question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: Phase I/Ib Study of Sarasar and Temodar in Patients with Recurrent or Temodar-Refractory Glioblastoma Multiforme
inclusion_criteria: Histologically proven supratentorial glioblastoma multiforme or gliosarcoma | Radiographic evidence of tumor recurrence or progression by MRI/CT after radiation therapy | Imaging within 14 days prior to registration with stable or decreasing steroid dose for >=5 days | Post-resection patients: >=2 weeks from surgery, recovered with adequate wound healing | Post-resection imaging: CT/MRI within 96 hours post-op or >=4 weeks post-op (within 14 days of registration) with stable steroids for 5 days | Karnofsky performance status >=60 | Recovered from prior therapy toxicities | Washouts: >=4 weeks from prior cytotoxic therapy; >=2 weeks from vincristine; >=6 weeks from nitrosoureas; >=3 weeks from procarbazine; >=1 week from non-cytotoxic agents
exclusion_criteria: Current use of enzyme-inducing anticonvulsants (primidone, carbamazepine, phenobarbital, phenytoin) or not off them for at least 72 hours prior to treatment | History of another cancer (except non-melanoma skin cancer or cervical carcinoma in situ) unless in complete remission and off all therapy for >=3 years | Uncontrolled active infection | Serious intercurrent medical illness or conditions that could obscure toxicity or alter drug metabolism | Any prior treatment with farnesyl transferase inhibitors | Prior recurrence while receiving a farnesyl transferase inhibitor | Use of oral contraceptives or other hormonal birth control methods (e.g., depot medroxyprogesterone)
prior_therapies: Prior temozolomide required; No prior farnesyl transferase inhibitor therapy allowed; Up to 2 prior chemotherapy regimens for recurrent/progressive disease allowed; Phase 1b expansion: at least 2 cycles of adjuvant temozolomide required; Washout: >=4 weeks from prior cytotoxic therapy; Washout: >=2 weeks from vincristine; Washout: >=6 weeks from nitrosoureas; Washout: >=3 weeks from procarbazine; Washout: >=1 week from non-cytotoxic agents
reasoning: Disease and setting match (recurrent GBM), and prior-exposure requirements are met (completed temozolomide after chemoradiation); age and sex are eligible with no stated disallowed therapies. Other details (e.g., supratentorial location, enzyme‑inducing anticonvulsants) are unknown but do not create a conflict from provided data.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Recurrent disease after standard therapy; ECOG 1; Age 40 years; Male; Prior gross total resection; Completed adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Completed adjuvant temozolomide
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Radiation therapy with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and recurrent setting match; prior temozolomide exposure requirement is satisfied. Age/sex fit. Other specifics (supratentorial location, washouts, EIAEDs) are unknown and not counted as soft mismatches per rubric. Thus ≥2 core anchors match (stage/setting and line/prior), supporting grade A.

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase I Study of Vorinostat (Suberoylanilide Hydroxamic Acid [SAHA]) in Combination With Temozolomide in Patients With Malignant Gliomas
diseases_targeted: Anaplastic Astrocytoma; Anaplastic Oligodendroglioma; Giant Cell Glioblastoma; Glioblastoma; Gliosarcoma; Mixed Glioma; Brain Neoplasm (recurrent)
inclusion_criteria: Histologically proven intracranial malignant glioma (glioblastoma, gliosarcoma, anaplastic astrocytoma, anaplastic oligodendroglioma, anaplastic mixed oligoastrocytoma, or malignant astrocytoma NOS); prior low-grade glioma allowed if subsequently malignant | Life expectancy > 8 weeks | Karnofsky performance status >= 60 | WBC >= 3,000/µL | ANC >= 1,500/µL | Platelet count >= 100,000/µL | Hemoglobin >= 10 g/dL (transfusion permitted to meet threshold) | AST (SGOT) < 2 x ULN | Bilirubin < 2 x ULN | Creatinine < 1.5 mg/dL | Baseline MRI or CT within 14 days on stable steroid dose >= 5 days; same modality used for follow-up; if steroids increased before registration, new baseline imaging required | Interval >= 3 weeks from completion of radiation therapy to study entry | Women of childbearing potential: negative pregnancy test within 7 days prior to registration | Women of childbearing potential and men agree to use adequate contraception during study | Willing to participate in pharmacokinetic studies | Part I: Stable disease after radiation therapy or progression eligible (unless progressed on temozolomide); prior relapses allowed | Recovered from prior therapy toxicities with required washouts (see prior therapies) | Post-resection eligibility: recovered from surgery; imaging within 96 hours post-op or >= 4 weeks post-op (within 14 days of registration) on stable steroids >= 5 days | Prior brachytherapy or stereotactic radiosurgery requires confirmation of true progression (PET or thallium scan, MR spectroscopy, or surgical documentation) | Part II: Only patients with stable disease after radiation therapy; no recurrent disease | Part II: Only prior therapy allowed is radiation alone or radiation with concomitant temozolomide; patients stable on adjuvant temozolomide may participate
exclusion_criteria: Progressed on temozolomide | Significant uncontrolled medical illness that would compromise therapy tolerance | History of other cancer within 3 years (except non-melanoma skin cancer or carcinoma in situ of the cervix) unless in complete remission and off therapy >= 3 years | Active infection | Pregnant | Breastfeeding (if treated with vorinostat; potential risks may also apply to temozolomide) | Any disease that would obscure toxicity assessment or dangerously alter drug metabolism | HIV positive receiving combination antiretroviral therapy | Receiving other investigational agents | Allergic reactions to vorinostat or compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition | Use of valproic acid within 2 weeks prior to enrollment
prior_therapies: >= 3 weeks since completion of radiation therapy; >= 28 days since any investigational agent; >= 28 days since prior cytotoxic therapy (>= 23 days since last standard 5/28 temozolomide); >= 14 days since vincristine; >= 42 days since nitrosoureas; >= 21 days since procarbazine; >= 7 days since non-cytotoxic agents (e.g., interferon, tamoxifen, thalidomide, cis-retinoic acid); Recent resection allowed if recovered from surgery and imaging criteria met; Prior interstitial brachytherapy or stereotactic radiosurgery allowed with confirmation of true progression; Part I: Prior relapses and prior temozolomide with stable disease allowed; progression on temozolomide not allowed; Part II: Only prior therapy permitted is radiation with or without concomitant temozolomide; adjuvant temozolomide allowed if stable; no other prior chemotherapies
reasoning: Disease and setting match recurrent glioblastoma, which is eligible in Part I. Prior RT with concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide is allowed, with no indication of progression on temozolomide; age and sex fit trial requirements.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Recurrent disease after standard therapy; ECOG 1; Age 40 years; Male; Prior gross total resection; Completed adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Completed adjuvant temozolomide
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Radiation therapy with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches glioblastoma. Stage/setting (recurrent) fits Part I. Prior RT+temozolomide is allowed and completion of adjuvant TMZ implies no progression on TMZ. ≥2 core anchors (stage/setting and prior-exposure compatibility) match; no soft conflicts. Grade A is appropriate.

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. After 5 months, she had a new pleural effusion that was cytology positive for ovarian carcinoma. She was found to be BRCA1 positive. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1/2 Trial of ABT-888, an Inhibitor of Poly(ADP-ribose) Polymerase (PARP), and Topotecan (TPT) in Patients With Solid Tumors (Phase 1) and Relapsed Ovarian Cancer or Primary Peritoneal Cancer (Phase 2) After Prior Platinum Containing First-Line Chemotherapy
diseases_targeted: Solid Tumor (metastatic); Solid Tumor (unresectable); Ovarian Cancer (recurrent); Fallopian Tube Cancer (recurrent); Primary Peritoneal Cancer (recurrent)
inclusion_criteria: Phase I: Histologically confirmed solid tumor that is metastatic or unresectable and lacks standard curative or life-extending therapy | Phase II: Biopsy-proven ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal cancer | Fewer than 3 prior lines of therapy and relapse less than 1 year from last platinum regimen | Measurable disease with at least one lesion >= 2.0 cm (conventional) or >= 1.0 cm (spiral CT) | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1500/µL | Hemoglobin >= 9.0 g/dL | Platelets >= 100,000/µL | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN | AST or ALT <= 2.5 x ULN (stricter general threshold) | Creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN | INR <= 1.4 unless on therapeutic warfarin | PTT <= 48 s | ECOG performance status 0-2 | Life expectancy >= 12 weeks | Negative pregnancy test for females of childbearing potential | Able to swallow and absorb oral medication
exclusion_criteria: Standard therapy exists that is potentially curative or capable of extending life expectancy | Prior treatment with a PARP inhibitor or topotecan | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina, cardiac arrhythmia, significant psychiatric illness) | Chemotherapy within 4 weeks | Mitomycin C or nitrosoureas within 6 weeks | Immunotherapy within 4 weeks | Biologic therapy within 4 weeks | Radiation therapy within 4 weeks | Radiation to > 25% of bone marrow | Investigational therapy within 4 weeks (hormone therapy for prostate cancer allowed) | Failure to recover from acute reversible effects of prior chemotherapy | NYHA class III or IV heart failure | Known CNS metastases or seizure disorder unless treated and stable >= 6 months without steroids and without seizures | Pregnant or nursing | Men or women of childbearing potential unwilling to use adequate contraception | Significant co-morbid systemic illness that would interfere with safety assessment | Immunocompromised state or known HIV positive | Receiving another investigational agent for the primary neoplasm | Other active malignancy except non-melanoma skin cancer or carcinoma in situ of the cervix | History of myocardial infarction within 6 months | Congestive heart failure requiring ongoing maintenance therapy for life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias | More than 2 prior chemotherapy regimens for the current malignancy
prior_therapies: < 3 prior lines of therapy and relapse < 1 year from last platinum regimen; No chemotherapy within 4 weeks prior to registration; No mitomycin C or nitrosoureas within 6 weeks prior to registration; No immunotherapy within 4 weeks prior to registration; No biologic therapy within 4 weeks prior to registration; No radiation therapy within 4 weeks prior to registration; No investigational therapy within 4 weeks prior to registration
reasoning: Disease and setting match (recurrent ovarian cancer after prior platinum), and prior therapy criteria are met (<3 lines, relapse <1 year; no prior PARP/topotecan). Age/sex align; measurable disease and lab/PS details are unknown and would need confirmation but are not hard exclusions.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; BRCA1 positive; Optimal debulking surgery performed; Received adjuvant carboplatin + paclitaxel + bevacizumab; Cytology-positive malignant pleural effusion at 5 months post-adjuvant
patient_prior_therapies: Carboplatin; Paclitaxel; Bevacizumab; Optimal debulking surgery
judge_comment: No hard exclusions identified. Disease matches (recurrent ovarian cancer). Stage/setting aligns (relapsed within 1 year of platinum), and line/prior exposure criteria match (<3 prior lines; no prior PARP/topotecan). Other requirements (measurable disease, labs) are unknown and not treated as hard exclusions per rubric. Thus ≥2 core anchors match without soft conflicts → A.

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase I Study of Oral Carboxyamidotriazole Orotate (CTO) Titrated as a Single Agent in Patients With Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors and Titrated in Combination Therapy With Temodar® for Patients With Glioblastoma and Other Recurrent Malignant Gliomas or in Combination With Temodar® and Radiation Therapy for Patients With Newly Diagnosed Glioblastoma and Malignant Gliomas
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed advanced or metastatic solid tumor refractory to or without standard therapy (Arm A) | Measurable disease per RECIST 1.1 (Arm A) | Received prior anticancer therapy or not eligible for established conventional therapy (Arm A) | Recovered from acute adverse effects of prior therapies to baseline or <= grade 1 (all applicable arms) | ECOG performance status 0–2 (all arms) | Age >= 18 years (all arms) | Adequate bone marrow, renal, and hepatic function (see labs) (Arm A) | Life expectancy >= 12 weeks (Arm A) | Histologically proven malignant glioblastoma or other recurrent malignant gliomas (Arm B) | Measurable tumor on gadolinium-enhanced MRI (Arm B) | Life expectancy >= 8 weeks (Arm B) | Unequivocal radiographic progression by MRI within 14 days; on stable steroid dose >= 5 days or new baseline MRI if dose increased (Arm B) | Postoperative eligibility if recovered from surgery and residual disease assessed by MRI within required windows (Arm B) | Prior radiation therapy with or without chemotherapy and progressed; interval >= 12 weeks from completion of radiation to registration (Arm B) | On stable dose of non–CYP3A4-inhibiting/inducing antiepileptic drugs for >= 2 weeks with no seizures at registration (Arms B and C) | Histologically proven newly diagnosed glioblastoma or other malignant gliomas (Arm C) | Life expectancy >= 8 weeks (Arm C) | MRI within 14 days prior to registration; on stable steroid dose >= 5 days or new baseline MRI if dose increased (Arm C)
exclusion_criteria: Prior chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, radiation therapy, or biologic therapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for mitomycin C or nitrosoureas); for targeted therapy, < 5 half-lives or < 28 days (whichever is shorter) (Arms A and B) | For Arm B, shorter washouts allowed: 14 days vincristine; 21 days procarbazine; 7 days for non-cytotoxic agents (interferon, tamoxifen, thalidomide, cis-retinoic acid) | Any concomitant condition compromising study objectives/compliance or ability to tolerate therapy (e.g., CHF, uncontrolled angina, MI within 1 year, uncontrolled hypertension, dysrhythmias, active infection, unstable diabetes, psychiatric disorder) (all arms) | Pregnant or breastfeeding (all arms) | Another malignancy within 3 years except curatively treated non-melanoma skin cancer or carcinoma in situ of cervix or breast not requiring further treatment (all arms) | Known HIV, HBV, or HCV infection (all arms) | Underlying diagnosis/disease state with increased risk of bleeding (all arms) | Central nervous system metastases, leptomeningeal disease, brain involvement, or seizure disorder (Arm A) | Uncontrolled seizure activity (Arms B and C) | Treatment with known CYP3A4 inhibitors or inducers (all arms) | No prior chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, or biologic therapy for gliomas (Arm C) | Anaplastic oligodendroglioma with 1p/19q deletion or unknown 1p/19q status (Arm C)
prior_therapies: Prior anticancer therapy allowed or ineligible for standard therapy (Arm A); Washout >= 4 weeks from prior chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, radiation therapy, or biologic therapy (>= 6 weeks for mitomycin C or nitrosoureas) (Arms A and B); For prior targeted therapy, washout >= 5 half-lives or 28 days (whichever is shorter) (Arms A and B); Shorter washouts permitted in Arm B: 14 days vincristine; 21 days procarbazine; 7 days non-cytotoxic agents (interferon, tamoxifen, thalidomide, cis-retinoic acid); Prior radiation therapy required with progression; >= 12 weeks since completion of radiation (Arm B); No prior chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, or biologic therapy for gliomas (Arm C); Recovery to baseline or <= grade 1 from prior therapy adverse effects before enrollment (all arms)
reasoning: Recurrent glioblastoma after radiation+temozolomide fits the trial’s Arm B for recurrent malignant gliomas; age 40 and ECOG 1 meet general eligibility. Required details like MRI/progression timing, washouts, steroid/AED status, and labs are unknown but pose no identified conflicts.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Recurrent disease after standard therapy; ECOG 1; Age 40 years; Male; Prior gross total resection; Completed adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Completed adjuvant temozolomide
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Radiation therapy with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches Arm B (recurrent GBM). Stage/setting matches (recurrent post standard therapy) and prior-exposure compatibility matches (prior RT±TMZ allowed/required). Other required details (MRI timing, washouts, steroids/AEDs) are unknown, not mismatches. Thus ≥2 core anchors match with no soft conflicts → A.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: Adoptive Transfer of Autologous T Cells Targeted to Prostate Specific Membrane Antigen (PSMA) for the Treatment of Castrate Metastatic Prostate Cancer (CMPC)
inclusion_criteria: Male, age >= 18 years | Karnofsky >= 70% | Histologic confirmation of prostate cancer at MSKCC | Progressive castrate metastatic prostate cancer | Soft tissue progression per RECIST 1.0 | Bone disease progression per PCWG2 with >= 2 new lesions on bone scan | Rising PSA on >= 3 successive determinations >= 2 weeks apart meeting protocol thresholds (and evidence of metastases present) | PSA rise timing after anti-androgen discontinuation: within 2 weeks if second-line therapy | PSA rise timing after anti-androgen discontinuation: after 4 weeks if first-line therapy | Evidence of metastatic disease on imaging (bone scan, CT, and/or MRI) at any time after initial diagnosis | Castrate serum testosterone < 50 ng/mL achieved by prior orchiectomy or LHRH agonist with or without anti-androgen | WBC >= 3000/µL | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1500/µL | Platelets >= 100000/µL | Hemoglobin >= 10 g/dL | Bilirubin < 1.5 x ULN (Gilbert's permitted) | ALT < 2.5 x ULN | AST < 2.5 x ULN | Creatinine < 1.5 x ULN | Negative screening for HIV, HBV antigen, and HCV
exclusion_criteria: History of non-prostate primary malignant cancer (except non-melanoma skin cancer) within 5 years | History of splenectomy | Autoimmune or antibody-mediated disease (e.g., SLE, rheumatoid arthritis, ulcerative colitis, Crohn's disease, temporal arteritis, thyroiditis) | Clinically significant cardiac disease (NYHA Class III/IV) or severe debilitating pulmonary disease | Radiation therapy within 4 weeks prior to Day -1 | More than one prior chemotherapy regimen | Use within 4 weeks before Week 1: systemic radiopharmaceuticals (e.g., samarium-153), hematopoietic growth factors other than erythropoietin, medroxyprogesterone as appetite stimulant, or alternative prostate cancer treatments (e.g., Prostasol, saw palmetto, Zyflamend) | Active CNS or symptomatic epidural metastatic disease | Infection requiring antibiotics within 7 days of Day -1 | Requirement for daily systemic corticosteroids or other immunosuppressive/immunomodulatory agents (topical/nasal/physiologic steroids permitted) | Live attenuated vaccines within 8 weeks prior to Day -1 and throughout the study | Subunit or killed vaccines within 2 weeks prior to Day -1 and throughout the study (influenza vaccination permitted between Week 12–16 and after Week 20) | Positive stool guaiac (excluding hemorrhoids or documented radiation-induced proctitis if tested) | Participation in a therapeutic study or receipt of an investigational drug within 4 weeks of leukapheresis | Allergy to ganciclovir or acyclovir
prior_therapies: Prior orchiectomy or LHRH agonist to achieve castrate testosterone required; If anti-androgen discontinued: document PSA rise within 2 weeks (second-line) or after 4 weeks (first-line) before enrollment; Washout: radiation therapy >= 4 weeks before Day -1; Washout: systemic radiopharmaceuticals, non-erythropoietin hematopoietic growth factors, medroxyprogesterone as appetite stimulant, and alternative prostate cancer treatments >= 4 weeks before Week 1; Washout: live attenuated vaccines >= 8 weeks before Day -1; subunit/killed vaccines >= 2 weeks before Day -1; Washout: investigational drug >= 4 weeks before leukapheresis
reasoning: Male age 66 with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer, PSMA-positive, and progression after enzalutamide matches the trial’s setting. Prior LHRH therapy aligns with requirements and no explicit exclusions are identified from the available data.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male; Castration-resistant prostate cancer; Metastatic disease; PSMA PET avid disease; Liver metastases; Bone metastases; Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga); Prior leuprolide (Lupron)
judge_comment: Disease and setting match (metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer). Line/prior exposure is compatible (prior LHRH and AR-targeted therapy allowed; no chemo listed). PSMA-positive aligns with likely target. No hard exclusions identified from provided data. ≥2 core anchors match without soft conflicts, so A is appropriate.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: An Early Phase 1 Study of ABT-888 in Combination With Carboplatin and Paclitaxel in Patients With Hepatic or Renal Dysfunction and Solid Tumors
diseases_targeted: Breast Cancer; Carcinoma of Unknown Primary; Endometrial Cancer; Esophageal Cancer; Lung Cancer; Head and Neck Cancer; Testicular Cancer; Melanoma; Ovarian Cancer; Urothelial Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed metastatic or unresectable malignancy with expected responsiveness to carboplatin/paclitaxel | ECOG <=2 | Life expectancy >12 weeks | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1,500/µL | Platelets >= 100,000/µL | Hemoglobin >= 8.0 g/dL | All degrees of renal dysfunction allowed, including hemodialysis | Mild to severe hepatic dysfunction allowed | Total bilirubin <= 5 x ULN | AST and ALT <= 10 x ULN | For patients with biliary stent: stable labs within hepatic group from two readings 3 days apart, taken >=10 days after stent placement; no obstruction within last 2 months if stent placed >2 months ago
exclusion_criteria: Chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) or unresolved toxicities from prior therapy | Concurrent treatment with other investigational agents | Allergy to veliparib or compounds of similar chemical/biologic composition or to study agents | Peripheral neuropathy > grade 1 | Inability to take oral medications continuously | Bleeding diathesis | Active or unstable CNS metastases or requirement for steroid treatment | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina, significant arrhythmia, psychiatric illness limiting compliance) | Pregnant or breastfeeding | HIV-positive on combination antiretroviral therapy with potential for PK interactions | Concurrent hepatic and renal dysfunction | Progressed on prior carboplatin plus paclitaxel therapy | Active seizure or history of seizure disorder
prior_therapies: Prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy allowed with washout >=4 weeks (>=6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C); Prior veliparib permitted
reasoning: Disease matches (urothelial carcinoma) and the metastatic setting fits the trial; prior therapies are compatible since the patient has not progressed on carboplatin/paclitaxel, and renal dysfunction is allowed. No hard exclusions are triggered, though standard requirements (e.g., ECOG ≤2 and washout ≥4 weeks) are not specified.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial carcinoma; Progressing after second line therapy; Prior neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin (4 cycles); Prior enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab with progression after 6 cycles; Status post cystectomy with pathologic complete response; Age 55 years; Male; Chronic kidney disease with eGFR 35 mL/min; History of type 2 diabetes mellitus; History of COPD
patient_prior_therapies: Neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin; Cystectomy; Enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions apply. Disease matches (urothelial carcinoma included). Stage/setting matches (metastatic/unresectable allowed). Line/prior exposure compatible (no prior carboplatin/paclitaxel progression; prior therapies allowed with washout unknown). No required biomarkers. No identified soft conflicts. Meets ≥2 core anchors → A.

trial_title: A Phase I Trial of Bevacizumab, Temsirolimus Alone and in Combination With Valproic Acid, or Cetuximab in Patients With Advanced Malignancy and Other Indications
diseases_targeted: Advanced Malignant Neoplasm; Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm; Recurrent Malignant Neoplasm; Refractory Malignant Neoplasm; Lymphangioleiomyomatosis; Neurofibromatosis Type 2; Erdheim-Chester Disease; Castleman Disease
inclusion_criteria: Advanced or metastatic cancer refractory to standard therapy, relapsed after standard therapy, or without effective standard therapy | Relentlessly progressive benign diseases eligible: lymphangioleiomyomatosis, neurofibromatosis type 2, Erdheim-Chester disease, Castleman disease | >= 4 weeks since last therapeutic radiation or cytotoxic chemotherapy or antibody therapy | >= 5 half-lives since last non-cytotoxic targeted or biologic therapy | Palliative radiation allowed if not to the only target lesion | ECOG performance status <=2 | Karnofsky >= 60% | Lansky >= 60% (for participants <=16 years) | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1,000/µL | Platelets >= 50,000/µL | Creatinine <= 3 x ULN | Total bilirubin <= 3.0 mg/dL | AST <= 5 x ULN | ALT <= 5 x ULN | Fasting total cholesterol <= 350 mg/dL | Triglycerides <= 400 mg/dL
exclusion_criteria: Clinically significant unexplained bleeding within 28 days prior to enrollment | Uncontrolled hypertension (systolic blood pressure > 140 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure > 90 mmHg on medication) | History of cerebrovascular accident within 6 months | Myocardial infarction within 6 months | Unstable angina or unstable angina pectoris | Pregnant or breast-feeding | Hypersensitivity to bevacizumab or murine products or any component of its formulation | Hypersensitivity to temsirolimus, sirolimus, polysorbate 80, or any component of its formulation | Hypersensitivity to cetuximab, murine products, or any component of its formulation | Concurrent use of CYP3A4 inducers or inhibitors | Colorectal cancer with known KRAS mutation (for cetuximab-containing arm) | Major surgery within 6 weeks of enrollment | Receiving other investigational agents or other concurrent anticancer agents or therapies
prior_therapies: >= 4-week washout from therapeutic radiation, cytotoxic chemotherapy, or antibody therapy; >= 5 half-life washout from non-cytotoxic targeted or biologic therapy; Palliative radiation permitted if not to the only target lesion
reasoning: The basket Phase I trial includes advanced/recurrent malignancies, matching this patient’s recurrent glioblastoma after standard therapy (stage/setting and prior-therapy criteria align), and ECOG 1 is within the allowed ≤2. patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Radiation therapy with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide

Core anchors: Stage/setting (recurrent after standard therapy) matches; Line/prior-exposure (post-standard therapy with washout possible) matches. No required biomarkers or mets pattern constraints. question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. trial_title: A Dual Phase 1/2, Investigator Initiated Study to Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose, Safety, and Efficacy of 186Rhenium Nanoliposomes (186RNL) in Recurrent Glioma (CTRC# 12-02)
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Histologically confirmed recurrent Grade III/IV glioma (e.g., Astrocytoma, IDH-mutant grade 3 or 4; Glioblastoma, IDH-wildtype grade 4) | Disease progression by RANO or other accepted neuro-oncology criteria after standard treatment options with known survival benefit for any recurrence, or medically unable/unwilling to receive them | Stable dose of antiepileptic medication for >= 2 weeks without seizures prior to dosing (if on antiepileptics) | Corticosteroid dose stable or decreasing for >= 2 weeks without symptom progression prior to dosing (if on corticosteroids) | Tumor within the treatment field volume | ECOG performance status 0–2 | Karnofsky Performance Status >= 60% | Life expectancy >= 2 months | Bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN | AST <= 3.0 x ULN | ALT <= 3.0 x ULN | Serum creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN | ANC >= 1000/µL (without hematologic support) | Platelet count >= 100000/µL (without hematologic support) | Hemoglobin >= 9.0 g/dL (without hematologic support)
exclusion_criteria: Acute intracranial or intratumoral hemorrhage on MRI or CT (resolving changes/punctate/hemosiderin allowed) | Contraindication or inability to undergo MRI | Not recovered to CTCAE v4.0 Grade <= 1 from prior therapy-related adverse events (except alopecia, anemia, lymphopenia) | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Uncontrolled hypertension (>150/100 mmHg on two readings) despite optimal mitomycin C within 42 days prior to dosing | Metronomic/protracted low-dose chemotherapy within 14 days prior to dosing | Other cytotoxic chemotherapy within 28 days prior to dosing | Prior treatment with carmustine wafers | Receipt of another investigational agent within 28 days prior to dosing or currently receiving investigational therapy | Multifocal progression or leptomeningeal involvement | question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. exclusion_criteria: Receipt of other investigational agents or additional anti-cancer agents | Endometrial carcinosarcoma | Ovarian cancer histology other than high-grade serous without a deleterious BRCA mutation | Recurrences amenable to potentially curative radiation therapy or surgery | History of other malignancy within 5 years except adequately treated basal/squamous skin cancer or in situ cervical cancer (dual primaries of endometrial, ovarian, or breast cancer allowed) | History of myelodysplastic syndrome | Symptomatic, uncontrolled spinal cord compression and/or brain metastases | Prior chemotherapy, biologic therapy, radiation therapy, androgens, thalidomide, immunotherapy, other anticancer agents, or investigational agents within 28 days before starting study treatment (palliative focal RT excepted as noted) | Prohibited corticosteroids within 14 days prior to starting study treatment | Major surgery within 28 days or minor surgery within 2 weeks prior to study entry, or not recovered from surgery | QTcF >= 470 ms at 2 or more time points within 24 hours or family history of long QT syndrome | Blood transfusion required within 28 days prior to study start | Receipt of hematopoietic growth factors (e.g., G-CSF, GM-CSF) within 2 weeks prior to study start | Concomitant prohibited medications/substances within specified washout periods | Known hypersensitivity to olaparib, capivasertib (AZD5363), vistusertib (AZD2014), or their excipients; or to drugs of similar class | Intolerable adverse events to prior PARP, mTOR, PI3K, or AKT inhibitors per investigator | Within 12 months: CABG, angioplasty, vascular stent, myocardial infarction, angina pectoris, CHF NYHA >= 2, ventricular arrhythmias requiring continuous therapy, uncontrolled supraventricular arrhythmias including atrial fibrillation, hemorrhagic or thrombotic stroke including TIA or other CNS bleeding | Abnormal ECHO or MUGA with LVEF < 50% | Torsades de pointes within 12 months | Uncontrolled hypotension (SBP < 90 mmHg and/or DBP < 50 mmHg) | Proteinuria (>= 3+ dipstick or 300 mg/dL on urinalysis or > 500 mg/24 hours) | Type I diabetes or uncontrolled type II diabetes (HbA1c > 8%) | Severe or uncontrolled systemic disease (e.g., severe hepatic impairment, interstitial lung disease, uncontrolled chronic renal disease), unstable/uncompensated respiratory or cardiac conditions, uncontrolled hypertension (>= 140/90), active bleeding diathesis, or active infection including hepatitis B, hepatitis C, or HIV | Investigator deems patient unsuitable or unlikely to comply | FOR EXPANSION PHASE ONLY: No accessible tumor for biopsy | No archival tumor specimens available
prior_therapies: Unlimited prior chemotherapy allowed; Prior PARP inhibitor allowed if not discontinued for toxicity (progression allowed); Prior mTOR inhibitor allowed if not discontinued for toxicity (progression allowed); Prior AKT inhibitor allowed if not discontinued for toxicity (progression allowed); Frontline therapy for metastatic disease permitted; No anticancer therapy or investigational agents within 28 days before study start; No prohibited corticosteroids within 14 days before study start; No hematopoietic growth factors within 14 days before study start; No major surgery within 28 days or minor surgery within 2 weeks before study start
reasoning: Recurrent clear cell ovarian cancer with BRCA1 positivity fits the trial cohort for deleterious BRCA-mutant recurrent ovarian cancer; the patient (female, 36) has assessable disease via pleural effusion. Prior carbo/taxol/bevacizumab is permitted and no exclusionary factors are evident.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; BRCA1 positive; Optimal debulking surgery performed; Received adjuvant carboplatin + paclitaxel + bevacizumab; Cytology-positive malignant pleural effusion at 5 months post-adjuvant
patient_prior_therapies: Carboplatin; Paclitaxel; Bevacizumab; Optimal debulking surgery
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches (recurrent ovarian cancer cohort with BRCA). Stage/setting matches (recurrent), line/prior exposure compatible (adjuvant carbo/taxol/bev allowed), and biomarker requirement appears satisfied (BRCA1 positive for the BRCA-mutant ovarian cohort). No soft conflicts identified. Grade A is appropriate.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: Addition of Pembrolizumab Upon Progression on Enzalutamide in Men With mCRPC
inclusion_criteria: Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer progressing on enzalutamide after initial response | Histologically or cytologically confirmed prostate adenocarcinoma (no pure small cell) | Age >= 18 years | Metastatic disease | Lesion amenable to biopsy | ECOG performance status 0–1 | ANC >= 1,500/µL within 28 days of treatment initiation | Platelets >= 100,000/µL within 28 days of treatment initiation | Hemoglobin >= 9 g/dL within 28 days of treatment initiation | Serum creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN or creatinine clearance >= 60 mL/min within 28 days of treatment initiation | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN or direct bilirubin <= ULN within 28 days of treatment initiation | AST <= 2.5 x ULN (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastases) within 28 days of treatment initiation | ALT <= 2.5 x ULN (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastases) within 28 days of treatment initiation | INR or PT <= 1.5 x ULN unless on therapeutic anticoagulation (if undergoing biopsy) within 28 days of treatment initiation | aPTT <= 1.5 x ULN unless on therapeutic anticoagulation (if undergoing biopsy) within 28 days of treatment initiation | PSA or radiographic progression on enzalutamide per RECIST 1.1 or >= 2 new bone lesions | Prior surgical castration or ongoing LHRH agonist/antagonist with serum testosterone < 50 ng/dL and agreement to continue LHRH therapy
exclusion_criteria: Participation in another investigational study or use of an investigational device within 4 weeks before first dose | Immunodeficiency or systemic steroid/immunosuppressive therapy within 7 days before first dose (physiologic corticosteroid doses may be permitted) | Prior monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks before day 1 or unresolved toxicities > grade 1 from prior therapies; denosumab prohibited within 4 weeks before day 1 and on study | Prior chemotherapy for castration-resistant disease | Prior chemotherapy, targeted small molecule therapy, or radiation within 2 weeks before day 1 or unresolved toxicities > grade 1 (<= grade 2 neuropathy allowed) | Major surgery without adequate recovery before starting therapy | Another active malignancy requiring treatment (except certain skin cancers or in situ bladder cancer after curative therapy) | Known brain metastases or carcinomatous meningitis | History of seizure | Allergy to enzalutamide | Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment within the past 3 months or history of clinically severe autoimmune disease requiring systemic therapy (exceptions: vitiligo, resolved childhood asthma/atopy, stable hypothyroidism on replacement, Sjogren's syndrome) | History of non-infectious pneumonitis requiring steroids or current pneumonitis | Active infection requiring systemic therapy | Prior therapy with PD-1, PD-L1, PD-L2, CD137, or CTLA-4 inhibitors | Plans to receive cytotoxic chemotherapy, immune checkpoint inhibitors, sipuleucel-T, radiopharmaceuticals, abiraterone, or other experimental therapy during the study | Known HIV infection | Active hepatitis B or active hepatitis C infection | Receipt of a live vaccine within 30 days before first dose | Rapidly progressive visceral disease making the patient a candidate for docetaxel per treating physician judgment
prior_therapies: Prior enzalutamide with initial response followed by progression; Prior surgical castration or ongoing LHRH agonist/antagonist therapy
reasoning: Male age 66 with metastatic castration‑resistant prostate cancer and documented progression on enzalutamide after prior LHRH therapy matches the stage/setting and prior‑exposure requirements; no disallowed prior chemotherapy or checkpoint inhibitors are reported. Some elements (initial response to enzalutamide, biopsy‑amenable lesion, ECOG/labs) are unknown but not conflicting.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male; Castration-resistant prostate cancer; Metastatic disease; PSMA PET avid disease; Liver metastases; Bone metastases; Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga); Prior leuprolide (Lupron)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions identified. Stage/setting (mCRPC) clearly matches. However, the line/prior-exposure anchor is not a clear match because the trial requires progression on enzalutamide after initial response and ongoing LHRH therapy—both are unknown. Histology (adenocarcinoma) and metastatic pattern constraints (no brain mets) are also unknown. That yields exactly 1 core anchor match, so grade B. The grader over-counted the line/prior anchor and gave A.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 2, Two-arm Multicenter, Open-Label Study to Determine the Efficacy and the Safety of Two Different Dose Regimens of a Pan-FGFR Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor JNJ-42756493 in Subjects With Metastatic or Surgically Unresectable Urothelial Cancer With FGFR Genomic Alterations
inclusion_criteria: Histologic metastatic or surgically unresectable urothelial cancer; minor variant histology allowed | Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1 | ECOG performance status 0–2 | Adequate bone marrow, liver, and renal function | Negative pregnancy test for women of childbearing potential | Disease progression per RECIST v1.1 after prior chemotherapy for metastatic or unresectable disease | Neoadjuvant or adjuvant chemotherapy with recurrence/progression within 12 months of last dose counts as metastatic setting | Prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy with progression also eligible
exclusion_criteria: Systemic anticancer therapy (chemotherapy, targeted therapy) within 2 weeks before first dose (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) | Immunotherapy within 4 weeks before first dose | Definitive radiotherapy within 2 weeks before first dose (localized palliative RT allowed; not to target lesions) | Persistent serum phosphate > ULN during screening despite medical management | History of or current uncontrolled cardiovascular disease | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Planning to conceive during study or within 3 months (female) or 5 months (male) after last dose | Not recovered from reversible toxicities of prior anticancer therapy (except nonclinically significant toxicities such as alopecia, skin discoloration, or Grade 1 neuropathy)
prior_therapies: Prior chemotherapy for metastatic or unresectable urothelial cancer with progression required; Neoadjuvant or adjuvant chemotherapy with recurrence/progression within 12 months qualifies as prior chemotherapy in the metastatic setting; Prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy allowed
reasoning: Disease and setting match (metastatic urothelial carcinoma), and the patient has progressed after anti–PD-1 therapy, satisfying prior-exposure requirements; age and sex also fit. The trial requires an FGFR alteration, which is unknown here (not a hard exclusion), and other eligibility labs/timing are not specified.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial carcinoma; Progressing after second line therapy; Prior neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin (4 cycles); Prior enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab with progression after 6 cycles; Status post cystectomy with pathologic complete response; Age 55 years; Male; Chronic kidney disease with eGFR 35 mL/min; History of type 2 diabetes mellitus; History of COPD
patient_prior_therapies: Neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin; Cystectomy; Enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Stage/setting matches. However, the trial requires prior chemotherapy for metastatic/unresectable disease (or adjuvant/neoadjuvant with relapse ≤12 months), which is not established here—progression after anti–PD-1 does not meet that requirement—so Line/prior is unknown, not a match. Required FGFR alteration is unknown, so cannot be counted as a match and also prevents an A. With exactly one anchor match and no soft conflicts, the correct grade is B.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase I Two-Dimensional Dose-Finding Study of Ixazomib in Combination With Gemcitabine and Doxorubicin, Followed by a Phase II Extension to Assess the Efficacy of This Combination in Metastatic, Surgically Unresectable Urothelial Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed metastatic or locally unresectable urothelial (transitional cell) carcinoma; variant histology allowed with urothelial component | Measurable or evaluable disease | At least one prior therapy unless not candidates for or refuse cisplatin-based therapy | Phase I: any number of prior regimens allowed | Phase II: no prior proteasome inhibitor (e.g., bortezomib, carfilzomib) and no prior gemcitabine >= 800 mg/m^2 plus doxorubicin >= 30 mg/m^2 in the same regimen | Prior neoadjuvant chemotherapy failure eligible | If prior ischemic heart disease or >= 200 mg/m^2 prior doxorubicin, left ventricular ejection fraction >= 45% | ALT <= 3 x ULN | AST <= 3 x ULN | ECOG performance status <= 2; PS 3 allowed if due to malignancy
exclusion_criteria: Platelet count < 100 x 10^9/L | Absolute neutrophil count < 1.0 x 10^9/L | Creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min | Peripheral neuropathy >= grade 3 or grade 2 with pain | Total bilirubin >= 1.5 x ULN | Allergy to study drugs or excipients | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Participation in other investigational trials within 30 days | Myocardial infarction within 6 months, NYHA class III/IV heart failure, uncontrolled angina, severe uncontrolled ventricular arrhythmias, acute ischemia or active conduction abnormalities | Symptomatic congestive heart failure | Claudication limiting activity | Cerebrovascular event within the last year (including TIA) | Unstable angina | Active brain metastases (previously treated and stable allowed) | Radiotherapy within 28 days (14 days if small field) | Another malignancy within 2 years unless meeting specified exceptions | Strong CYP1A2/3A inhibitors or strong CYP3A inducers within 14 days of first ixazomib dose; use of Ginkgo biloba or St. John's wort | Not recovered to <= grade 1 from prior chemotherapy toxicities | Major surgery within 14 days | Infection requiring current IV antibiotics | Active systemic infection, active hepatitis B or C, or HIV positive | Serious medical or psychiatric illness interfering with protocol treatment | GI disease or procedure interfering with oral absorption of ixazomib
prior_therapies: At least one prior systemic therapy required unless cisplatin-ineligible or refuse cisplatin-based therapy; Phase I: any number of prior regimens permitted, including prior bortezomib or gemcitabine+doxorubicin; Phase II: exclude prior proteasome inhibitor therapy and exclude prior combination gemcitabine >= 800 mg/m^2 plus doxorubicin >= 30 mg/m^2; Prior neoadjuvant chemotherapy allowed; Radiotherapy washout: >= 28 days (>= 14 days if small field); Other investigational agents washout: >= 30 days; Major surgery washout: >= 14 days; Recovered to <= grade 1 from prior chemotherapy toxicities before enrollment
reasoning: Metastatic urothelial carcinoma matches the trial setting, and prior therapies are compatible (≥1 prior regimen; no proteasome inhibitor or gemcitabine+doxorubicin exposure). No explicit exclusions are evident; age/sex fit and renal function (eGFR 35 mL/min) is above the trial’s CrCl ≥30 mL/min cutoff.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial carcinoma; Progressing after second line therapy; Prior neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin (4 cycles); Prior enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab with progression after 6 cycles; Status post cystectomy with pathologic complete response; Age 55 years; Male; Chronic kidney disease with eGFR 35 mL/min; History of type 2 diabetes mellitus; History of COPD
patient_prior_therapies: Neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin; Cystectomy; Enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches (metastatic UC). Stage/setting matches (metastatic/unresectable allowed). Line/prior exposure compatible (≥1 prior regimen; no prior proteasome inhibitor or gemcitabine+doxorubicin combo). Age/sex OK. Renal function above CrCl ≥30 mL/min cutoff. No identified soft conflicts. Grade A is appropriate.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: Phase I/II Study of the Anti-Programmed Death Ligand-1 Antibody Durvalumab (MEDI4736) in Combination With Olaparib and/or Cediranib for Advanced Solid Tumors and Advanced or Recurrent Ovarian, Triple Negative Breast, Lung, Prostate and Colorectal Cancers
diseases_targeted: Solid Tumor; Ovarian Cancer; Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer; Small Cell Lung Cancer; Prostate Cancer (metastatic castrate-resistant); Triple Negative Breast Cancer; Colorectal Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Adequately controlled blood pressure on <= 3 antihypertensive medications | Phase I: Advanced or recurrent solid tumor | ECOG performance status 0–2 | Adequate organ and marrow function | Off prior chemotherapy, radiation therapy, or biologic therapy >= 3 weeks | Ovarian/fallopian tube/primary peritoneal cancer: persistent or recurrent disease with >= 2 prior regimens or platinum-resistant/refractory after first platinum | Ovarian/fallopian tube/primary peritoneal cancer: at least one lesion safe to biopsy and willing to undergo mandatory baseline biopsy | Ovarian cancer: prior PARP inhibitor and/or prior anti-angiogenesis therapy allowed (but not both olaparib and cediranib previously) | Triple negative breast cancer: histologically confirmed persistent or recurrent TNBC | Triple negative breast cancer: ER/PR/HER2 status documented | Triple negative breast cancer: documentation of germline BRCA1/2 mutation status required | Triple negative breast cancer: measurable disease per RECIST v1.1 | Triple negative breast cancer: at least one lesion safe to biopsy and willing to undergo mandatory baseline biopsy | NSCLC: histologically or cytologically confirmed advanced disease with >= 1 prior line of platinum-based chemotherapy or appropriate targeted therapy for EGFR/ALK/BRAF alterations | NSCLC: measurable disease per RECIST v1.1 | NSCLC: at least one lesion safe to biopsy and willing to undergo mandatory baseline biopsy | mCRPC: metastatic, progressive, castrate-resistant prostate cancer | mCRPC: at least one lesion safe to biopsy and willing to undergo mandatory baseline biopsy | mCRPC: prior treatment with enzalutamide and/or abiraterone (exceptions for prior docetaxel with ADT in castrate-sensitive disease as specified) | mCRPC: ongoing GnRH agonist/antagonist therapy or prior bilateral orchiectomy | SCLC: advanced or recurrent disease eligible for Durvalumab + olaparib cohort | CRC: advanced or recurrent colorectal cancer eligible for Durvalumab + cediranib cohort
exclusion_criteria: Cardiac events within 1 year: myocardial infarction, pericardial effusion, or myocarditis | Cardiac arrhythmia (e.g., atrial fibrillation or flutter) or need for pro-arrhythmic drugs/biologics within 1 year | NYHA Class II or greater heart failure | Left ventricular ejection fraction < 55% or below institutional normal if assessed | QTc > 470 ms or other significant ECG abnormality within 14 days of treatment | Hypertensive crisis or hypertensive encephalopathy | Clinically significant peripheral or vascular disease, including rapidly growing aortic aneurysm, abdominal aortic aneurysm > 5 cm, or aortic dissection | Unstable angina | Cerebrovascular accident or transient ischemic attack within 1 year | History of tuberculosis | Autoimmune disease requiring steroid maintenance or primary immunodeficiency | HIV-positive on antiretroviral therapy ineligible unless long-standing (> 5 years), undetectable viral load, CD4 > 150/µL, and no anticipated drug-drug interactions per PI | HBV-positive or HCV-positive due to risk of viral reactivation | History of severe allergic reactions to MEDI4736 (durvalumab), olaparib, cediranib, other humanized monoclonal antibodies, or similar compounds; history of anaphylaxis, angioedema, laryngeal edema, serum sickness, or uncontrolled asthma | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Any other concomitant or prior invasive malignancy | NSCLC: prior treatment with cediranib (monotherapy or combination) not eligible | NSCLC: current or prior immunosuppressive medication within 28 days before first durvalumab dose (except allowed low-dose steroids and inhaled/intranasal corticosteroids) | NSCLC: prior history of pneumonitis and/or interstitial lung disease | NSCLC: prior PARP inhibitor not eligible | Triple negative breast cancer: prior PARP inhibitor not eligible | Triple negative breast cancer: CNS metastasis or leptomeningeal disease within 1 year | mCRPC: progression on prior docetaxel for castrate-sensitive disease | mCRPC: prior PARP inhibitor not eligible | mCRPC: radionuclide treatment within 6 weeks prior to first dose | Ovarian cancer: prior treatment with both olaparib and cediranib (combination or sequentially) not eligible
prior_therapies: Phase II Ovarian cancer: >= 2 prior regimens or platinum-resistant/refractory after first platinum; Ovarian cancer: prior PARP inhibitor allowed; Ovarian cancer: prior anti-angiogenesis therapy allowed; NSCLC: at least one prior line of platinum-based chemotherapy or prior EGFR/ALK/BRAF-targeted therapy when indicated by tumor genotype; mCRPC: prior treatment with enzalutamide and/or abiraterone required (with specified exceptions); mCRPC: continue GnRH agonist/antagonist therapy during study; All cohorts: washout from prior chemotherapy, radiation therapy, or biologic therapy >= 3 weeks
reasoning: Matches the mCRPC cohort: metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer with prior abiraterone and progression on enzalutamide; age and sex appropriate. No explicit exclusions (e.g., prior PARP or prohibited therapies) are evident.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male; Castration-resistant prostate cancer; Metastatic disease; PSMA PET avid disease; Liver metastases; Bone metastases; Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga); Prior leuprolide (Lupron)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches mCRPC cohort. Stage/setting (metastatic CRPC) and line/prior exposure (prior abiraterone and enzalutamide) both match, satisfying ≥2 core anchors. Other requirements (e.g., ongoing GnRH, biopsy willingness) are unknown and not soft conflicts per rubric. Grade A is appropriate.

He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1 Study of Cabozantinib Plus Nivolumab (CaboNivo) Alone or in Combination With Ipilimumab (CaboNivoIpi) in Patients With Advanced/Metastatic Urothelial Carcinoma and Other Genitourinary Tumors
diseases_targeted: Urothelial Carcinoma (bladder); Urethral Urothelial Carcinoma; Ureter Urothelial Carcinoma; Renal Pelvis Urothelial Carcinoma; Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma; Renal Cell Carcinoma; Sarcomatoid Renal Cell Carcinoma; Sarcomatoid Urothelial Carcinoma; Plasmacytoid Urothelial Carcinoma; Renal Medullary Carcinoma; Penile Squamous Cell Carcinoma; Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma (bladder)
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Histologically confirmed metastatic genitourinary solid tumor (phase I) | Expansion: metastatic urothelial carcinoma (bladder, urethra, ureter, renal pelvis), or clear cell renal cell carcinoma, or adenocarcinoma of the bladder, or non-resectable penile squamous cell carcinoma, or rare GU histologies (squamous or small cell bladder carcinoma, renal medullary carcinoma, sarcomatoid bladder or renal cell carcinoma, plasmacytoid bladder carcinoma, or other rare bladder/kidney histology) | Metastatic disease with at least one evaluable/measurable site or new bone lesion (per cohort definitions) | For urothelial carcinoma or renal cell carcinoma expansion: progressive metastatic disease with at least one measurable site (RECIST) or bone disease by NaF PET/CT | Progressed on >= 1 standard therapy or no standard therapy conferring survival benefit; cisplatin-ineligible urothelial carcinoma may receive protocol therapy first-line | Any number of prior cytotoxic agents permitted | Karnofsky performance status >= 70% | Tissue available for PD-L1 expression (archival or consent to pre/post-treatment biopsies)

to any other site within 28 days | Radionuclide treatment within 6 weeks | Small molecule kinase inhibitor within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) | Hormonal therapy within 14 days or 5 half-lives (GnRH agonists/antagonists allowed) | Investigational agent within 28 days | Unresolved toxicities from prior therapy > grade 1 (except alopecia and asymptomatic lab abnormalities) | Prior MET or VEGFR inhibitors excluded from expansion cohorts (allowed in phase I) | Prior PD-1/PD-L1 or CTLA-4 therapy excluded unless enrolling in designated cohort | Active brain metastases or epidural disease unless previously treated and stable off steroids >= 2 weeks; baseline contrast brain imaging required if history present | PT/INR or PTT >= 1.5 x ULN within 7 days before first dose | Concurrent warfarin prohibited (except <= 1 mg/day); aspirin up to 325 mg/day, factor Xa/thrombin inhibitors, and LMWH permitted | Chronic treatment with strong CYP3A4 inducers not permitted | Clinically significant gastrointestinal bleeding within 6 months; hemoptysis >= 2.5 mL within 3 months; signs of pulmonary hemorrhage within 3 months | Tumor invading major blood vessels | Tumor invasion of GI tract or endotracheal/endobronchial tumor within 28 days before cabozantinib | Cardiovascular disorders: NYHA class III/IV heart failure; question_text: What are trial options for a 68-year-old male with a two-year history of progressive cognitive decline? His MMSE score is 19, consistent with moderate-stage dementia. An amyloid PET scan was performed and was negative. CSF analysis was also negative for amyloid plaques but showed elevated p-tau. His family is seeking disease-modifying therapies.
trial_title: Neurologic Bone Marrow Derived Stem Cell Treatment Study
diseases_targeted: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis; Alzheimer Disease; CADASIL; Cerebral Hemorrhage; Cerebral Infarction; Cerebral Ischemia; Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy; Cognitive Impairment; Dementia; Diabetic Neuropathy; Frontotemporal Dementia; Lewy Body Disease; Lewy Body Variant of Alzheimer Disease; Multiple System Atrophy; Neuropathy; Parkinson Disease; Progressive Supranuclear Palsy; Stroke; Traumatic Brain Injury
inclusion_criteria: Documented functional damage to the central or peripheral nervous system unlikely to improve with current standard of care | >= 6 months since disease onset | If on pharmacologic or surgical therapy, clinically stable and unlikely to have reversal of neurologic damage from that therapy | Investigator assessment that there is potential for improvement with BMSC and minimal risk from the procedure | Age > 18 years | Medically stable and able to be cleared by a primary care practitioner for the procedure
exclusion_criteria: Not medically stable or at significant risk to health from undergoing the procedure | Pregnant at the time of treatment or planning pregnancy within 3 months post-treatment
prior_therapies: Current pharmacologic or surgical therapy allowed if stable
reasoning: Disease matches (dementia is included), age 68 meets ≥18, and the 2-year progressive cognitive decline fits the ≥6 months/documented CNS damage setting; prior therapy constraints are compatible. No required biomarkers or explicit exclusions apply.

exclusion_criteria: Not medically stable or at significant risk to health from undergoing the procedure | Pregnant at the time of treatment or planning pregnancy within 3 months post-treatment

inclusion_criteria: Rare cancer histologically and/or biochemically confirmed (specimen submission required; GTD confirmed by quantitative serum beta-hCG) | PD-L1 amplification cohort: solid tumors (excluding lymphoma) with PD-L1 amplification defined as DNA copy number >= 6 by CLIA-approved assay performed in advanced disease | Cancer of unknown primary: metastatic malignancy with no discernible primary after standard evaluation | Progressed after at least one line of standard systemic therapy or no standard therapy exists that prolongs overall survival | Measurable disease by RECIST v1.1 on CT or MRI within 28 days (cohorts except GTD) | Age >= 18 years | Zubrod performance status 0-2 | Prior malignancy allowed if stage I-II in complete remission, or any cancer disease-free >= 1 year; stage I-II follicular thyroid or prostate cancer eligible without complete remission requirement | Prior anti-CTLA-4 or prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 allowed (but not both); must be completed >= 4 weeks before registration (except PD-L1 amplified cohort must be PD-1/PD-L1 naive; prior CTLA-4 allowed >= 4 weeks) | Adequate thyroid function (TSH or free T4 within normal range) or on stable replacement | Adequate adrenal axis function (cortisol within normal range or ACTH within normal range) | Brain metastases or primary brain tumors treated and stable; local therapy completed >= 28 days before registration; off steroids >= 7 days | Off other systemic anti-cancer therapy >= 7 days before registration with toxicities recovered to <= grade 1 (except alopecia and <= grade 2 neuropathy) | Hormonal/endocrine blockade permitted if progressed on prior therapy; long-acting somatostatin analogs and androgen deprivation therapy permitted during protocol therapy
exclusion_criteria: Prior grade >= 3 immune-related adverse event with prior immunotherapy | History of or planned solid organ transplant | Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment in the past 2 years (except replacement therapy); autoimmune patients must not have received steroids or immunosuppressives within 28 days prior to registration | Currently receiving investigational agents or systemic anti-cancer therapy (including radiation); planned radiation must be completed before registration | Known hypersensitivity or allergy to nivolumab or ipilimumab | Pregnant or nursing | Active hepatitis B or C infection (allowed if viral load undetectable and no residual hepatic impairment) | HIV-positive patients ineligible if CD4+ < 250 cells/mm^3 or history of non-malignancy AIDS-defining conditions (other than historical low CD4) | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness including symptomatic CHF (NYHA III/IV), unstable angina or coronary angioplasty/stenting within 24 weeks, unstable cardiac arrhythmia (CTCAE v4 grade >= 2), known cardiac metastases, abnormal cardiac valve morphology (>= grade 3), or psychiatric illness limiting compliance | Symptomatic interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis | Not fully recovered from major surgery to <= grade 1 within 14 days before registration
prior_therapies: Progressed after >= 1 prior line of standard systemic therapy or no standard OS-prolonging therapy exists; Prior anti-CTLA-4 or prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 allowed, but not both; must be completed >= 4 weeks before registration; PD-L1 amplified cohort: no prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1; prior anti-CTLA-4 allowed if completed >= 4 weeks; Off other systemic anti-cancer therapy >= 7 days before registration with toxicities recovered to <= grade 1 (except alopecia and <= grade 2 neuropathy); Brain metastases local therapy completed >= 28 days before registration; off steroids >= 7 days; Major surgery recovered to <= grade 1 at least 14 days before registration; Planned radiation must be completed before registration; Hormonal/endocrine therapy may continue if progressed on prior therapy (e.g., GnRH, somatostatin analogs, androgen deprivation)

trial_title: P53MVA and Pembrolizumab in Treating Patients With Recurrent Ovarian, Primary Peritoneal, or Fallopian Tube Cancer
diseases_targeted: Ovarian Carcinoma (platinum-resistant, recurrent); Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma (platinum-resistant, recurrent); Fallopian Tube Carcinoma (platinum-resistant, recurrent)
inclusion_criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed epithelial ovarian, primary peritoneal, or fallopian tube cancer | Recurrent or progressive disease within 6 months after completion of platinum-based chemotherapy (platinum-resistant or refractory) | Measurable disease per RECIST 1.1 or detectable disease | CA-125 >= 2 x ULN if no measurable disease | Ascites and/or pleural effusion attributed to tumor if no measurable disease | Non-measurable solid and/or cystic abnormalities on imaging not meeting target lesion criteria if no measurable disease | TP53 mutation and/or p53 overexpression by IHC (>= 10% tumor cells) | ECOG <=2 | Life expectancy >= 3 months | Up to 4 prior chemotherapy regimens for recurrent disease allowed
exclusion_criteria: Positive pregnancy test or pregnant/breastfeeding | Prior therapy with anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, or other T-cell checkpoint agents (e.g., CTLA-4, OX-40, CD137) | Systemic anti-cancer therapy within 4 weeks before start | Radiotherapy within 3 weeks before start (1-week washout allowed for short palliative non-CNS RT) | Live vaccine within 30 days before first dose | Participation in another investigational agent or device study within 4 weeks before start | Immunodeficiency (including organ grafts or HIV) or systemic immunosuppression >10 mg prednisone equivalent within 7 days before start | Another malignancy requiring active treatment within the past 3 years (except certain in situ and non-melanoma skin cancers) | Active CNS metastases or carcinomatous meningitis (previously treated, stable brain metastases allowed off steroids >=14 days) | Severe hypersensitivity (>= grade 3) to pembrolizumab or excipients | Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment in the past 2 years | History of non-infectious pneumonitis requiring steroids or current pneumonitis | Active infection requiring systemic therapy | Known HIV infection | Active hepatitis A, hepatitis B surface antigen positive, or active hepatitis C (HCV RNA detectable) | Active tuberculosis infection | Significant cardiac disease: myocardial infarction or arterial thromboembolic event within 6 months, severe/unstable angina, NYHA class III/IV heart failure, QTcB > 470 ms, uncontrolled hypertension (>150/100 mm Hg), abnormal EKG/echo/troponin (>= grade 2) | Li-Fraumeni syndrome (family history or confirmed) | Severe environmental allergies or allergy to egg proteins | Psychiatric or substance use disorders interfering with study requirements
prior_therapies: Up to 4 prior chemotherapy regimens for recurrent disease allowed; Adjuvant chemotherapy and maintenance paclitaxel not counted toward regimen limit; Prior targeted agents or hormone therapy not counted as systemic chemotherapy regimens; No prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1/PD-L2 or other T-cell checkpoint therapy; No systemic anti-cancer therapy within 4 weeks before start (toxicities recovered to <= grade 1 except <= grade 2 neuropathy); No radiotherapy within 3 weeks before start (1-week washout allowed for short palliative non-CNS RT); No investigational agents or devices within 4 weeks before start; No live vaccines within 30 days before first dose; No non-oncology viral vaccines within 30 days before start
reasoning: Excellent stage/setting and prior-therapy fit for platinum-resistant recurrent epithelial ovarian cancer; pleural effusion qualifies as detectable disease and age/sex match. patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; BRCA1 positive; Optimal debulking surgery performed; Received adjuvant carboplatin + paclitaxel + bevacizumab; Cytology-positive malignant pleural effusion at 5 months post-adjuvant
patient_prior_therapies: Carboplatin; Paclitaxel; Bevacizumab; Optimal debulking surgery

question_text: I'm looking for trial options for an 11-year-old boy with Duchenne muscular dystrophy confirmed by a deletion of exons 49-50. He lost ambulation 8 months ago and is now dependent on a power wheelchair. He is on a stable regimen of deflazacort and lisinopril for early cardiomyopathy (LVEF 52%). His Performance of Upper Limb (PUL) score is 18. His parents are interested in trials for non-ambulatory patients.
trial_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Multiple Dose Study With an Open-Label Extension to Determine the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Efficacy of Oral Ifetroban in Subjects With Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy
inclusion_criteria: Male, age >= 7 years | Diagnosis of Duchenne muscular dystrophy (phenotype consistent with DMD) with either positive genotype, first-degree relative with positive genotype, or confirmatory muscle biopsy | Stable corticosteroid dose for >= 8 weeks or no corticosteroids for >= 30 days | Stable cardiac function with change in LVEF < 15% and no heart failure admission over the last 12 months | LVEF >= 35% by cardiac MRI or echocardiography | Myocardial damage by late gadolinium enhancement permitted | Concurrent ACE inhibitor, beta-blocker, or ARB therapy allowed if started >= 3 months prior to first dose without dose change | Aldosterone receptor antagonists (e.g., spironolactone or eplerenone) allowed if started >= 12 months prior to first dose | Late-stage cohort eligibility: LVEF 35%-45% by MRI or echocardiography, or historical LVEF 35%-45% with baseline MRI < 50%
exclusion_criteria: Clinically significant illness other than Duchenne muscular dystrophy | Clinically significant laboratory abnormality not associated with Duchenne muscular dystrophy | Major surgery within 6 weeks prior to first dose or planned surgery that would interfere with study procedures | Requires antiarrhythmic therapy and/or initiation of diuretic therapy for acute heart failure within the last 6 months | LVEF < 35% by cardiac MRI and/or fractional shortening < 15% by echocardiography during screening | Known bleeding disorder or receipt of anticoagulant treatment within 2 weeks of study entry | Allergy to gadolinium contrast or known renal insufficiency defined as abnormal cystatin C or creatinine above the upper limit of normal for age | Non–MRI-compatible implants (e.g., neurostimulator, AICD) | Participation in a therapeutic clinical trial within 30 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) of study entry | Any other condition that could interfere with participation
prior_therapies: Stable oral corticosteroids for >= 8 weeks or off corticosteroids for >= 30 days before enrollment; Concurrent ACE inhibitor, beta-blocker, or ARB permitted if initiated >= 3 months prior without dose change; Aldosterone receptor antagonists permitted if initiated >= 12 months prior; No participation in another therapeutic clinical trial within 30 days or 5 half-lives prior to entry
reasoning: Disease and cardiomyopathy status match; male age 11 meets criteria. On stable corticosteroids and ACE inhibitor (allowed), with LVEF 52% (>=35%); no stated exclusions apply.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 11 years; Male sex; Duchenne muscular dystrophy confirmed by deletion of exons 49-50; Non-ambulatory (lost ambulation 8 months ago); Power wheelchair dependent; Stable deflazacort regimen; Early cardiomyopathy with LVEF 52%; Performance of Upper Limb (PUL) score 18
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease aligns (DMD with cardiac involvement). Core anchors: Stage/setting compatible (LVEF 52% within required ≥35% and cardiomyopathy focus), and prior exposure compatibility (stable corticosteroids; ACE inhibitor permitted). No identified soft mismatches. Grade A is appropriate.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase II Study of Olaparib (AZD2281) in Patients With Metastatic/Advanced Urothelial Carcinoma and Other Genitourinary Tumors With DNA-Repair Defects
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed non-prostate genitourinary (GU) cancer | Presence of cancer-associated genetic mutations per FoundationOne CDx per cohort definitions or TMB >= 10 mut/Mb | Measurable disease per RECIST 1.1 | Evidence of disease progression during or after at least one platinum-based chemotherapy regimen and/or an immune-checkpoint inhibitor | Age >= 18 years | ECOG performance status <= 1 (or Karnofsky >= 70%) | Able to tolerate oral medications; no gastrointestinal condition precluding absorption of olaparib | Negative pregnancy test for women of childbearing potential at screening and within 3 days prior to day 1 | Use of effective contraception during treatment and for required period after last dose | Provision of archival tumor sample or willingness to undergo mandatory screening biopsy (or liquid biopsy if tissue unavailable)
exclusion_criteria: Prior treatment with olaparib or any PARP inhibitor | Myelodysplastic syndrome or acute myeloid leukemia, or baseline features suggestive of MDS/AML | Persistent toxicities >= CTCAE grade 2 from prior therapy (except alopecia or peripheral neuropathy) | Concurrent treatment with other investigational agents (per protocol during treatment phase) | Known brain metastases or spinal cord compression unless definitively treated and clinically stable for >= 28 days | Allergic reactions to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to olaparib | Current use of strong or moderate CYP3A inhibitors or inducers without adequate washout (>= 5 half-lives or 3 weeks, whichever is shorter) | Pregnancy or breastfeeding | Any chronic or concurrent acute liver disease | History of stroke, transient ischemic attack, or myocardial infarction within 6 months | Uncontrolled infection | Symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina, or clinically significant cardiac arrhythmia | Unstable or untreated cardiac conditions or left ventricular ejection fraction < 50% | Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus | Psychiatric illness or social situation limiting compliance | Other severe medical or psychiatric condition or laboratory abnormality increasing risk or interfering with study | Immunocompromised state (e.g., HIV with detectable virus not on HAART) | Active hepatitis B or C infection | Other malignancy within 2 years except allowed low-risk cancers as specified | Systemic chemotherapy or radiotherapy (except palliative) within 2 weeks prior to study treatment | Major surgery within 2 weeks prior to starting study treatment without adequate recovery | Previous allogeneic bone marrow transplant or double umbilical cord blood transplantation
prior_therapies: Progression during or after at least one platinum-based chemotherapy regimen required; Prior treatment with an immune-checkpoint inhibitor (atezolizumab, pembrolizumab, nivolumab, avelumab, or durvalumab) allowed and may qualify; Washout from chemotherapy >= 2 weeks before study treatment; Washout from monoclonal antibody therapy >= 4 weeks before study treatment
reasoning: Disease and setting match (metastatic urothelial carcinoma), and the patient has progressed after platinum chemotherapy and an immune-checkpoint inhibitor, meeting line-of-therapy requirements. The required genomic/TMB criterion is unknown from the provided data, making eligibility uncertain but not an exclusion.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial carcinoma; Progressing after second line therapy; Prior neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin (4 cycles); Prior enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab with progression after 6 cycles; Status post cystectomy with pathologic complete response; Age 55 years; Male; Chronic kidney disease with eGFR 35 mL/min; History of type 2 diabetes mellitus; History of COPD
patient_prior_therapies: Neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin; Cystectomy; Enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches. Stage/setting (metastatic) and line/prior exposure (progressed after platinum and ICI) both match core anchors. Required biomarker (DDR/TMB) status is unknown, which is not an exclusion and not a soft mismatch. Per decision procedure, ≥2 anchors match with no conflicts → A.

prior_therapies: Cohort 1 requires prior anti–PD-(L)1 therapy; Cohort 1 allows up to 2 prior lines of systemic therapy; Cohort 2 prohibits prior anti–PD-(L)1 therapy; Cohort 2 allows only 1 prior line of systemic therapy; Neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy within 12 months of last dose counts as prior systemic therapy
