trial_title: A Phase II Open-Label Study of Sacituzumab Govitecan in Unresectable Locally Advanced/Metastatic Urothelial Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | ECOG performance status 0–1 | Adequate renal and hepatic function | Adequate hematologic parameters without transfusional support | Life expectancy >= 3 months | Cohorts 4 and 6: Measurable disease by RECIST 1.1 | Cohorts 1, 2, 3, 5: Creatinine clearance >= 30 mL/min | Cohort 4: No prior platinum-based chemotherapy in the metastatic or unresectable locally advanced setting | Cohort 4: Creatinine clearance >= 50 mL/min; if receiving cisplatin 70 mg/m2 Day 1 q21d, creatinine clearance >= 60 mL/min; if creatinine clearance 50–59 mL/min, receive split-dose cisplatin | Cohorts 4, 5, 6, 7: Archival tumor tissue (muscle-invasive or metastatic urothelial carcinoma) or biopsy of metastatic urothelial carcinoma | Cohort 5: Completed 4–6 cycles of gemcitabine + cisplatin with CR/PR/SD and treatment-free interval of 4–10 weeks | Cohort 6: Cisplatin-ineligible; no prior therapy for metastatic or unresectable locally advanced disease; CPI-naive or >12 months from completion of adjuvant therapy | Cohort 7: No prior systemic therapy for locally advanced or metastatic urothelial cancer (recurrence >12 months after curative therapy allowed) | Cohort 7: Measurable disease by RECIST 1.1
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant or lactating | Active second malignancy | Known active hepatitis B or hepatitis C | Known active central nervous system metastases and/or carcinomatous meningitis | Other concurrent medical or psychiatric conditions that would preclude study participation | Prior anti-cancer monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks before Day 1 or unresolved > Grade 1 toxicities from prior therapy | Cohorts 3–6: Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment in past 2 years | Cohorts 3–6: Receipt of a live vaccine within 30 days prior to first dose | Cohorts 3–6: History or evidence of interstitial lung disease or non-infectious pneumonitis | Cohort 3: Prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy | Cohort 4: Refractory to platinum in neoadjuvant/adjuvant setting (relapse <= 12 months after completion) | Cohorts 4, 5, 6: If prior checkpoint inhibitor, treatment-free interval must be >12 months between last dose and date of recurrence | Cohort 7: Prior anticancer therapy within 12 months before C1D1 or prior radiation within 2 weeks before C1D1 | Cohort 7: History of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia, drug-induced or idiopathic pneumonitis, or active pneumonitis on screening CT | Cohort 7: Child-Pugh class B or C hepatic impairment | Cohort 7: Uncontrolled diabetes | Cohort 7: Active keratitis or corneal ulcerations | Cohort 7: Ongoing sensory or motor neuropathy Grade >= 2
prior_therapies: Cohort 1: Prior platinum-containing therapy and prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy with progression/recurrence; Cohort 2: Platinum-ineligible for first-line metastatic disease and progression after first-line anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy; no prior platinum for recurrent/metastatic/advanced disease; Cohort 3: Prior platinum-containing therapy with progression/recurrence; Cohort 4: No prior platinum-based chemotherapy in the metastatic or unresectable locally advanced setting; Cohort 5: Completed 4–6 cycles of gemcitabine + cisplatin without progressive disease; Cohort 6: No prior therapy for metastatic or unresectable locally advanced disease; CPI-naive or >12 months since completion of adjuvant therapy; Cohort 7: No prior systemic therapy for locally advanced or metastatic disease (curative-intent therapy allowed if recurrence >12 months)
reasoning: Disease and setting match metastatic urothelial carcinoma. The patient fits Cohort 1 (prior platinum and PD-1 with progression) and has renal function consistent with cohorts requiring CrCl ≥30 mL/min; no explicit exclusions are evident.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial carcinoma; Progressing after second line therapy; Prior neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin (4 cycles); Prior enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab with progression after 6 cycles; Status post cystectomy with pathologic complete response; Age 55 years; Male; Chronic kidney disease with eGFR 35 mL/min; History of type 2 diabetes mellitus; History of COPD
patient_prior_therapies: Neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin; Cystectomy; Enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab
judge_comment: Disease and metastatic setting match. Patient fits Cohort 1 (prior platinum and prior PD-1 with progression). Renal function (eGFR ~35) aligns with cohorts requiring CrCl ≥30 mL/min. No hard exclusions identified and no soft conflicts noted. Therefore ≥2 core anchors (stage/setting and line/prior) match, justifying grade A.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase II Study of Ipilimumab, Cabozantinib, and Nivolumab in Rare Genitourinary Cancers (ICONIC)
diseases_targeted: Bladder Adenocarcinoma; Bladder Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma; Bladder Squamous Cell Carcinoma; Bladder Neuroendocrine Carcinoma; Bladder Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma; Urothelial Carcinoma; Micropapillary Urothelial Carcinoma; Plasmacytoid Urothelial Carcinoma; Giant Cell Urothelial Carcinoma; Lipid-Rich Urothelial Carcinoma; Nested Variant Urothelial Carcinoma; Lymphoepithelioma-Like Carcinoma; Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma; Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma; Papillary Renal Cell Carcinoma; Sarcomatoid Renal Cell Carcinoma; Collecting Duct Carcinoma; Renal Medullary Carcinoma; Urachal Adenocarcinoma; Urethral Carcinoma; Urethral Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma; Penile Carcinoma; Prostate Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma; Malignant Testicular Leydig Cell Tumor; Malignant Testicular Sertoli Cell Tumor
inclusion_criteria: Metastatic disease with new or progressive lesions on imaging | At least one measurable lesion per RECIST v1.1 | For bone-only cohort: at least one bone lesion on bone scan/CT/MRI | Histologically confirmed metastatic small cell/neuroendocrine carcinoma of the bladder | Histologically confirmed metastatic bladder adenocarcinoma, urachal adenocarcinoma, or bladder/urethra clear cell adenocarcinoma (pure) | Histologically confirmed metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of the bladder (pure) | Histologically confirmed metastatic plasmacytoid urothelial carcinoma (>= ~50% plasmacytoid/discohesive) | Any penile cancer | Sarcomatoid renal cell carcinoma (predominantly ~50%, including rhabdoid) and unclassified high-grade RCC; malignant angiomyolipoma allowed | Other variant urothelial carcinomas (e.g., micropapillary >= ~50%, giant cell, lipid-rich, clear cell, nested), large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma, lymphoepithelioma-like carcinoma, mixed patterns; treatment-naive primary prostate small cell allowed; malignant testicular Sertoli or Leydig cell tumors; papillary and chromophobe RCC | Sarcomatoid urothelial carcinoma (predominantly ~50%) | Renal medullary carcinoma | Bone-only metastatic genitourinary tumors (non-prostate) | Renal collecting duct carcinoma (WHO definition) | Urethral carcinoma (any histology; if urothelial, isolated to urethra) | Availability of H&E slides from diagnostic tumor tissue for central review | Up to 2 prior systemic anticancer treatments allowed or treatment naive; small cell carcinoma should have received a platinum-based combination regimen; bone-only cohort must receive cisplatin-based chemotherapy if eligible | Age >= 18 years | Able to swallow oral tablets | Karnofsky performance status >= 80% | ANC >= 1,000/µL | Platelets >= 75,000/µL | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN (<= 3.0 mg/dL allowed with Gilbert syndrome) | AST/ALT <= 3 x ULN (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastases or Gilbert syndrome) | Creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN or creatinine clearance >= 40 mL/min/1.73 m2 | Hemoglobin >= 9 g/dL (PRBC transfusion allowed) | Serum albumin >= 3.2 g/dL | Lipase and amylase <= 2 x ULN and no clinical/radiologic pancreatitis | HIV-positive allowed if on stable HAART, CD4 > 350/µL, and viral load undetectable | Select stable autoimmune/rheumatologic conditions on topical therapy allowed; controlled endocrine deficiencies allowed; vitiligo allowed | Women of childbearing potential: negative pregnancy test within 7 days prior to registration | Recovery to baseline or CTCAE <= grade 1 from prior therapy toxicities (except alopecia, neuropathy, or non-clinically significant lab AEs) | Previously treated brain metastases eligible if asymptomatic and off steroids >= 2 weeks; baseline contrast brain imaging required if known brain metastases
exclusion_criteria: Prior cabozantinib | Both prior MET/VEGF inhibitor exposure and prior PD-1/PD-L1/CTLA-4 therapy (sequentially or in combination) | Prior PD-1/PD-L1 or CTLA-4 therapy (except allowed for urothelial carcinoma cohorts D, H, J, L) | Active or acute diverticulitis, intra-abdominal abscess, or GI obstruction within 12 months | Pregnancy or breastfeeding | Cytotoxic chemotherapy or biologic agents within 2 weeks before first dose | Radiation therapy to lungs/mediastinum/abdomen within 4 weeks before first dose or with ongoing complications | Radiation to brain metastasis within 3 weeks (WBRT) or 2 weeks (SBRT) before first dose | Radiation to any other site within 2 weeks before first dose | Radionuclide treatment within 6 weeks before first dose | Small molecule kinase inhibitor within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) before first dose | Hormonal therapy within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) before first dose (GnRH agonists/antagonists allowed) | Other investigational agent within 14 days before first dose | Not recovered to baseline or CTCAE > grade 1 from prior therapy toxicities (except allowed conditions) | Active brain metastases or epidural disease requiring steroids within 2 weeks | Concomitant warfarin (except <= 1 mg/day); aspirin up to 325 mg/day, thrombin or factor Xa inhibitors, and LMWH permitted | Chronic concomitant strong CYP3A4 inducers or strong inhibitors | Clinically significant GI bleeding within 6 months | Hemoptysis >= 2.5 mL/day within 1 month | Signs of pulmonary hemorrhage within 3 months | Tumor invading major blood vessels | Tumor invading GI tract or endotracheal/endobronchial tumor within 28 days; rectal tumor masses | Congestive heart failure NYHA class III or IV | Uncontrolled hypertension (sustained BP > 150/90 mmHg) despite therapy within 7 days of first dose | QTcF > 500 ms (unless average of 3 repeat ECGs <= 500 ms) | History of congenital long QT syndrome | Within 6 months: unstable angina, clinically significant arrhythmias, stroke/TIA/ischemic event, myocardial infarction, or cardiomyopathy | Unresolved active peptic ulcer disease, acute diverticulitis/cholecystitis/cholangitis/appendicitis, or malabsorption within 28 days before first dose | Within 2 years: abdominal or genitourinary fistula, GI perforation, bowel or gastric outlet obstruction, or intra-abdominal abscess (must be fully resolved) | High fistula risk conditions (e.g., recent PEG tube placement) | Severe active infection requiring IV therapy within 14 days | Serious non-healing wound, ulcer, or bone fracture within 28 days | History of organ transplant or allogeneic stem cell transplant | Uncompensated hypothyroidism or thyroid dysfunction within 7 days (unless replacement started) | Major surgery within 3 months (or >= 6 weeks if completely healed) before first cabozantinib dose; minor surgery within 1 month (or 3 months if wound complications); wounds must be fully healed | Severe hypersensitivity to any monoclonal antibody | Active malignancy requiring systemic treatment within 2 years | Allergic reactions to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to cabozantinib, nivolumab, or ipilimumab | Active hepatitis B (HBsAg positive with detectable HBV DNA) or active hepatitis C infection | Active autoimmune disease or history with risk of recurrence requiring systemic immunosuppression (e.g., SLE, MS, myasthenia gravis, IBD, autoimmune hepatitis, TEN, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, antiphospholipid syndrome)
prior_therapies: Up to 2 prior systemic anticancer treatments allowed; treatment naive allowed; Small cell carcinoma: prior platinum-based combination regimen required (neoadjuvant, adjuvant, or first line); Bone-only cohort: must receive standard cisplatin-based chemotherapy if cisplatin-eligible; Prior MET or VEGFR inhibitors allowed; No cytotoxic chemotherapy or biologic agents within 2 weeks before first dose; No radiation within protocol-specified windows before first dose (lungs/mediastinum/abdomen within 4 weeks; brain WBRT within 3 weeks or SBRT within 2 weeks; other sites within 2 weeks); No radionuclide therapy within 6 weeks before first dose; No small molecule kinase inhibitors within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) before first dose; No hormonal therapy within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) before first dose (GnRH agonists/antagonists allowed); No other investigational agents within 14 days before first dose; Toxicities from prior therapies recovered to baseline or CTCAE <= grade 1 (exceptions apply)
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match, and the patient’s prior therapies (two systemic regimens including PD-1) fit the trial’s allowance for urothelial carcinoma cohorts. Note: the patient’s eGFR 35 mL/min may not meet the trial’s creatinine clearance ≥ 40 mL/min requirement, which could affect eligibility.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial carcinoma; Progressing after second line therapy; Prior neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin (4 cycles); Prior enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab with progression after 6 cycles; Status post cystectomy with pathologic complete response; Age 55 years; Male; Chronic kidney disease with eGFR 35 mL/min; History of type 2 diabetes mellitus; History of COPD
patient_prior_therapies: Neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin; Cystectomy; Enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab
judge_comment: A is too strong. While metastatic stage matches, the UC cohorts in this trial appear to require variant histology, making the required subtype unknown for this patient; moreover, prior PD-1 exposure is only allowed in certain UC cohorts, so line/prior compatibility is not clearly a match without confirming cohort eligibility. With exactly one clear core anchor (stage/setting) and no soft conflicts, the rubric points to B, not A. The low eGFR is not a hard exclusion under the rubric’s anchors.

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1 Study to Evaluate IL13Rα2-Targeted Chimeric Antigen Receptor (CAR) T Cells Combined With Checkpoint Inhibition for Patients With Resectable Recurrent Glioblastoma
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | ECOG <= 2 | Karnofsky >= 60% | Life expectancy >= 4 weeks | Histologically confirmed WHO grade IV glioblastoma or prior grade II/III glioma with progression consistent with grade IV glioblastoma after standard therapy | Relapsed/refractory measurable disease after standard therapy | >= 12 weeks after completion of front-line radiation therapy | IL13Ralpha2-positive tumor by IHC (H-score > 50) | WBC > 2000/µL or ANC >= 1000/µL (within 14 days prior to leukapheresis) | Platelets >= 75000/µL | Fasting blood glucose within ULN | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN | AST <= 2.5 x ULN | ALT <= 2.5 x ULN | Serum creatinine <= 1.6 mg/dL | Oxygen saturation >= 95% on room air | Seronegative for HIV Ag/Ab combo | Hepatitis C antibody negative or, if positive, HCV RNA negative | Hepatitis B surface antigen negative | Hepatitis A virus IgM antibody negative | Women of childbearing potential: negative pregnancy test | Agreement to use effective contraception during study and for at least 5 months after last nivolumab dose and/or 3 months after last CAR T cell cycle
exclusion_criteria: Prior CTLA-4, PD-1, or PD-L1 inhibitor therapy | Steroid-dependent requiring > 6 mg dexamethasone per day at enrollment | Unresolved toxicities from prior therapy | History of or active autoimmune disease | Uncontrolled seizure activity or clinically evident progressive encephalopathy | History of allergic reactions to compounds similar to study agents | Active diarrhea | Clinically significant uncontrolled illness | Active infection requiring antibiotics | Known HIV, hepatitis B, or hepatitis C infection | Other active malignancy | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Any condition that contraindicates participation due to safety concerns per investigator | Inability to comply with study procedures
prior_therapies: Completed standard therapy for glioblastoma; Radiographic progression after standard therapy; At least 12 weeks since completion of front-line radiation therapy
reasoning: Disease and setting match (recurrent GBM after standard therapy), with age and ECOG within trial limits and no conflicting exclusions (no prior PD-1/PD-L1). IL13Rα2 positivity is required but status is unknown; otherwise core anchors align.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Recurrent disease after standard therapy; ECOG 1; Age 40 years; Male; Prior gross total resection; Completed adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Completed adjuvant temozolomide
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Radiation therapy with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and stage/line match, but the trial requires IL13Rα2-positive tumor and the patient’s IL13Rα2 status is unknown. Per rubric, A requires required biomarkers to be satisfied; with a required biomarker unknown, this remains uncertain rather than excellent, so grade C.

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. After 5 months, she had a new pleural effusion that was cytology positive for ovarian carcinoma. She was found to be BRCA1 positive. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase I/Ib Dose Escalation Study of Pegylated Liposomal Doxorubicin (PLD) With Peposertib (M3814) in Platinum - Resistant or Ineligible Ovarian and Related Cancers With Planned Expansions in High Grade Serous (HGSOC) and Low Grade Serous Ovarian Cancer (LGSOC)
diseases_targeted: Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma (FIGO Grade 1); Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma (FIGO Grade 2); Endometrial High Grade Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma; Fallopian Tube Carcinosarcoma; Fallopian Tube Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma; Fallopian Tube Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma; Fallopian Tube High Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma; Fallopian Tube Mucinous Adenocarcinoma; Fallopian Tube Transitional Cell Carcinoma; Fallopian Tube Undifferentiated Carcinoma; Ovarian High Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma; Ovarian Seromucinous Carcinoma; Ovarian Undifferentiated Carcinoma; Platinum-Sensitive Ovarian Carcinoma; Primary Peritoneal Carcinosarcoma; Primary Peritoneal High Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma; Primary Peritoneal Transitional Cell Carcinoma; Primary Peritoneal Undifferentiated Carcinoma; Recurrent Fallopian Tube Carcinoma; Recurrent Ovarian Carcinoma; Recurrent Ovarian Carcinosarcoma; Recurrent Ovarian Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma; Recurrent Ovarian Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma; Recurrent Ovarian Low Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma; Recurrent Ovarian Mucinous Adenocarcinoma; Recurrent Ovarian Transitional Cell Carcinoma; Recurrent Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma; Recurrent Primary Peritoneal Low Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma
inclusion_criteria: Recurrent or persistent epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal cancer (dose-escalation). | Expansion cohorts: recurrent or persistent low grade serous ovarian cancer (LGSOC) or high grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC). | Measurable disease per RECIST 1.1. | Prior therapy: at least one prior line of platinum-based chemotherapy required. | Prior therapy: unlimited additional lines of chemotherapy, targeted, biologic, or hormonal therapy allowed. | Washout: prior anti-cancer therapy discontinued >= 4 weeks, one cycle, or 5 half-lives (whichever is shortest) before study treatment. | Age >= 18 years. | Platinum-sensitive ovarian cancer eligible for dose expansion if PLD is appropriate. | ECOG performance status <= 2 (Karnofsky >= 60%). | Cardiac ejection fraction >= lower limit of normal. | Hemoglobin >= 9 g/dL. | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1,500/µL. | Platelets >= 100,000/µL. | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN. | AST/ALT <= 3 x ULN. | Alkaline phosphatase <= 2.5 x ULN. | Creatinine clearance > 30 mL/min. | HIV-infected patients eligible if on effective ART with undetectable viral load within 6 months. | Chronic hepatitis B eligible if viral load undetectable on suppressive therapy, if indicated. | Hepatitis C eligible if cured or on treatment with undetectable viral load. | Treated brain metastases eligible if no progression on follow-up imaging, off steroids, and clinically stable. | Women of childbearing potential: negative urine or serum pregnancy test within 72 hours prior to first dose. | Contraception required during treatment and for 6 months after last dose. | Prior or concurrent malignancy allowed if it will not interfere with assessment of safety or efficacy. | Cardiac risk assessment NYHA class 2B or better. | Availability of archival FFPE tissue (within past 36 months) for DNA/RNA analysis.
exclusion_criteria: Eligible for available therapies known to confer clinical benefit (dose-escalation phase). | Inability to swallow or absorb oral medication (e.g., drainage PEG). | Prior anthracycline exposure for ovarian cancer (doxorubicin or pegylated liposomal doxorubicin). | Unresolved toxicities from prior therapy > grade 1 (except alopecia, thyroid dysfunction, or neuropathy). | Receipt of other investigational agents within 28 days prior to start of treatment. | Allergic reactions to compounds similar to peposertib or pegylated liposomal doxorubicin. | Unable to discontinue interacting medications or herbal supplements with peposertib (strong CYP3A4/5, CYP2C9, CYP2C19 modulators; narrow TI substrates of CYP3A4/5, CYP1A2, CYP2B6; narrow TI transport substrates of P-gp, BCRP, OCT1, OATP1B1, OATP1B3). | Unable to discontinue proton-pump inhibitors >= 5 days prior to treatment (calcium carbonate allowed). | Concurrent sorivudine or brivudine use. | Live attenuated vaccine within 30 days prior to peposertib dosing. | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness, including active infection. | Psychiatric illness or social situations limiting compliance. | Pregnant or breastfeeding. | Significant uncontrolled cardiac conduction abnormalities.
prior_therapies: At least one prior line of platinum-based chemotherapy required.; Unlimited additional prior lines of chemotherapy, targeted therapy, biologic therapy, or hormonal therapy allowed.; Washout required: prior anti-cancer therapy stopped >= 4 weeks, one cycle, or 5 half-lives before study start (whichever is shortest).
reasoning: Recurrent clear cell ovarian carcinoma is explicitly included, and the patient is platinum-resistant with prior platinum therapy, female, age ≥18, and anthracycline-naive. No required biomarkers are needed and no explicit exclusions are identified from the provided data.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; BRCA1 positive; Optimal debulking surgery performed; Received adjuvant carboplatin + paclitaxel + bevacizumab; Cytology-positive malignant pleural effusion at 5 months post-adjuvant
patient_prior_therapies: Carboplatin; Paclitaxel; Bevacizumab; Optimal debulking surgery
judge_comment: Disease matches explicitly (recurrent ovarian clear cell). Stage/setting (recurrent) and prior therapy (≥1 prior platinum) both match core anchors; no soft conflicts identified. The grader inferred anthracycline-naive, which is unnecessary but does not affect the A grade per rubric.

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase II Study of Checkpoint Blockade Immunotherapy in Patients With Somatically Hypermutated Recurrent WHO Grade 4 Glioma
diseases_targeted: Glioblastoma (IDH-wildtype); Astrocytoma (IDH-mutant, grade 4); Secondary Glioblastoma; Diffuse Glioma
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed WHO grade 4 glioma at first or second recurrence, including secondary glioblastoma | Glioblastoma IDH-wildtype CNS WHO grade 4 per 2021 WHO criteria | Astrocytoma IDH-mutant CNS WHO grade 4 | Measurable disease on MRI with a bidimensionally measurable lesion >= 10 mm | Tumor tissue available from resection or biopsy of recurrent tumor within 28 days before pre-registration or planned within 28 days after pre-registration | Age >= 18 years | ECOG performance status <= 2 | Able to undergo brain MRI with contrast
exclusion_criteria: Active autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease at risk for exacerbation | Prior treatment with checkpoint blockade therapies (anti-CTLA-4, anti-PD-1/PD-L1) | Prior bevacizumab | Prior laser ablation at the time of recurrent tumor tissue sampling (allowed if performed >= 4 months before sampling) | Requires > 4 mg dexamethasone beyond the perioperative period (> 2 weeks after surgery) | History of another active malignancy requiring treatment within the previous 2 years (except in situ cancers or basal/squamous cell skin cancers)
prior_therapies: Prior laser ablation allowed if >= 4 months before recurrent tumor tissue sampling
reasoning: Recurrent IDH-wildtype glioblastoma after standard chemoradiation with ECOG 1 matches the trial’s disease, biomarker, and recurrent setting, and he has no disallowed prior checkpoint therapy or bevacizumab; age and sex are eligible. Measurable lesion size, recent recurrent-tumor tissue availability, and MRI-with-contrast ability are not provided and would need confirmation.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Recurrent disease after standard therapy; ECOG 1; Age 40 years; Male; Prior gross total resection; Completed adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Completed adjuvant temozolomide
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Radiation therapy with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches (IDH-wildtype glioblastoma, recurrent). Core anchors: Stage/setting = recurrent (match); Line/prior = checkpoint-naïve and no bevacizumab (match); Biomarker/subtype = IDH-wildtype accepted (match). Unknowns (measurable lesion, recent tissue, MRI with contrast, exact recurrence count) do not create soft conflicts. Grade A is appropriate.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: Phase I/II, Two-Part, Multicenter First-in-Human Study of Ifinatamab Deruxtecan (DS-7300a, I-DXd) in Subjects With Advanced Solid Malignant Tumors (IDeate-PanTumor01)
diseases_targeted: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma; Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma; Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer; Small Cell Lung Cancer; Bladder Cancer; Sarcoma; Endometrial Cancer; Melanoma; Prostate Cancer (castration-resistant, adenocarcinoma); Breast Cancer
inclusion_criteria: ECOG performance status 0–1 | At least one measurable lesion per RECIST v1.1 on CT or MRI; lesions should not be from a previously irradiated site unless progression is documented | Adequate cardiac, hematopoietic, renal, and hepatic function | Adequate treatment washout period prior to study treatment | Pathologically confirmed advanced/unresectable or metastatic: head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, esophageal squamous cell carcinoma, non-small cell lung cancer (squamous or adenocarcinoma), small cell lung cancer, bladder cancer, sarcoma, endometrial cancer, melanoma, adenocarcinoma castration-resistant prostate cancer, or breast cancer refractory/intolerant to standard therapy or without standard options | Expansion Cohort (2L ESCC): Disease progression after platinum-based therapy and an immune checkpoint inhibitor; maximum one prior line of systemic therapy for unresectable/metastatic ESCC
exclusion_criteria: Prior treatment with a B7-H3–targeted agent, including ifinatamab deruxtecan | Prior discontinuation of an antibody-drug conjugate containing an exatecan derivative due to treatment-related toxicities | Multiple primary malignancies within 3 years, except adequately resected non-melanoma skin cancer, curatively treated in situ disease, superficial GI tract tumors, and non-muscle invasive bladder cancer curatively resected by endoscopic surgery | Uncontrolled significant cardiovascular disease | Clinically severe pulmonary compromise, including underlying pulmonary disorders; autoimmune, connective tissue, or inflammatory disorders with potential pulmonary involvement; prior pneumonectomy; or requirement for supplemental oxygen | Uncontrolled infection requiring systemic therapy | Substance abuse or other medical conditions increasing safety risk or interfering with study participation or evaluation
prior_therapies: Treatment washout required before study start; ESCC expansion: disease progression after platinum-based therapy; ESCC expansion: prior immune checkpoint inhibitor required; ESCC expansion: maximum one prior line of systemic therapy for unresectable/metastatic disease
reasoning: Disease matches (metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer is included), and the patient has progressed on standard AR-targeted therapies, fitting the refractory setting. Age and sex are eligible, and there are no explicit exclusions noted; ECOG/measurable disease/organ function are unspecified but not conflicting.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male; Castration-resistant prostate cancer; Metastatic disease; PSMA PET avid disease; Liver metastases; Bone metastases; Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga); Prior leuprolide (Lupron)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches mCRPC cohort. Core anchors: Stage/setting (metastatic) matches and Line/prior (refractory to standard AR-targeted therapy) matches. No soft conflicts identified. Histology (adenocarcinoma) is not explicitly provided but not a hard exclusion and treated as neutral; other requirements (ECOG, measurable disease) are unknown and not part of core anchors. Thus A is appropriate per rubric.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: DS3201 With Ipilimumab in Patients With Metastatic Aggressive Variant Prostate (AVPC), Urothelial (UC), and Renal Cell (RCC) Carcinomas
diseases_targeted: Aggressive Variant Prostate Carcinoma; Castration-Resistant Prostate Carcinoma; Metastatic Urothelial Carcinoma; Metastatic Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: ECOG performance status 0-1 | Histologically or cytologically confirmed prostate carcinoma, urothelial carcinoma, or clear cell renal cell carcinoma; variant prostate histologies (small cell/neuroendocrine) permitted | Metastatic disease by CT/MRI and/or bone scan, or locally advanced not amenable to locoregional therapy | Prostate carcinoma: castration-resistant disease and maintain castrate testosterone (<= 50 ng/dL or <= 2.0 nM) throughout the study; small cell histology exempt from progression on prior ADT but must maintain castrate levels | Aggressive variant prostate carcinoma requires molecular signature: loss or mutation in at least 2 of TP53, RB1, PTEN by CLIA-certified testing | Renal cell carcinoma: progressive disease during or after at least one anti-angiogenic agent and one PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor | Urothelial carcinoma: progressive disease during or after at least one PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor and prior platinum chemotherapy or platinum-ineligible | AVPC patients may have received prior PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor but not required | Evidence of disease progression by RECIST; for AVPC, rising PSA per PCWG3 may qualify if AVPC molecular criteria met | Known brain metastases allowed if stable >= 4 weeks after local therapy, off steroids or on stable/decreasing dose <= 10 mg prednisone equivalent daily, and without confounding neurologic dysfunction | Recovery from prior surgery, radiotherapy, chemotherapy, or other anti-cancer therapy to baseline or <= grade 1 (other low-grade toxicities may be allowed if clinically insignificant) | Ability to swallow and retain oral medications | Disease site accessible for serial biopsies
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant or lactating | Carcinomatous meningitis | Prior treatment with an EZH2 inhibitor | PD-1, PD-L1, PD-L2, or CTLA-4 inhibitor within 4 weeks prior to day 1 | Monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks prior to day 1 | Investigational drug within 2 weeks prior to day 1 | Chemotherapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 | Radiation therapy or radionuclide therapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 | Receipt of live virus vaccine within 30 days prior to day 1 | Untreated symptomatic spinal cord compression or brain metastases | History of immune-related adverse event leading to permanent discontinuation of prior immunotherapy | History of >= grade 3 immune-related adverse event within past 16 weeks, any grade 4 life-threatening irAE, or neurologic/ocular irAE of any grade with prior immunotherapy (endocrine AEs allowed if on stable replacement, no adrenal crisis, asymptomatic) | Active, known, or suspected autoimmune disease (exceptions: vitiligo, type 1 diabetes, residual hypothyroidism on replacement, psoriasis/eczema not requiring systemic treatment, or conditions not expected to recur) | Requires chronic systemic corticosteroids > 10 mg prednisone equivalents daily or other immunosuppressive medications (physiologic adrenal replacement > 10 mg allowed without active autoimmune disease; inhaled/intranasal/intra-articular/topical allowed) | History of interstitial lung disease, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, or active pneumonitis on screening CT | Clinically significant cardiovascular disease: MI or stroke within 6 months; unstable angina within 3 months; CHF NYHA class 3-4; clinically significant ventricular arrhythmias; uncontrolled hypertension (SBP >= 140 mmHg or DBP >= 90 mmHg); baseline ECG abnormalities including QTc > 470 msec, complete LBBB, ischemic ST-T changes, second- or third-degree AV block, or serious brady-/tachyarrhythmias | Active hepatitis B (positive HBsAg) or active hepatitis C (detectable HCV RNA) | Known HIV infection | Gastrointestinal disorder that negatively affects absorption (e.g., short bowel syndrome, severe diarrhea, TPN requirement) | Additional malignancy that is progressing, requires active treatment, or has >= 30% probability of recurrence within 24 months (exceptions: non-melanoma skin cancer after curative therapy, Ta urothelial carcinoma, stage 0 CLL) | Any other severe/uncontrolled medical condition that could compromise participation | Unwilling or unable to comply with the study protocol
prior_therapies: Renal cell carcinoma: prior treatment with at least one anti-angiogenic agent; Renal cell carcinoma: prior treatment with a PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor; Urothelial carcinoma: prior treatment with a PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor; Urothelial carcinoma: prior platinum-based chemotherapy or platinum-ineligible; Prostate cancer: maintain castrate testosterone during study; Washout: PD-1/PD-L1/PD-L2 or CTLA-4 inhibitors within 4 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: investigational drug within 2 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: chemotherapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: radiation or radionuclide therapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed
reasoning: Disease matches (metastatic castration-resistant prostate carcinoma), and stage/setting plus prior-exposure compatibility align (AR-targeted therapy history is allowed; no prior checkpoint therapy reported). No explicit exclusions are apparent; the AVPC molecular signature applies only to that cohort and is not a known mismatch here.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male; Castration-resistant prostate cancer; Metastatic disease; PSMA PET avid disease; Liver metastases; Bone metastases; Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga); Prior leuprolide (Lupron)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches CRPC cohort. Core anchors: Stage/setting (metastatic CRPC) matches; Line/prior exposure compatible (prior AR-targeted therapy allowed, no disallowed IO reported). Biomarker requirement applies only to AVPC cohort; general CRPC cohort does not require it. No soft conflicts identified. Grade A is appropriate.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: DS3201 With Ipilimumab in Patients With Metastatic Aggressive Variant Prostate (AVPC), Urothelial (UC), and Renal Cell (RCC) Carcinomas
diseases_targeted: Aggressive Variant Prostate Carcinoma; Castration-Resistant Prostate Carcinoma; Metastatic Urothelial Carcinoma; Metastatic Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: ECOG performance status 0-1 | Histologically or cytologically confirmed prostate carcinoma, urothelial carcinoma, or clear cell renal cell carcinoma; variant prostate histologies (small cell/neuroendocrine) permitted | Metastatic disease by CT/MRI and/or bone scan, or locally advanced not amenable to locoregional therapy | Prostate carcinoma: castration-resistant disease and maintain castrate testosterone (<= 50 ng/dL or <= 2.0 nM) throughout the study; small cell histology exempt from progression on prior ADT but must maintain castrate levels | Aggressive variant prostate carcinoma requires molecular signature: loss or mutation in at least 2 of TP53, RB1, PTEN by CLIA-certified testing | Renal cell carcinoma: progressive disease during or after at least one anti-angiogenic agent and one PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor | Urothelial carcinoma: progressive disease during or after at least one PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor and prior platinum chemotherapy or platinum-ineligible | AVPC patients may have received prior PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor but not required | Evidence of disease progression by RECIST; for AVPC, rising PSA per PCWG3 may qualify if AVPC molecular criteria met | Known brain metastases allowed if stable >= 4 weeks after local therapy, off steroids or on stable/decreasing dose <= 10 mg prednisone equivalent daily, and without confounding neurologic dysfunction | Recovery from prior surgery, radiotherapy, chemotherapy, or other anti-cancer therapy to baseline or <= grade 1 (other low-grade toxicities may be allowed if clinically insignificant) | Ability to swallow and retain oral medications | Disease site accessible for serial biopsies
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant or lactating | Carcinomatous meningitis | Prior treatment with an EZH2 inhibitor | PD-1, PD-L1, PD-L2, or CTLA-4 inhibitor within 4 weeks prior to day 1 | Monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks prior to day 1 | Investigational drug within 2 weeks prior to day 1 | Chemotherapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 | Radiation therapy or radionuclide therapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 | Receipt of live virus vaccine within 30 days prior to day 1 | Untreated symptomatic spinal cord compression or brain metastases | History of immune-related adverse event leading to permanent discontinuation of prior immunotherapy | History of >= grade 3 immune-related adverse event within past 16 weeks, any grade 4 life-threatening irAE, or neurologic/ocular irAE of any grade with prior immunotherapy (endocrine AEs allowed if on stable replacement, no adrenal crisis, asymptomatic) | Active, known, or suspected autoimmune disease (exceptions: vitiligo, type 1 diabetes, residual hypothyroidism on replacement, psoriasis/eczema not requiring systemic treatment, or conditions not expected to recur) | Requires chronic systemic corticosteroids > 10 mg prednisone equivalents daily or other immunosuppressive medications (physiologic adrenal replacement > 10 mg allowed without active autoimmune disease; inhaled/intranasal/intra-articular/topical allowed) | History of interstitial lung disease, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, or active pneumonitis on screening CT | Clinically significant cardiovascular disease: MI or stroke within 6 months; unstable angina within 3 months; CHF NYHA class 3-4; clinically significant ventricular arrhythmias; uncontrolled hypertension (SBP >= 140 mmHg or DBP >= 90 mmHg); baseline ECG abnormalities including QTc > 470 msec, complete LBBB, ischemic ST-T changes, second- or third-degree AV block, or serious brady-/tachyarrhythmias | Active hepatitis B (positive HBsAg) or active hepatitis C (detectable HCV RNA) | Known HIV infection | Gastrointestinal disorder that negatively affects absorption (e.g., short bowel syndrome, severe diarrhea, TPN requirement) | Additional malignancy that is progressing, requires active treatment, or has >= 30% probability of recurrence within 24 months (exceptions: non-melanoma skin cancer after curative therapy, Ta urothelial carcinoma, stage 0 CLL) | Any other severe/uncontrolled medical condition that could compromise participation | Unwilling or unable to comply with the study protocol
prior_therapies: Renal cell carcinoma: prior treatment with at least one anti-angiogenic agent; Renal cell carcinoma: prior treatment with a PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor; Urothelial carcinoma: prior treatment with a PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor; Urothelial carcinoma: prior platinum-based chemotherapy or platinum-ineligible; Prostate cancer: maintain castrate testosterone during study; Washout: PD-1/PD-L1/PD-L2 or CTLA-4 inhibitors within 4 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: investigational drug within 2 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: chemotherapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed; Washout: radiation or radionuclide therapy within 2 weeks prior to day 1 not allowed
reasoning: Disease and setting match metastatic urothelial carcinoma, and the patient has progressed after PD-1 therapy with prior platinum exposure, meeting key cohort requirements. No explicit exclusion conflicts are identified from the provided information.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial carcinoma; Progressing after second line therapy; Prior neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin (4 cycles); Prior enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab with progression after 6 cycles; Status post cystectomy with pathologic complete response; Age 55 years; Male; Chronic kidney disease with eGFR 35 mL/min; History of type 2 diabetes mellitus; History of COPD
patient_prior_therapies: Neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin; Cystectomy; Enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab
judge_comment: No hard exclusions identified. Disease matches metastatic urothelial carcinoma. Stage/setting matches (metastatic), and line/prior exposure matches (prior PD-1 inhibitor and prior platinum). No soft conflicts evident from provided data. Therefore A is appropriate per rubric.

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. After 5 months, she had a new pleural effusion that was cytology positive for ovarian carcinoma. She was found to be BRCA1 positive. What are trial options?
trial_title: Rapid Analysis and Response Evaluation of Combination Anti-Neoplastic Agents in Rare Tumors (RARE CANCER) Trial: RARE 1 Nilotinib and Paclitaxel
diseases_targeted: Granulosa Cell Ovarian Cancer; Clear Cell Ovarian Cancer; Anal Cancer; Ewing Sarcoma
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed rare solid tumor progressed on standard therapy known to prolong survival or with no standard treatment options | Measurable and evaluable disease | Age >= 18 years | ECOG performance status <=2 | Adequate organ and marrow function per protocol-defined labs | Completion of radiation therapy or major surgery >=3 weeks prior to enrollment | Completion of biologic therapy or chemotherapy >=5 half-lives or 3 weeks (whichever is shorter); 6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C | >=2 weeks since prior Phase 0 (or equivalent) study drug | >=1 week from palliative radiation therapy to non-target lesions (after 2 cycles may be permitted at PI discretion) | Recovered to eligibility levels from prior therapy-related toxicity/adverse events | Women of childbearing potential and men agree to use adequate contraception during treatment and for 3 months after last dose | HIV-infected patients on effective antiretroviral therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months are eligible; HIV viral load test within 28 days prior to enrollment
exclusion_criteria: QTcF interval >=450 msec at study entry or congenital long QT syndrome | Sensory or motor neuropathy >= Grade 2 | Concurrent treatment with other investigational agents | Primary CNS malignancy or symptomatic CNS metastases (exceptions for asymptomatic untreated or treated CNS disease meeting protocol criteria) | History of allergic reactions to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to study drugs | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., serious untreated infection, symptomatic respiratory failure, congestive heart failure, unstable angina, significant arrhythmia, or psychiatric/social conditions limiting compliance) | Pregnancy or breastfeeding
prior_therapies: Progressed on prior standard therapy known to prolong survival or no standard options available; Washout: radiation therapy or major surgery >=3 weeks before enrollment; Washout: biologic therapy or chemotherapy >=5 half-lives or 3 weeks (whichever is shorter); 6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C; Washout: >=2 weeks since prior Phase 0 or equivalent study drug; Washout: >=1 week from palliative radiation therapy to non-target lesions; Recovery to eligibility levels from prior treatment-related toxicity
reasoning: Disease matches the trial’s clear cell ovarian cancer cohort, and the patient has recurrent disease after standard platinum/taxane/bevacizumab therapy, fitting the post-standard therapy setting. Age and sex meet eligibility, and no explicit exclusions are triggered by available data.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; BRCA1 positive; Optimal debulking surgery performed; Received adjuvant carboplatin + paclitaxel + bevacizumab; Cytology-positive malignant pleural effusion at 5 months post-adjuvant
patient_prior_therapies: Carboplatin; Paclitaxel; Bevacizumab; Optimal debulking surgery
judge_comment: Disease matches (clear cell ovarian cancer cohort). Patient has recurrent disease after standard platinum/taxane/bevacizumab, satisfying post-standard therapy setting. Age/sex within bounds. No explicit exclusion identified. At least two core anchors match (stage/setting and line/prior), so A is appropriate.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: Randomized Phase II Study of Platinum-Taxane-Cetrelimab Induction Followed by Niraparib Plus or Minus Cetrelimab Maintenance in Men With Aggressive Variant Prostate Cancers
diseases_targeted: Aggressive Variant Prostate Carcinoma; Castration-Resistant Prostate Carcinoma; Metastatic Prostate Carcinoma; Metastatic Prostate Neuroendocrine Carcinoma; Metastatic Prostate Small Cell Carcinoma; Stage IV Prostate Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed prostate carcinoma | Metastatic disease documented on imaging (bone scan, CT and/or MRI) | Meets at least one aggressive variant prostate carcinoma (AVPC) criterion | Histologically proven small cell (neuroendocrine) prostate carcinoma (AVPC criterion) | Exclusive visceral metastases (AVPC criterion) | Predominantly lytic bone metastases by x-ray or CT (AVPC criterion) | Bulky (>= 5 cm) lymphadenopathy or high-grade tumor mass in prostate/pelvis (AVPC criterion) | Low PSA (<= 10 ng/mL) at initial presentation or at symptomatic progression in the castrate-setting plus high-volume (>= 20) bone metastases (AVPC criterion) | Elevated LDH (>= 2 x ULN) or elevated CEA (>= 2 x ULN) without other etiologies (AVPC criterion) | Short interval (<= 180 days) to castration-resistant progression after initiation of hormonal therapy (AVPC criterion) | Loss or mutation in at least 2 of TP53, RB1, and PTEN by CLIA-certified testing, IHC and/or DNA sequencing (AVPC criterion) | Castration-resistant progression per RECIST without PSA rising to >= 1.0 ng/mL per PCWG3 (AVPC criterion) | Documented progressive disease by PSA progression (3 measurements >= 7 days apart with last >= 1.0 ng/mL), or new/increasing measurable disease (RECIST), or >= 2 new bone lesions (PCWG3), or increasing symptoms attributed to progression | Surgically or medically castrated with baseline testosterone <= 50 ng/dL | ECOG performance status <= 2 | Hemoglobin >= 10.0 g/dL (>= 8 g/dL if due to marrow infiltration) | Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) >= 1.5 x 10^9/L (>= 1.0 x 10^9/L if due to marrow infiltration) | White blood cells (WBC) > 3 x 10^9/L (> 2 x 10^9/L if due to marrow infiltration) | Platelet count >= 100 x 10^9/L (>= 50 x 10^9/L if due to marrow infiltration) | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN (except Gilbert syndrome) | AST and ALT <= 2.5 x ULN (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastases) | Calculated creatinine clearance (Cockcroft-Gault) >= 30 mL/min | No features suggestive of MDS/AML on peripheral blood smear | Able to swallow study drugs whole (tablet/capsule)
exclusion_criteria: Any prior treatment for CRPC with carboplatin, cisplatin, cabazitaxel, a PARP inhibitor, or an anti-PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitor | More than one prior line of chemotherapy | Unresolved toxicity from prior therapy > CTCAE grade 2 (except allowed ongoing LHRH therapy, bisphosphonates, or RANK ligand inhibitors) | Any unresolved CTCAE grade >= 2 toxicity from previous anti-cancer therapy (irreversible toxicities not expected to be exacerbated may be allowed) | History or current diagnosis of myelodysplastic syndrome or acute myeloid leukemia | Active uncontrolled infection | Active or symptomatic viral hepatitis or chronic liver disease | History of pneumonitis or extensive bilateral non-malignant lung disease | Another malignancy with >= 30% probability of recurrence within 24 months (except adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancer, curatively treated in-situ cervical cancer, or Ta urothelial carcinoma) | Serious underlying medical or psychiatric condition that would make study drug hazardous or confound adverse event interpretation (e.g., uncontrolled ventricular arrhythmia, recent myocardial infarction, superior vena cava syndrome, uncontrolled seizures, history of allogeneic transplant, primary immunodeficiency) | Unable to swallow oral medication or gastrointestinal disorders likely to interfere with absorption | Symptomatic uncontrolled brain metastases or spinal cord compression | Known hypersensitivity to niraparib, carboplatin, cabazitaxel, or anti-PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitors | Current or prior use of systemic immunosuppressive medication within 28 days before first cetrelimab dose (with specified corticosteroid exceptions) | Active or prior documented autoimmune or inflammatory disorders requiring systemic therapy (with specified exceptions such as vitiligo, alopecia, controlled hypothyroidism, certain inactive diseases, or celiac disease controlled by diet) | Receipt of live attenuated vaccine within 30 days prior to cetrelimab | Compulsory detention for treatment of psychiatric or physical illness
prior_therapies: (none)
reasoning: Stage/setting and prior-exposure requirements match (metastatic CRPC; no prior platinum, cabazitaxel, PARP, or PD-1/PD-L1). AVPC features are required but not provided; if he meets at least one AVPC criterion, he appears eligible.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male; Castration-resistant prostate cancer; Metastatic disease; PSMA PET avid disease; Liver metastases; Bone metastases; Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga); Prior leuprolide (Lupron)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Stage/setting and prior-exposure anchors match (2 anchors). However, A requires required biomarker/subtype be satisfied when applicable; AVPC criterion is required and is unknown for this patient. With key required subtype unknown and no soft mismatches, the correct grade is C, not A.

question_text: A 32-year-old male has moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease, refractory to both infliximab and ustekinumab, with a CDAI score of 350. He recently completed IV antibiotic treatment for a perianal abscess and still has an active, draining seton in place. What are his clinical trial options?
trial_title: Seeded Cells on Matrix Plug Treating Crohn's Perianal Fistulas (STOMP-II)
inclusion_criteria: Age 18-70 years | Crohn's disease diagnosed >=6 months | Single fistula tract with one internal and one external opening | Prior biologic or conventional therapy for fistula with failed response or documented intolerance
exclusion_criteria: Clinically significant medical conditions within 6 months compromising safety or compliance | Hepatitis B, hepatitis C, or HIV infection, or congenital/acquired immunodeficiencies | Participation in an investigational drug study within 30 days or investigational device study within 1 year involving rectum/vagina/fistula area or potentially interacting with study treatment | History of invasive cancer (including melanoma) within 5 years except localized skin cancers | Pregnant, attempting pregnancy, or breastfeeding | Allergy/hypersensitivity to aminoglycosides or contraindications to MR/MR contrast | History of clinically significant fat-directed autoimmunity | Genitourinary fistulization including rectovaginal fistula | Presence of an ileal anal pouch | Active, unresolved infection requiring parenteral antibiotics | Major gastrointestinal surgery within 3 months (stoma allowed) | Definitive surgical procedure for the target fistula or perianal procedure causing large soft tissue defect within 6 months | Compromised adipose harvest site (e.g., prior cool sculpting, local radiation, chemotherapy, recent tattoos, local infection) | Prior Cx601/Alofisel or other allogeneic/autologous stem-cell therapy within 6 months | Contraindications to local or general anesthesia or to adipose tissue collection | Horseshoe fistulas | Fistulas without an internal opening in anal canal or low rectum | Blind-ending sinus tracts (no external opening) | Branching fistulas (unless previously converted to a single tract) | More than one internal opening | Moderate or severe proctitis | Severe rectal mucosal fibrosis preventing securing of fistula plug cap | Any anatomical limitation preventing successful securing of the fistula plug cap | Moderately or greater active luminal Crohn's disease on colonoscopy | Use of systemic or rectal steroids for Crohn's disease within 2 weeks prior to screening/baseline | History of high-grade dysplasia, adenocarcinoma, or carcinoma in situ on colonoscopy within 5 years | Renal insufficiency: creatinine >1.8 mg/dL, eGFR <44 mL/min, or dialysis | Hemoglobin <8 g/dL | AST or ALT >2 x ULN | Unresolved abscess within the fistula tract | Coagulopathy (abnormal INR) or platelet count <75,000/µL | History of substance abuse interfering with protocol compliance
prior_therapies: Failed prior biologic or conventional therapy for perianal fistula; No investigational drug within 30 days prior to screening; No investigational device implanted near fistula region within 1 year prior to screening; No systemic or rectal steroids within 2 weeks prior to screening/baseline; No prior Cx601/Alofisel or other stem-cell therapy within 6 months
reasoning: Disease and setting match perianal fistulizing Crohn’s; age and sex fit. He has failed prior biologics (infliximab, ustekinumab), satisfying prior-therapy requirements, and no explicit exclusion is triggered by the provided data.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease; CDAI score 350; Refractory to infliximab; Refractory to ustekinumab; Active perianal fistula with draining seton in place; Recently completed IV antibiotics for perianal abscess
judge_comment: Disease matches and prior-therapy requirement matches, but there is a specific soft mismatch: the patient has moderate-to-severe luminal Crohn’s disease (CDAI 350), while the trial excludes moderately or greater active luminal disease (assessed by colonoscopy). Although not an explicit hard exclusion due to measurement modality, it is a clear stage/setting conflict, warranting D rather than A.

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. After 5 months, she had a new pleural effusion that was cytology positive for ovarian carcinoma. She was found to be BRCA1 positive. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1/2 Open Label, Dose Escalation and Expansion Study of MDNA11, IL-2 Superkine, Administered Alone or in Combination With Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

prior_therapies: Washout >= 4 weeks from prior systemic anti-cancer therapy (shorter interval may be considered for kinase inhibitors or short half-life drugs); Washout >= 2 weeks from prior radiotherapy; Washout >= 1 week for palliative radiotherapy (< 2 weeks of RT) to non-CNS disease; No radiation therapy to the lung > 30 Gy within 6 months prior to treatment; No participation in an investigational agent or device study within 4 weeks prior to treatment

patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; BRCA1 positive; Optimal debulking surgery performed; Received adjuvant carboplatin + paclitaxel + bevacizumab; Cytology-positive malignant pleural effusion at 5 months post-adjuvant

Prior therapy/line compatible with only washout required and no prohibited exposures. No soft conflicts identified; other criteria (ECOG, measurable disease) are unknown, not mismatches. ≥2 core anchors match, so A is appropriate.

He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
