question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1/1b Adaptive Dose Escalation Study of Mycophenolate Mofetil (MMF) in Combination With Standard of Care for Patients With Glioblastoma
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed glioblastoma, IDH wild-type (IHC R132H negative or sequencing); astrocytoma with molecular features of GBM eligible | Newly diagnosed glioblastoma with prior surgical resection or biopsy; cohort-specific requirements per Group 1-3 | Group 2: Documented MGMT-unmethylated glioblastoma | Group S: Newly suspected or recurrent glioblastoma and scheduled for standard-of-care surgical resection or biopsy | Stable or decreasing corticosteroids at <= 8 mg dexamethasone daily for >= 7 days prior to registration | Age >= 18 years | Karnofsky performance status >= 70% | WBC >= 3,000/µL (within 14 days) | ANC >= 1,500/µL (within 14 days) | Hemoglobin >= 8 g/dL (within 14 days) | Platelets >= 100,000/µL (within 14 days) | Total bilirubin <= 2 x ULN (within 14 days) | AST/ALT <= 3 x ULN (within 14 days) | Creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN (within 14 days) | INR <= 1.5 x ULN (within 14 days) | PT/PTT <= 1.5 x ULN (within 14 days) | Females of childbearing potential: negative pregnancy test within 14 days prior to registration
exclusion_criteria: Receiving other investigational agents (COVID-19 vaccine or treatment allowed) | Prior or concurrent malignancy that may interfere with study treatment or safety (per investigator discretion) | History of allergic reactions to temozolomide or mycophenolate mofetil or similar compounds | Spinal cord and diffuse leptomeningeal disease glioblastoma | Live vaccination within 2 weeks before initiation of MMF and/or TMZ | Current viral-vector based therapy | Uncontrolled epilepsy | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness | Concurrent malignancy outside of glioblastoma requiring tumor-directed treatment | Known hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT) deficiency (e.g., Lesch-Nyhan or Kelley-Seegmiller syndromes) | Known concurrent shingles, herpes, or cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection | Known concurrent opportunistic fungal infection | Known concurrent or history of unexplained opportunistic infection | Known immunodeficiency that could predispose to opportunistic infections | Psychiatric illness or social conditions limiting compliance or compromising safety | Pregnant or nursing | Unable to swallow oral medication or conditions affecting absorption of oral medication | Known history of HIV, HBV, or HCV infection
prior_therapies: Prior surgical resection or biopsy required for Groups 1-3; Group 1: Prior chemoradiation completed; Group 2: Surgical resection or biopsy only (no prior chemoradiation); Group 3: Surgical resection or biopsy only; Group S: Planned standard-of-care surgical resection or biopsy
reasoning: The patient has recurrent IDH-wildtype glioblastoma, matching the disease and biomarker requirements, and prior chemoradiation/temozolomide is compatible with trial cohorts. Age/sex fit; KPS, labs, steroid stability, and surgery planning are unknown but not conflicting.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Recurrent disease after standard therapy; ECOG 1; Age 40 years; Male; Prior gross total resection; Completed adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Completed adjuvant temozolomide
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Radiation therapy with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and IDH-wildtype match. However, stage/setting is uncertain because the recurrent cohort appears to require planned surgery (Group S), which is not provided; Groups 1–3 seem for newly diagnosed. Line/prior compatibility for the applicable recurrent cohort is therefore unknown. Only one clear core anchor (biomarker) matches, so B is appropriate rather than A.

question_text: A 32-year-old male has moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease, refractory to both infliximab and ustekinumab, with a CDAI score of 350. He recently completed IV antibiotic treatment for a perianal abscess and still has an active, draining seton in place. What are his clinical trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Guselkumab in Participants With Fistulizing, Perianal Crohn's Disease
inclusion_criteria: Diagnosis of Crohn's disease for >= 3 months | At least one active draining perianal fistula confirmed by screening MRI | Previously had inadequate initial response, loss of response, or intolerance to therapy from up to 2 classes of advanced drug therapies approved for Crohn's disease (e.g., infliximab, adalimumab, certolizumab pegol, vedolizumab or approved biosimilars) or a JAK inhibitor licensed for Crohn's disease (e.g., upadacitinib)
exclusion_criteria: Very severe luminal Crohn's disease activity | History of rectovaginal fistulas, rectal and/or anal stenosis, stoma or functioning ostomy, undrained abscess/collections, colonic mucosal dysplasia or pre-cancerous lesions not removed, demyelinating disease, or systemic lupus erythematosus | Complications of Crohn's disease anticipated to require surgery or preclude fistula evaluation (e.g., symptomatic strictures/stenoses, short gut syndrome) | Any medical contraindications preventing study participation | History of ongoing, chronic, or recurrent enteral or systemic infectious disease
prior_therapies: Prior exposure to up to 2 classes of advanced therapies for Crohn's disease (anti-TNF agents, vedolizumab, or JAK inhibitor such as upadacitinib); Documented inadequate response, loss of response, or intolerance to the above therapies
reasoning: Disease and setting match (active draining perianal fistula in Crohn's), and prior therapy exposure aligns (failed anti-TNF and another advanced class within the allowed up to 2 classes). Age/sex fit; MRI confirmation and absence of undrained abscess are unknown but not conflicting.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease; CDAI score 350; Refractory to infliximab; Refractory to ustekinumab; Active perianal fistula with draining seton in place; Recently completed IV antibiotics for perianal abscess
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches (perianal fistulizing Crohn’s). Stage/setting matches (active draining perianal fistula). Prior therapy exposure matches (failed anti-TNF and another advanced class; within up to two classes). Age/sex fit. Unknown MRI confirmation and abscess status are neutral per rubric. Thus ≥2 core anchors match with no soft conflicts → A. The grader’s reasoning aligns with the rubric.

question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. He has been on Osimertinib for 2 years with complete response. Unfortunately, began having headaches and recent MRI shows numerous lesions. Otherwise no past medical issues and ECOG 0. Are there any trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1/2, Open-label, Multi-center Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Anti-tumor Activity of JIN-A02 in Patients With EGFR Mutant Advanced Non-small Cell Lung Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years (>= 19 years in South Korea) | Pathologically confirmed advanced and/or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer with active EGFR mutation | Disease progression after standard therapy including an approved EGFR-TKI and/or up to 1 line of platinum-based chemotherapy | For Part C: prior approved EGFR-TKI active against T790M (e.g., osimertinib) required | Locally confirmed EGFR mutation by sponsor-approved test from tumor tissue and/or plasma ctDNA | Part A/B: EGFR C797S or EGFR T790M positive | Part C Cohort 1: EGFR C797S and T790M positive | Part C Cohort 2: EGFR C797S positive and T790M negative | Part C Cohort 3: EGFR T790M positive and C797S negative | Part C Cohort 4: any EGFR mutation with stable brain metastasis | Part C Cohort 5: EGFR-dependent mutation other than C797S or T790M | For Part C: at least one measurable lesion per RECIST v1.1 not previously irradiated | ECOG performance status 0–1 | Toxicities from prior therapy recovered to baseline or <= grade 1 (exceptions allowed for chronic <= grade 2 conditions per investigator) | Adequate bone marrow and organ function
exclusion_criteria: NSCLC with mixed squamous histology or histologic transformation (e.g., transition to small cell lung cancer or epithelial–mesenchymal transition) | For Part A/B and Part C Cohort 4: uncontrolled CNS metastases, leptomeningeal disease, or need for steroid escalation within 28 days (unless stable after local CNS therapy per protocol timeframe) | EGFR-TKI treatment within 7 days before first dose | Systemic anticancer therapy within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is shorter) before first dose | Limited field radiotherapy within 7 days or extended field chest radiotherapy within 14 days before first dose | Immunotherapy or other antibody therapy within 28 days before first dose | Not recovered from major surgery or its side effects within 28 days before first dose (excluding vascular access placement) | QTcF > 470 ms | Clinically significant and uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmia (e.g., type II second-degree or third-degree heart block) | Risk factors for QT prolongation or torsades de pointes (e.g., hypokalemia, congenital long QT, pertinent family history, or concomitant QT-prolonging drugs) | Uncontrolled hypertension: systolic blood pressure > 180 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure > 100 mmHg | Congestive heart failure NYHA class III–IV or hospitalization for heart failure within 6 months | Acute myocardial infarction or unstable angina within 6 months | Active second malignancy within 2 years (except adequately treated basal/squamous skin cancer or carcinoma in situ) | History/evidence of interstitial lung disease or steroid-requiring pneumonitis (COVID-19-related prior ILD may be eligible with approval) | Inability to swallow oral medication or significant gastrointestinal disorder causing malabsorption | Uncontrolled active infections including HIV, HBV, HCV, or tuberculosis | Known hypersensitivity to JIN-A02 or its components | History of drug abuse or unstable medical, mental, or social conditions interfering with study participation | Unable to comply with study procedures
prior_therapies: Progression after an approved EGFR-TKI; Up to one prior line of platinum-based chemotherapy; For Part C: prior osimertinib (or another T790M-active EGFR-TKI) required
reasoning: Metastatic NSCLC with an active EGFR mutation (exon 19 deletion) matches the disease/biomarker requirements, and prior osimertinib exposure aligns with Part C. Progression status and brain metastasis stability are unspecified but not stated as conflicting.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Metastatic non-small cell lung cancer; De novo metastatic disease; Bone metastases; Liver metastases; Brain metastases on MRI; EGFR exon 19 deletion; On osimertinib for 2 years; ECOG 0; No significant comorbidities
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches EGFR-mutant metastatic NSCLC. Core anchors: Stage/setting matches; Biomarker requirement (active EGFR mutation) matches. Line/prior progression requirement is unknown (not a soft mismatch). Brain metastasis stability is also unknown, not a soft mismatch. Thus ≥2 anchors match with no soft conflicts → A. The grader’s reasoning is acceptable.

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of Neoadjuvant Efineptakin Alfa (NT-I7) and Pembrolizumab in Recurrent Glioblastoma
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | WHO Grade IV IDH-wildtype glioblastoma or gliosarcoma with tissue-confirmed progressive or recurrent disease | Previously treated with maximal feasible resection or biopsy, radiation, and temozolomide | Enhancing mass on MRI amenable to resection or biopsy | ECOG performance status 0–1 | Karnofsky performance status >= 70
exclusion_criteria: Life-threatening raised intracranial pressure requiring immediate surgery | Bevacizumab use within <= 4 months prior to registration | Live vaccine within <= 30 days prior to registration | Requirement for dexamethasone dose > 2 mg/day within <= 2 days prior to registration | Failure to recover from adverse events of prior major surgery within <= 28 days | Failure to recover from adverse events of prior radiation therapy within <= 14 days | Severe uncontrolled systemic illness or condition that would interfere with study assessments | Known HIV infection | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (active infection, symptomatic CHF, unstable angina, cardiac arrhythmia, significant psychiatric or social illness) | Concurrent treatment with another investigational agent | Another active malignancy requiring systemic treatment within <= 1 year | Myocardial infarction within <= 6 months or congestive heart failure requiring maintenance therapy for life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias | Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment within <= 2 years | Concurrent known active hepatitis B and active hepatitis C infection | Known active tuberculosis | History of (non-infectious) pneumonitis or interstitial lung disease that required steroids, or current pneumonitis/interstitial lung disease | Hypersensitivity to pembrolizumab or its excipients | Prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1/PD-L2 therapy within < 12 months prior to registration | History of allogeneic tissue/solid organ transplant
prior_therapies: Prior maximal feasible resection or biopsy required; Prior radiation therapy required; Prior temozolomide required; No bevacizumab within 4 months prior to registration; No live vaccine within 30 days prior to registration; No major surgery within 28 days prior to registration; No radiation therapy within 14 days prior to registration; No prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1/PD-L2 therapy within 12 months prior to registration
reasoning: Recurrent IDH-wildtype glioblastoma after resection, radiation, and temozolomide with ECOG 1 matches the trial’s disease, setting, and prior-therapy requirements; age and sex are eligible and no exclusions (e.g., recent bevacizumab or prior PD-1) are indicated. Items like an enhancing lesion amenable to resection/biopsy and steroid dose are not provided and would need confirmation.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Recurrent disease after standard therapy; ECOG 1; Age 40 years; Male; Prior gross total resection; Completed adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Completed adjuvant temozolomide
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Radiation therapy with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches (recurrent IDH-wildtype GBM). Core anchors: Stage/setting (recurrent) matches; Line/prior-exposure (prior surgery, RT, temozolomide; no prior PD-1) matches; required biomarker (IDH-wildtype) satisfied. No identified soft conflicts; unknowns like resectability/steroid dose are neutral. Grade A is appropriate.

question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. He has been on Osimertinib for 2 years with complete response. Unfortunately, began having headaches and recent MRI shows numerous lesions. Otherwise no past medical issues and ECOG 0. Are there any trial options?
trial_title: Clinical Trial of CD40L-augmented Tumor Infiltrating Lymphocytes (CD40L TIL) for Patients With Oncogene-Driven Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Stage IV or recurrent non-small cell lung cancer | Activating genomic alteration in EGFR, ALK, ROS1, or ERBB2 | ECOG performance status 0–1 | Expected survival >= 4 months | Progression after >= 1 prior line of systemic therapy for NSCLC | Prior appropriate targeted therapy for the relevant genomic alteration | Measurable disease (excluding lesion used for TIL harvest) prior to nivolumab start | Safely accessible tumor for TIL harvest by excisional biopsy expected to yield >= 1.5 cm3 of tissue (aggregate) | Brain metastases allowed if treated or clinically stable <= 10 mm or not requiring immediate CNS-specific therapy | Adequate organ and marrow function | DLCO >= 45% predicted within past 4 months | HIV: on effective ART >= 6 months with undetectable viral load and normal CD4 count | Chronic HBV: undetectable viral load on suppressive therapy if indicated and no overt cirrhosis | HCV: treated and cured, or on treatment with undetectable viral load and no overt cirrhosis | Prior or concurrent malignancy allowed if it will not interfere with safety or efficacy assessment
exclusion_criteria: More than six prior lines of systemic therapy for NSCLC | Any prior PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor for metastatic NSCLC | Rapidly progressing tumors per investigator judgment | Active or prior documented autoimmune disease within the past 2 years (except allowed limited conditions with approval) | Active leptomeningeal or pachymeningeal metastases, or carcinomatous meningitis | Primary immunodeficiency | Chronic systemic steroid therapy or other immunosuppressive therapy within 7 days prior to enrollment (except allowed physiologic or topical/inhaled steroids) | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina, significant arrhythmia other than AF/SVT, >= 85% carotid artery stenosis) | Unresolved >= grade 2 toxicity from prior anticancer therapy (unless irreversible and not expected to be exacerbated) | QTc >= 480 ms (Bazett) | Active systemic infection requiring intravenous antibiotics within 1 week prior to nivolumab | History of allogeneic organ transplant | Psychiatric illness or social situation limiting compliance | History of anaphylaxis to beta-lactam antibiotics
prior_therapies: At least one prior line of systemic therapy for NSCLC required; Appropriate prior targeted therapy required for the relevant genomic alteration
reasoning: The patient has metastatic NSCLC with an activating EGFR exon 19 deletion, meeting the disease and biomarker requirements; age/ECOG fit and prior therapy (osimertinib) without PD-1 exposure aligns with trial expectations. Progression status and brain metastasis stability are unspecified but not explicit conflicts.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Metastatic non-small cell lung cancer; De novo metastatic disease; Bone metastases; Liver metastases; Brain metastases on MRI; EGFR exon 19 deletion; On osimertinib for 2 years; ECOG 0; No significant comorbidities
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches. Core anchors: Stage/setting (metastatic) matches; required biomarker (EGFR exon 19) matches. Line/prior compatibility largely fits (≥1 prior line with appropriate targeted therapy; no PD-1), though progression status is unknown and brain mets stability is unknown—neither is a soft mismatch. With ≥2 anchors matched and no soft conflicts, grade A is appropriate. The grader’s reasoning aligns with the rubric.

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. After 5 months, she had a new pleural effusion that was cytology positive for ovarian carcinoma. She was found to be BRCA1 positive. What are trial options?
trial_title: MC220601, Folate Receptor Alpha Dendritic Cells (FRαDCs) Plus Pembrolizumab for Patients With Advanced Stage Ovarian Cancer (FRAPPE)
diseases_targeted: Ovarian Carcinoma (recurrent); Ovarian Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Ovarian Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Ovarian High Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Ovarian Carcinosarcoma (recurrent); Fallopian Tube Carcinoma (recurrent); Fallopian Tube Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Fallopian Tube Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Fallopian Tube High Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Fallopian Tube Carcinosarcoma; Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma (recurrent); Primary Peritoneal Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Primary Peritoneal Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Primary Peritoneal High Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma (recurrent); Primary Peritoneal Carcinosarcoma (recurrent)
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Histologically confirmed recurrent epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal cancer (high grade serous, endometrioid, or clear cell; mixed carcinomas/carcinosarcomas eligible if >= 50% high grade serous and/or endometrioid and/or clear cell) | Platinum-refractory, platinum-resistant, or platinum-sensitive recurrence | Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1 and/or CA-125-evaluable disease by GCIG | ECOG performance status 0-1 | Hemoglobin >= 8.5 g/dL | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1000/µL | Platelet count >= 75000/µL | Lymphocytes >= 300/µL | Monocytes >= 250/µL | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN (if Gilbert's, direct bilirubin <= ULN) | AST <= 3 x ULN | Creatinine clearance >= 30 mL/min
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant or nursing | Persons of childbearing potential or able to father a child unwilling to use adequate contraception | Prior anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 therapy for ovarian cancer | IV anti-cancer therapy <= 3 weeks or oral anti-cancer therapy <= 1 week prior to registration | Grade >= 2 ovarian cancer-related symptoms, or lesion > 5 cm (non-nodal long axis or nodal short axis), or disease likely to become symptomatic within 8 weeks | Significant comorbid illness that would interfere with study treatment or assessments | Uncontrolled HIV infection; HIV must be well controlled on ART with CD4 >= 350/µL and suppressed HIV RNA | Ongoing or active serious infection requiring systemic therapy | Current or prior immune-related pneumonitis or interstitial lung disease requiring steroids | Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment within 2 years (except replacement therapy) | Active hepatitis B (unless on antivirals with undetectable HBV DNA) or active hepatitis C (unless successfully treated with undetectable HCV RNA) | Other active malignancy requiring palliative systemic therapy within 3 years or likely to require treatment in next 2 years (except non-melanoma skin cancer, papillary thyroid cancer not requiring therapy, or carcinoma in situ) | Myocardial infarction within 6 months or congestive heart failure requiring ongoing maintenance therapy for life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias | Systemic immunosuppressive medication within 7 days prior to registration (except permitted low-dose or inhaled steroids) | History of allogeneic stem cell transplant
prior_therapies: Any number of prior therapies or maintenance regimens for ovarian cancer allowed; Eligible regardless of platinum status (platinum-refractory, -resistant, or -sensitive); Washout required: last IV anti-cancer therapy >= 3 weeks; last oral anti-cancer therapy >= 1 week before registration
reasoning: Recurrent clear cell ovarian carcinoma matches the trial disease; the study permits recurrent cases regardless of platinum status, any prior therapies, and requires no prior PD-1 (which the patient hasn’t received), with age/sex in range. Measurable/CA-125-evaluable disease and symptom/lesion size details are unspecified but no conflicts are evident.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; BRCA1 positive; Optimal debulking surgery performed; Received adjuvant carboplatin + paclitaxel + bevacizumab; Cytology-positive malignant pleural effusion at 5 months post-adjuvant
patient_prior_therapies: Carboplatin; Paclitaxel; Bevacizumab; Optimal debulking surgery
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches (recurrent clear cell ovarian carcinoma). Stage/setting matches (recurrent). Line/prior exposure compatible (any prior allowed; no prior PD-1). Required histology/subtype satisfied. Other criteria (measurable/CA-125, symptom/lesion size) are unknown and per rubric should not penalize. Therefore ≥2 core anchors match with no soft conflicts → A.

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: Randomized Phase 2 Clinical Trial of Repeated Intratumoral and Cervical Perilymphatic Lerapolturev Injections Versus Lomustine in Recurrent Glioblastoma (GBM)
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Histopathologically confirmed recurrent supratentorial glioblastoma (WHO grade 4) | Karnofsky Performance Score >= 70% | Hemoglobin >= 9 g/dL prior to biopsy | Platelet count >= 100,000/µL prior to biopsy (unsupported) | Neutrophil count >= 1000/µL prior to biopsy | Creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN prior to biopsy | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN prior to biopsy (Gilbert's syndrome exception) | AST/ALT <= 2.5 x ULN | Prothrombin time and partial thromboplastin time <= 1.2 x ULN prior to biopsy | If on warfarin, INR < 2.0 prior to biopsy | Recurrent tumor presence confirmed by histopathology at time of biopsy prior to first lerapolturev infusion | Able to undergo brain MRI with and without contrast | Completed CDC-recommended poliovirus vaccination series and received IPV booster 1–6 weeks before lerapolturev (or evidence of anti-poliovirus immunity)
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant or breastfeeding | Impending, life-threatening cerebral herniation syndrome | Active infection requiring IV therapy or unexplained febrile illness (Tmax > 99.5°F/37.5°C) | Known immunosuppressive disease or HIV infection | Severe heart disease (NYHA class III or IV) | Known lung disease (FEV1 < 50%) or uncontrolled diabetes mellitus | Known albumin allergy | History of agammaglobulinemia | Chemotherapy or bevacizumab within 4 weeks (nitrosourea within 6 weeks; metronomic daily etoposide or cyclophosphamide within 1 week) prior to study drug unless recovered from toxicities | Immunotherapy within 4 weeks prior to study drug unless recovered from toxicities | Tumor treating fields within 1 week prior to study drug | Less than 12 weeks from radiation therapy unless progression outside field, two progressive scans >= 4 weeks apart, or histopathologic confirmation | Failure to complete standard-of-care treatments including surgery and radiation (age-adjusted dosing) | If MGMT promoter methylated or unknown, lack of at least one prior chemotherapy regimen | Neoplastic lesions in brainstem, cerebellum, or spinal cord | Active multifocal disease, extensive subependymal disease, tumor crossing midline, or leptomeningeal disease | Dexamethasone > 4 mg/day within 2 weeks prior to first lerapolturev infusion | Worsening steroid myopathy | Prior unrelated malignancy requiring current active treatment (except cervical carcinoma in situ and adequately treated basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer) | Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic immunomodulatory treatment within the past 3 months | Known hypersensitivity to lomustine, dacarbazine, or components of lomustine
prior_therapies: Maximal safe resection of recurrent tumor prior to study treatment; Completion of standard-of-care radiation therapy (age-adjusted dosing) prior to enrollment; If MGMT promoter methylated or unknown, at least one prior chemotherapy regimen required; Washout: chemotherapy or bevacizumab > 4 weeks (nitrosourea > 6 weeks; metronomic daily etoposide or cyclophosphamide > 1 week) before study drug; Washout: immunotherapy > 4 weeks before study drug; Washout: tumor treating fields > 1 week before study drug; Radiation therapy >= 12 weeks before study drug unless specified progression criteria met; Prior poliovirus vaccination series and IPV booster 1–6 weeks before lerapolturev
reasoning: Disease and setting match (recurrent GBM after standard chemoradiation), and prior therapy/exposure are compatible with trial requirements; age and sex are permitted. No explicit exclusions are triggered from available data, and no required biomarker constraints apply.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Recurrent disease after standard therapy; ECOG 1; Age 40 years; Male; Prior gross total resection; Completed adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Completed adjuvant temozolomide
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Radiation therapy with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease and recurrent setting match. Prior standard chemoradiation aligns with line/prior requirements. Biomarker/subtype (supratentorial location) is unknown, not a mismatch. No soft conflicts identified. Thus ≥2 core anchors (stage/setting and line/prior) match → A is appropriate.

question_text: A 55-year-old female has severe, seropositive rheumatoid arthritis refractory to methotrexate and two prior biologic agents (adalimumab and tocilizumab). She has active disease with a DAS28 score of 5.5. Critically, she has a history of treated Hepatitis B (HBsAg negative, anti-HBc positive) and moderate chronic kidney disease with an eGFR of 45 mL/min/1.73m². What are trial options for her?
trial_title: A Phase 2a, Open Label, Multicenter, Platform Trial to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy of Inebilizumab and Blinatumomab in Subjects With Autoimmune Diseases
diseases_targeted: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (lupus nephritis); Rheumatoid Arthritis (refractory)
inclusion_criteria: Subprotocols A/B: Systemic lupus erythematosus meeting 2019 EULAR/ACR classification criteria | Subprotocols A/B: Positive autoantibody at screening or documented history: ANA >= 1:80 or anti-dsDNA positive or anti-Smith positive | Subprotocols A/B: Active, biopsy-proven proliferative lupus nephritis class III or IV with/without class V features (2018 ISN/RPS) | Subprotocol A: Inadequate response, loss of response, or intolerance to >= 1 KDIGO-recommended therapy; UPCR >= 1.0 mg/mg | Subprotocol B: Inadequate response, loss of response, or intolerance to >= 2 KDIGO-recommended therapies; UPCR >= 1.0 mg/mg | Subprotocols A/B: If on background meds, stable doses prior to Day 1: prednisone <= 20 mg/day for 5 days; hydroxychloroquine <= 400 mg/day (or chloroquine/quinacrine) for 4 weeks; mycophenolate mofetil <= 3 g/day or mycophenolic acid <= 2160 mg/day for 2 weeks; azathioprine <= 2 mg/kg/day for 2 weeks | Subprotocol C: Rheumatoid arthritis meeting 2010 ACR/EULAR classification criteria | Subprotocol C: Active disease: DAS28-CRP > 3.2, >= 6 tender joints, and >= 6 swollen joints at screening | Subprotocol C: Refractory disease: prior treatment with >= 1 csDMARD and (>= 2 bDMARDs of different MOA OR >= 1 bDMARD and >= 1 tsDMARD) | Subprotocol C: Inadequate response despite >= 12 weeks of treatment with a csDMARD, bDMARD, or tsDMARD, or intolerance to these therapies
exclusion_criteria: Subprotocols A/B: eGFR < 30 mL/min (MDRD) | Subprotocols A/B: Significant likely irreversible SLE-related organ damage (e.g., ESRD) | Subprotocols A/B: Acute, severe lupus flare during screening requiring immediate treatment | Subprotocols A/B: Prior kidney transplant or planned transplant during study treatment period | Subprotocols A/B: Other renal diseases that could interfere with lupus nephritis assessment (e.g., diabetic nephropathy) | Subprotocols A/B: Renal biopsy showing pure class V lupus nephritis | Subprotocol C: Other inflammatory joint disease history/current (non-RA) or significant systemic involvement secondary to RA (e.g., vasculitis, pulmonary fibrosis, Felty's syndrome) | Subprotocol C: ACR Functional Class IV
prior_therapies: Lupus nephritis: prior inadequate response/loss of response/intolerance to >= 1 (Subprotocol A) or >= 2 (Subprotocol B) KDIGO-recommended therapies; Rheumatoid arthritis: prior >= 1 csDMARD and >= 2 bDMARDs of different MOA OR >= 1 bDMARD and >= 1 tsDMARD; Rheumatoid arthritis: prior exposure >= 12 weeks to csDMARD/bDMARD/tsDMARD or documented intolerance; Allowed background medications if stable: prednisone <= 20 mg/day; hydroxychloroquine <= 400 mg/day (or chloroquine/quinacrine); mycophenolate mofetil <= 3 g/day or mycophenolic acid <= 2160 mg/day; azathioprine <= 2 mg/kg/day
reasoning: Disease matches the RA subprotocol, with active, refractory RA and prior MTX plus ≥2 bDMARDs of different MOA; age and sex are within limits, and CKD (eGFR 45) and resolved HBV are not excluded for the RA cohort. Tender/swollen joint counts and DAS28-CRP specifically are not provided, but active disease is documented.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Seropositive rheumatoid arthritis; Active disease with DAS28 score of 5.5; History of treated Hepatitis B (HBsAg negative, anti-HBc positive); Moderate chronic kidney disease (eGFR 45 mL/min/1.73 m^2)
patient_prior_therapies: Refractory to methotrexate; Prior adalimumab; Prior tocilizumab; Failed two prior biologic agents
judge_comment: No hard exclusions: disease (RA) included; age/sex fit; no explicit exclusion for CKD eGFR 45 or resolved HBV in RA cohort. Core anchors: Stage/setting (active, refractory RA) matches; Line/prior-exposure (csDMARD + ≥2 bDMARDs of different MOA) matches. Required RA activity details (DAS28-CRP, joint counts) are partially unknown but not a soft mismatch. Thus A is appropriate.

question_text: A 32-year-old male has moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease, refractory to both infliximab and ustekinumab, with a CDAI score of 350. He recently completed IV antibiotic treatment for a perianal abscess and still has an active, draining seton in place. What are his clinical trial options?
trial_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial Evaluating the Safety and Feasibility of the Recombinant Human Platelet-derived Growth Factor B (rhPDGF-BB)-enhanced Collagen Plug for Complex Perianal Fistula Healing
inclusion_criteria: Single-tract perianal fistula not amenable to fistulotomy | Draining seton in place | Age >21 years

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. After 5 months, she had a new pleural effusion that was cytology positive for ovarian carcinoma. She was found to be BRCA1 positive. What are trial options?
trial_title: REJOICE-PanTumor01: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Open-Label, Pan-Tumor Trial to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Raludotatug Deruxtecan (R-DXd) in Participants With Advanced/Metastatic Solid Tumors
diseases_targeted: Endometrial Cancer; Cervical Cancer; Clear Cell Ovarian Carcinoma; Endometrioid Ovarian Cancer (low grade); Serous Ovarian Cancer (low grade); Mucinous Ovarian Cancer; Urothelial Carcinoma; Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | At least 1 lesion not previously irradiated | Lesion amenable to biopsy and willingness to provide a pre-treatment biopsy | Measurable disease per RECIST 1.1 | Radiographic progression on or after the most recent line of systemic therapy | ECOG performance status 0–1 | Endometrial cancer: Pathologically or cytologically documented endometrial carcinoma (any histology) or carcinosarcoma, irrespective of MSI/MMR status | Endometrial cancer: Disease progression after 1–3 prior lines including platinum-based chemotherapy and an anti-PD-1–containing regimen (combined or sequential) in the advanced/metastatic setting | Cervical cancer: Pathologically or cytologically documented recurrent or persistent squamous, adenosquamous, or adenocarcinoma of the cervix | Cervical cancer: Disease progression after >=1 prior line of systemic therapy in the advanced or metastatic setting | Non-HGS ovarian cancer: Pathologically or cytologically documented unresectable or metastatic clear cell, low-grade endometrioid, low-grade serous, or mucinous ovarian cancer previously treated with >=1 prior line | Urothelial cancer: Pathologically or cytologically documented unresectable or metastatic urothelial carcinoma of bladder, renal pelvis, ureter, or urethra; histologic variants allowed if predominantly urothelial | Urothelial cancer: Relapsed/progressed after >=1 prior line (maximum 3) that contained anti-PD-(L)1 therapy in the perioperative or metastatic setting | ccRCC: Pathologically or cytologically documented unresectable or metastatic clear cell renal cell carcinoma | ccRCC: Previously treated with <=3 prior systemic regimens for advanced/metastatic RCC, including both a PD-(L)1 checkpoint inhibitor and a VEGF-TKI in sequence or combination
exclusion_criteria: Clinically active brain metastases, spinal cord compression, or leptomeningeal carcinomatosis | Cerebrovascular accident, transient ischemic attack, or other arterial thromboembolic event within 6 months | Uncontrolled or significant cardiovascular disease | History of noninfectious ILD/pneumonitis requiring steroids, current ILD/pneumonitis, or suspected ILD/pneumonitis on screening imaging | Clinically severe pulmonary compromise | Chronic steroid treatment >10 mg/day (with protocol-specified exceptions) | History of other active malignancy within 3 years, except those with negligible risk and treated with expected curative outcome | Unresolved toxicities from prior anticancer therapy (except alopecia) not resolved to <= Grade 1 or baseline per NCI-CTCAE v5.0 | Prior exposure to CDH6-targeted agents or to an ADC with an exatecan derivative topoisomerase I inhibitor (e.g., trastuzumab deruxtecan, datopotamab deruxtecan) | Ongoing uncontrolled systemic bacterial, fungal, or viral infection | Active or uncontrolled HIV, HBV, or HCV infection
prior_therapies: Progression on or after the most recent line of systemic therapy; Endometrial cancer: 1–3 prior lines including platinum-based chemotherapy and an anti-PD-1–containing regimen; Cervical cancer: >=1 prior line of systemic therapy in advanced/metastatic setting; Non-HGS ovarian cancer: >=1 prior line of therapy; Urothelial cancer: >=1 prior line (max 3) including anti-PD-(L)1 therapy; ccRCC: <=3 prior systemic regimens including both a PD-(L)1 inhibitor and a VEGF-TKI
reasoning: Disease matches the clear cell ovarian carcinoma cohort, and the patient has recurrent/metastatic disease after prior systemic therapy (carboplatin/paclitaxel/bevacizumab), meeting stage/setting and prior-line requirements; age/sex also fit. Other requirements (RECIST-measurable disease, biopsy amenability, ECOG) are unknown but not conflicting.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; BRCA1 positive; Optimal debulking surgery performed; Received adjuvant carboplatin + paclitaxel + bevacizumab; Cytology-positive malignant pleural effusion at 5 months post-adjuvant
patient_prior_therapies: Carboplatin; Paclitaxel; Bevacizumab; Optimal debulking surgery

Stage/setting aligns (recurrent/metastatic with malignant pleural effusion), and prior systemic therapy received with progression afterward meets line/prior requirements. Other criteria (measurable disease, biopsy, ECOG) are unknown, not conflicting. ≥2 core anchors match with no soft mismatches, so A is appropriate.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: A Phase 1 First-in-Human, Open-Label, Multicenter Study of OP-3136 in Adult Participants With Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors
diseases_targeted: Breast Cancer (ER+ HER2-); Prostate Cancer (castration-resistant metastatic); Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (metastatic)
inclusion_criteria: Advanced or metastatic ER+ HER2- breast cancer (per cohort definitions) | Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer | Advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (Part 1 only) | Part 1A monotherapy: Unresectable or metastatic tumor with no life-prolonging options or intolerant/refractory to available therapies
exclusion_criteria: Prior therapy with a KAT6A/B inhibitor | Symptomatic visceral disease at risk of short-term life-threatening complications | Known active or symptomatic CNS metastases, carcinomatous meningitis, leptomeningeal disease, or spinal cord compression requiring CNS-directed therapy | CNS disease not clinically and radiologically stable for >= 2 months prior to first dose | Requirement for or current steroid therapy for CNS metastases | History of cerebrovascular disease, including transient ischemic attack, within 6 months prior to first dose | Impaired cardiac function or clinically significant cardiac disease within 6 months prior to first dose
prior_therapies: ER+ HER2- mBC Part 1B/Part 2B (combo with fulvestrant): Progressed on or after >=1 prior line including endocrine therapy and a CDK4/6 inhibitor in the advanced/metastatic setting; ER+ HER2- mBC Part 1B/Part 2B (combo with fulvestrant): No more than 2 prior lines of endocrine therapy in the advanced/metastatic setting (Part 2B); no more than 3 prior lines of endocrine therapy with >=1 line combined with a CDK4/6 inhibitor (Part 1B); ER+ HER2- mBC Part 1B: No more than 1 prior line of chemotherapy or an antibody-drug conjugate in the advanced/metastatic setting; ER+ HER2- mBC Part 2A monotherapy: Up to 3 prior lines of endocrine therapy (one with a CDK4/6 inhibitor) and up to 1 prior line of chemotherapy or an antibody-drug conjugate; mCRPC Part 2A monotherapy: Up to 4 prior lines of systemic therapy for prostate cancer; mCRPC Part 2A monotherapy: Prior treatment must include an androgen receptor pathway inhibitor
reasoning: Disease and stage match mCRPC; the trial requires prior AR pathway inhibitor exposure, which the patient has (enzalutamide and abiraterone). Age and gender fit, and no explicit exclusions are triggered by available data.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male; Castration-resistant prostate cancer; Metastatic disease; PSMA PET avid disease; Liver metastases; Bone metastases; Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga); Prior leuprolide (Lupron)

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. Completed adjuvant radiation + concurrent temozolomide and then adjuvant temozolomide. Three months after completing adjuvant therapy, MRI shows recurrence. ECOG 1 and no other medical issues. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase I Trial Combining Triapine With Radiation Therapy for Recurrent Glioblastoma or Astrocytoma
diseases_targeted: Recurrent Glioblastoma, IDH-Wildtype; Recurrent Astrocytoma, IDH-Mutant; Recurrent Diffuse Midline Glioma
inclusion_criteria: Histologically, molecularly, or cytologically confirmed recurrent astrocytic tumors: glioblastoma (IDH-wildtype) grade 2-4, astrocytoma (IDH-mutant) grade 2-4, or diffuse midline glioma (including pediatric-type H3K G34 or K27 mutant) | Tumor maximal diameter <= 6 cm | >= 6-month interval since last radiation therapy | Prior standard-dose radiation (approximately 59.4–60 Gy in 1.8–2 Gy fractions or equivalent) allowed | Non-standard RT dose or stereotactic radiosurgery allowed if new tumor outside prior field, histologic confirmation of tumor, or imaging consistent with true progression | Age >= 18 years | ECOG performance status <= 2 (Karnofsky >= 60%) | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1,500/µL | Hemoglobin >= 8 g/dL | Platelets >= 100,000/µL | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN | AST/ALT <= 3 x ULN | Creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN or GFR >= 50 mL/min | HIV-infected patients eligible if on effective ART with undetectable viral load within 6 months | Chronic HBV eligible if viral load undetectable on suppressive therapy | HCV eligible if treated and cured or on treatment with undetectable viral load | NYHA class II or better if cardiac risk factors or prior cardiotoxic therapy | Able to swallow whole capsules | Able to undergo MRI with contrast or adequate CT if MRI-incompatible | People of child-bearing potential: negative pregnancy test within 2 weeks of registration and agreement to use effective contraception during treatment and for 12 months after
exclusion_criteria: Residual toxicities > grade 1 from prior anti-cancer therapy (except alopecia) | Concurrent treatment with other investigational agents | Concomitant medications known to induce methemoglobinemia (e.g., sulfonamides, nitrofurans, antimalarials such as primaquine or chloroquine, cyclophosphamide, ifosfamide) | History of allergic reactions to compounds similar to triapine | Known G6PD deficiency | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness or active infections making participation hazardous | Pregnancy or breastfeeding
prior_therapies: Prior radiation therapy permitted; re-irradiation requires >= 6-month interval; Prior stereotactic radiosurgery permitted under protocol-defined criteria
reasoning: Disease and setting match (recurrent IDH‑wildtype glioblastoma post‑standard therapy), with age ≥18 and ECOG 1 meeting trial limits and no disallowed prior therapies; required biomarker is satisfied. Some criteria (tumor size ≤6 cm, ≥6 months since prior RT, labs) are unknown but not conflicting.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed glioblastoma; IDH wildtype; Recurrent disease after standard therapy; ECOG 1; Age 40 years; Male; Prior gross total resection; Completed adjuvant radiation with concurrent temozolomide; Completed adjuvant temozolomide
patient_prior_therapies: Gross total resection; Radiation therapy with concurrent temozolomide; Adjuvant temozolomide
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches (recurrent IDH-wildtype GBM) and stage/setting matches (recurrent). Required biomarker satisfied (IDH-wildtype). Line/prior exposure is compatible (prior RT/TMZ allowed). Unknowns like tumor size and interval since RT are not conflicts. Meets ≥2 core anchors without soft mismatches, so A is appropriate.

question_text: A 32-year-old male has moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease, refractory to both infliximab and ustekinumab, with a CDAI score of 350. He recently completed IV antibiotic treatment for a perianal abscess and still has an active, draining seton in place. What are his clinical trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 2a Study of Allogeneic Bone Marrow Mesenchymal Stem Cell Derived Extracellular Vesicle Isolate Product (DB-3Q) in Patients With Perianal Fistulizing Crohn's Disease
inclusion_criteria: Age 18-75 years | Crohn's Disease diagnosed for >= 6 months prior to Day 1 | Single and/or multi-tract perianal fistula(s) with 2 or fewer openings that are actively draining | Failed at least one medical therapy within the last year (e.g., antibiotics, immunomodulators, monoclonal antibodies, or small molecule inhibitors) | Previous failed surgical intervention (including seton placement >= 2 weeks prior to screening) or not a candidate for/willing to undergo surgical intervention | Medical therapy for Crohn's Disease stable for >= 2 months prior to Day 1
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant or breastfeeding | Woman of childbearing potential without a documented negative urine or serum pregnancy test | Active perianal abscess or infection at screening or Day 1 | Clinically significant medical conditions within 6 months before Day 1 that could compromise safety | Confirmed HIV infection | Confirmed Hepatitis B infection | Confirmed Hepatitis C infection | History of cancer, including melanoma, within 1 year of screening (except localized non-melanoma skin cancers) | History of colorectal cancer within 2 years of screening | Use of investigational therapy or treatment within 30 days prior to Day 1 | Unwilling to use medically acceptable contraception during the study
prior_therapies: Failed at least one prior medical therapy for Crohn's Disease within the last year; Previous failed surgical intervention for perianal fistula or not a candidate/willing; Current Crohn's Disease medical therapy stable for >= 2 months prior to Day 1; No investigational therapy within 30 days prior to Day 1
reasoning: Disease and setting match perianal fistulizing Crohn’s with an actively draining fistula and seton; age/sex are within limits, and prior failures of infliximab and ustekinumab satisfy the requirement for failed medical therapy. No explicit exclusion (e.g., active abscess at screening) is documented in the patient profile.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease; CDAI score 350; Refractory to infliximab; Refractory to ustekinumab; Active perianal fistula with draining seton in place; Recently completed IV antibiotics for perianal abscess
judge_comment: No hard exclusions identified. Disease matches perianal fistulizing Crohn’s, and two core anchors match: stage/setting (active perianal fistula with seton) and line/prior exposure (failed prior biologics satisfying failed medical therapy). Other specifics (e.g., timing within last year, stability of therapy, number of fistula openings) are unknown, not mismatches. Grader’s A is appropriate.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: Randomized Phase II Rescuing Cancer Immunotherapy With Plasma Exchange in Bladder Cancer 1 (ReCIPE-B1)
diseases_targeted: Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma (metastatic); Upper Tract Urothelial Carcinoma (metastatic)
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | Histologically proven urothelial carcinoma of the bladder or upper urinary tract | Disease progressed despite prior enfortumab vedotin and pembrolizumab treatment (primary or secondary progression allowed) | Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1 | ECOG performance status 0-2 | Hemoglobin > 7.0 g/dL (within 30 days) | Platelet count >= 75,000/µL (within 30 days) | ALT <= 3.5 x ULN (within 30 days) | AST <= 3.5 x ULN (within 30 days) | Total bilirubin <= 3 x ULN (within 30 days) | Direct bilirubin <= 3 x ULN (within 30 days) | Estimated GFR >= 15 mL/min (within 30 days)
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant | Breastfeeding | Persons of childbearing potential or able to father a child unwilling to use adequate contraception | Histologic variants/divergent differentiation including any neuroendocrine, micropapillary, or signet ring cell features | Active malignancy other than the study disease within 24 months (with specified exceptions) | Significant cardiovascular disease within 6 months (e.g., NYHA class >= III CHF, unstable angina, cardiac arrhythmia, myocardial infarction, ventricular fibrillation, Torsades de Pointes, cerebrovascular accident, transient ischemic attack) | Psychiatric illness or substance abuse that would limit compliance | Any condition that, in the investigator's opinion, would not be in the participant's best interest or could confound assessments
prior_therapies: Prior enfortumab vedotin and pembrolizumab with documented progression
reasoning: Metastatic urothelial carcinoma with documented progression after enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab matches the trial’s disease and required prior-exposure setting; age and sex are eligible. Renal function (eGFR 35 mL/min) meets the trial’s minimum (>=15), and no exclusions are apparent from the provided data.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial carcinoma; Progressing after second line therapy; Prior neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin (4 cycles); Prior enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab with progression after 6 cycles; Status post cystectomy with pathologic complete response; Age 55 years; Male; Chronic kidney disease with eGFR 35 mL/min; History of type 2 diabetes mellitus; History of COPD
patient_prior_therapies: Neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin; Cystectomy; Enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab
judge_comment: Disease matches metastatic urothelial carcinoma; stage/setting matches (metastatic) and line/prior-exposure matches (progressed after EV+pembrolizumab), giving ≥2 core anchors. No hard exclusions; eGFR 35 ≥15 meets trial criterion. Other eligibility items (ECOG, measurable disease, labs) are unknown and thus neutral. Grade A is appropriate.

question_text: A 32-year-old male has moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease, refractory to both infliximab and ustekinumab, with a CDAI score of 350. He recently completed IV antibiotic treatment for a perianal abscess and still has an active, draining seton in place. What are his clinical trial options?
trial_title: Autologous Stem Cell Transplantation with CD34-Selected Peripheral Blood Stem Cells (PBSC) in Pediatric and Adult Patients with Severe Crohn's Disease
inclusion_criteria: Age 10–60 years | Severe, refractory Crohn's Disease appropriate for stem cell transplant therapy | Prior surgery with severe recurrent disease despite aggressive maintenance therapy | Diffuse small bowel and colonic disease refractory to aggressive medical treatment and not eligible for surgery without high risk of short bowel syndrome or other contraindications to surgery | Persistently high disease activity: HBI > 6 or CDAI > 250 or PCDAI > 45, or moderate disease (HBI <= 6, CDAI < 250, PCDAI 30–45) requiring daily corticosteroids and aggressive medical treatment to maintain status | Resistant complications unresponsive to medical management (e.g., multiple enteric fistulas, enterovesicular or enterovaginal fistulas, severe perianal disease, debilitating arthritis, severe skin lesions such as pyoderma, severe bony complications such as aseptic necrosis or pathologic fractures) | Severe complications from medical therapy (e.g., pancreatitis from 6-mercaptopurine, colitis from 5-ASA, severe hypersensitivity to TNF-alpha inhibitors, anti-integrin agents, or anti-IL12/23 agents) | Stoma present is allowed | No surgical therapeutic option due to risk of short bowel syndrome or patient refusal | Harvey Bradshaw Index > 5, or CDAI > 250, or PCDAI > 30 | Platelet count > 100,000/µL | Absolute neutrophil count > 1500/µL | Creatinine <= 2.0 mg/dL | No history of coronary artery disease; LVEF >= 40% or shortening fraction >= 26% | FEV1/FVC >= 60% predicted; DLCO >= 60% predicted | Negative pregnancy test for females of childbearing potential | Agreement to use effective contraception during treatment and for up to 24 months after PBSC transplant or while on any medication that may harm a pregnancy
exclusion_criteria: No prior adequate dosing of 6-mercaptopurine, 5-ASA products, and metronidazole | Sustained corticosteroid-free response to anti-TNF-alpha, anti-integrin, or anti-IL12/23 therapy after a 4-month course | Toxic megacolon | Intestinal perforation | Conjugated bilirubin > 2.0 mg/dL | Pregnancy or nursing | HIV seropositive, HTLV seropositive, HBsAg positive, or HCV RNA positive by PCR | Active infection within two weeks of mobilization and high-dose chemotherapy | Other significant medical problems or abnormal findings that increase risk, interfere with compliance, or impact data quality in the investigator's opinion
prior_therapies: Prior adequate dosing of 6-mercaptopurine, 5-ASA products, and metronidazole required; Prior surgery allowed
reasoning: Disease and setting match: a 32-year-old with severe, refractory fistulizing Crohn's disease (CDAI 350) and perianal involvement fits the trial’s inclusion profile. However, eligibility requires prior adequate dosing of 6-mercaptopurine, 5-ASA, and metronidazole (not documented) and absence of active infection within two weeks, making prior-therapy and timing criteria uncertain.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease; CDAI score 350; Refractory to infliximab; Refractory to ustekinumab; Active perianal fistula with draining seton in place; Recently completed IV antibiotics for perianal abscess
judge_comment: No hard exclusions: disease, age, and sex match; required prior meds status is unknown, not a conflict. One core anchor clearly matches (severe/refractory setting). Line/prior exposure compatibility is uncertain, with no soft mismatch identified. Thus B is appropriate and the grader’s reasoning aligns with the rubric.

question_text: A 55-year-old female has severe, seropositive rheumatoid arthritis refractory to methotrexate and two prior biologic agents (adalimumab and tocilizumab). She has active disease with a DAS28 score of 5.5. Critically, she has a history of treated Hepatitis B (HBsAg negative, anti-HBc positive) and moderate chronic kidney disease with an eGFR of 45 mL/min/1.73m². What are trial options for her?
trial_title: Persona The Personalized Knee System TKA Outcomes Study: Prospective Multicenter Study of the Persona Knee System
diseases_targeted: Osteoarthritis; Rheumatoid Arthritis; Traumatic Arthritis; Polyarthritis; Avascular Necrosis of the Femoral Condyle
inclusion_criteria: Age 18-75 years | Severe knee pain/disability due to rheumatoid arthritis | Severe knee pain/disability due to osteoarthritis | Severe knee pain/disability due to traumatic arthritis | Severe knee pain/disability due to polyarthritis | Severe knee pain/disability due to collagen disorders | Severe knee pain/disability due to avascular necrosis of the femoral condyle | Post-traumatic loss of joint configuration (e.g., patellofemoral erosion/dysfunction or prior patellectomy) | Moderate valgus deformity | Moderate varus deformity | Moderate flexion deformity | Salvage of previously failed surgical attempts not including prior partial or total knee arthroplasty of the ipsilateral knee | Candidate for Persona fixed bearing knee components implanted per product labeling
exclusion_criteria: Previous infection in the affected joint or other local/systemic infection that may affect the prosthetic joint | Insufficient bone stock on femoral or tibial surfaces | Skeletal immaturity | Neuropathic arthropathy | Osteoporosis compromising the affected limb | Loss of musculature or neuromuscular disease compromising the affected limb | Stable, painless arthrodesis in a satisfactory functional position | Severe instability due to absence of collateral ligament integrity | Rheumatoid arthritis with a skin ulcer or recurrent skin breakdown | Known or suspected sensitivity or allergy to implant materials | Pregnant | Prior partial or total knee arthroplasty of the ipsilateral knee
prior_therapies: (none)
reasoning: Disease and age match with no conflicts from prior therapies or biomarkers; however, the trial requires severe knee pain/disability and candidacy for total knee arthroplasty, which are not specified for this patient, leaving the key setting unknown.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Seropositive rheumatoid arthritis; Active disease with DAS28 score of 5.5; History of treated Hepatitis B (HBsAg negative, anti-HBc positive); Moderate chronic kidney disease (eGFR 45 mL/min/1.73 m^2)
patient_prior_therapies: Refractory to methotrexate; Prior adalimumab; Prior tocilizumab; Failed two prior biologic agents
judge_comment: No hard exclusions. Disease matches but core anchors are unknown/not matched: stage/setting (TKA candidacy and severe knee pain) is unspecified; line/prior is irrelevant/unspecified; no biomarker or mets constraints. Age is not a core anchor. With 0 anchors matched and no soft conflicts, the correct grade is C, not B.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: INTense ExeRcise for SurviVAL Among Men with Metastatic Prostate Cancer (INTERVAL - GAP4): a Multicentre, Randomised, Controlled, Phase III Study
inclusion_criteria: Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC): adenocarcinoma with systemic metastatic disease despite castrate testosterone (<50 ng/dL). | mCRPC progression by measurable disease: >20% increase in sum of diameters or new lesion(s). | mCRPC progression by bone scan: new lesion(s) attributable to prostate cancer. | mCRPC progression by PSA: PSA >= 2 ng/mL with three rising values at least 1 week apart (PSA1 < PSA2 < PSA3). | mCRPC progression by PSMA PET/CT: new lesion(s) attributable to prostate cancer. | mCRPC treatment status category allowed: treatment-naive for mCRPC (<=4 weeks on approved therapies still considered naive). | mCRPC treatment status category allowed: on abiraterone/enzalutamide/apalutamide with stable or declining PSA after >=4 weeks. | mCRPC treatment status category allowed: PSA progression on abiraterone/enzalutamide/apalutamide if asymptomatic and no intent to start chemotherapy within 6 months. | mCRPC treatment status category allowed: prior first-line docetaxel/cabazitaxel or other approved chemotherapy for mCRPC if asymptomatic without evidence of progression. | mCRPC treatment status category allowed: progressed after first-line docetaxel/cabazitaxel and now on abiraterone/enzalutamide/apalutamide with stable or responding PSA; life expectancy >1 year. | Metastatic hormone-sensitive prostate cancer (mHSPC): high-risk (>=2 of: Gleason score >=8; >=3 bone lesions; measurable visceral lesions) or high-volume (visceral metastases and/or >=4 bone metastases with >=1 outside vertebral column/pelvis). | On androgen deprivation therapy during study or prior bilateral orchiectomy. | >=4 weeks since last major surgery and fully recovered. | Halabi Nomogram score < 1951 (low or intermediate risk). | Age >= 18 years. | ECOG performance status 0-1. | Medical clearance to undergo symptom-limited cardiopulmonary exercise test and vigorous aerobic and resistance training; able to complete an acceptable cardiopulmonary exercise test.
exclusion_criteria: Small cell neuroendocrine prostate cancer or features of small cell disease. | Known contraindications to high-intensity exercise (e.g., brain metastases; current congestive heart failure NYHA class II–IV; serious or non-healing wound, ulcer, or bone fracture; spinal cord compromise or instrumentation due to metastatic disease; peripheral neuropathy >= grade 3). | Serious cardiovascular events within 12 months (e.g., transient ischemic attack, cerebrovascular accident, myocardial infarction). | Uncontrolled hypertension (blood pressure >=160/90). | Engaging in vigorous aerobic exercise >60 minutes/week or structured resistance exercise >=2 days/week.

question_text: 40 year old man with recurrent glioblastoma. Diagnosed 1 year ago, underwent gross total resection with confirmation of GBM, IDH wildtype. prior_therapies: At least 2 weeks since last targeted therapy, chemotherapy, or radiation before PBMC collection; At least 6 weeks since nitrosourea chemotherapy before CAR T infusion; At least 23 days since temozolomide before CAR T infusion; At least 4 weeks since other non-nitrosourea cytotoxic chemotherapy before CAR T infusion; At least 2 weeks since last targeted agent before CAR T infusion (at least 4 weeks for bevacizumab)

prior_therapies: Prior docetaxel allowed; Prior paclitaxel allowed if no progression on therapy and no relapse within 6 months after completing therapy; persistent disease at completion of primary paclitaxel is not eligible; Discontinue hormonal therapy directed at the tumor >= 2 weeks before first dose; Discontinue prior anti-tumor therapy, including immunologic agents, >= 4 weeks before first dose (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C)

question_text: A 32-year-old male has moderate-to-severe fistulizing Crohn's disease, refractory to both infliximab and ustekinumab, with a CDAI score of 350. trial_title: A Phase 2a, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Double-blind Study to Assess the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of AGMB-129 in Patients With Fibrostenotic Crohn's Disease

question_text: I have a 62-year-old male patient diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) 14 months ago. He has limb-onset disease and an ALSFRS-R score of 38. His forced vital capacity (FVC) is stable at 85% of predicted. He is currently taking riluzole. What trial options are available?

trial_title: A Phase I/II Study of E7389 Halichondrin B Analog (NSC # 707389) in Metastatic Urothelial Tract Cancer and Renal Insufficiency
inclusion_criteria: Locally advanced or metastatic urothelial cancer not amenable to surgical treatment | Histologically or cytologically confirmed urothelial tract carcinoma | Measurable disease (>= 20 mm by conventional imaging or >= 10 mm by spiral CT) | Up to two prior lines of chemotherapy for recurrent/advanced disease allowed | Received at least one platinum-based chemotherapy for recurrent/advanced disease | For a specified cohort, prior tubulin inhibitor therapy required (e.g., paclitaxel, docetaxel, or vinblastine) | Women with or without prior therapy eligible | Life expectancy > 6 months | ECOG performance status 0-2 or Karnofsky >= 60% | Absolute neutrophil count >= 1,000/µL | Platelets >= 100,000/µL | Hemoglobin >= 9 g/dL | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN | AST/ALT <= 2.5 x ULN | Renal function: creatinine <= 1.5 x ULN or creatinine clearance >= 60 mL/min, or moderate/severe renal dysfunction with creatinine clearance >= 20 mL/min
exclusion_criteria: Concurrent treatment with other investigational agents | Unstable or untreated brain metastases | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (including active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina, clinically significant arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social conditions limiting compliance) | Pregnant or breastfeeding | HIV-positive on combination antiretroviral therapy | HIV-positive with CD4+ <= 500/mm3 | Prior therapy with eribulin | Symptomatic uremia, uncontrolled edema, or unstable serum electrolytes not stabilized prior to enrollment
prior_therapies: Prior platinum-based chemotherapy for recurrent/advanced disease required; Up to two prior lines of chemotherapy for recurrent/advanced disease allowed; Prior tubulin inhibitor required for a specified cohort (e.g., paclitaxel, docetaxel, vinblastine)

patient_inclusion_criteria: Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial carcinoma; Progressing after second line therapy; Prior neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin (4 cycles); Prior enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab with progression after 6 cycles; Status post cystectomy with pathologic complete response; Age 55 years; Male; Chronic kidney disease with eGFR 35 mL/min; History of type 2 diabetes mellitus; History of COPD

diseases_targeted: Ovarian Epithelial Cancer (Stage III–IV); Fallopian Tube Cancer (Stage III–IV); Primary Peritoneal Cancer (Stage III–IV); Ovarian Serous Cystadenocarcinoma; Ovarian Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma; Ovarian Clear Cell Carcinoma; Ovarian Mixed Epithelial Carcinoma; Ovarian Undifferentiated Adenocarcinoma; Brenner Tumor

exclusion_criteria: Known diabetes mellitus or fasting glucose > 126 mg/dL or random glucose > 140 mg/dL | Current use of metformin, sulfonylureas, thiazolidinediones, or insulin | Use of other investigational agents | Comorbidities with expected survival < 2 years unrelated to ovarian cancer | Concurrent active invasive malignancy or prior malignancy with > 30% risk of recurrence within 2 years | Allergy to metformin or compounds of similar composition | NYHA class III or IV heart failure | History of any acidosis | Alcoholic liver disease | Habitual intake of >= 3 alcoholic beverages per day | Uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., active major infection, unstable angina, symptomatic CHF, significant arrhythmia, psychiatric illness limiting compliance) | Pregnant or nursing | Mucinous adenocarcinoma or borderline tumors | Planned intraperitoneal chemotherapy | Neoadjuvant chemotherapy without planned interval debulking surgery (assuming adequate response) | Planned chemotherapy regimens not specified in the protocol | Participation in other interventional trials to reduce ovarian cancer recurrence or planned off-protocol maintenance therapy (e.g., paclitaxel or bevacizumab)

question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. inclusion_criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed stage IV ALK-positive non-squamous NSCLC | ALK rearrangement demonstrated by FDA-approved assay (FISH or IHC) or by NGS | Willing and able to undergo a fresh biopsy or provide recent post-progression biopsy with sufficient tissue | Progressive disease per RECIST 1.1 after exactly one second-generation ALK inhibitor (ceritinib, alectinib, ensartinib, or brigatinib) | Prior crizotinib allowed; the second-generation ALK inhibitor must be the last treatment before enrollment | No prior chemotherapy except one prior cycle at initial metastatic diagnosis without progression; adjuvant/neoadjuvant chemotherapy allowed if last dose >12 months before enrollment | ANC >= 1500/µL within 28 days prior to Step 2 | Platelets >= 100000/µL within 28 days prior to Step 2 | Creatinine clearance >= 60 mL/min within 28 days prior to Step 2 | Total bilirubin <= 1.5 x ULN within 28 days prior to Step 2 (except Gilbert's syndrome) | AST <= 2.5 x ULN within 28 days prior to Step 2 (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastases) | ALT <= 2.5 x ULN within 28 days prior to Step 2 (<= 5 x ULN with liver metastases) | Asymptomatic treated or untreated brain metastases allowed; measurable extracranial target lesion required if brain metastases present; stable/decreasing steroids for >= 7 days | ECOG performance status 0-2 | Acute effects of prior therapy resolved to baseline or CTCAE <= 1 (except alopecia, hearing loss) | Able to take oral medications
exclusion_criteria: Prior lorlatinib (third-generation ALK inhibitor) | Major surgery within 2 weeks before study entry | Palliative radiotherapy (< 10 fractions) within 48 hours before study entry | Stereotactic/small field brain irradiation within 1 week before study entry | Whole brain or other palliative radiotherapy within 2 weeks before study entry | Dose of next-generation ALK inhibitor (ceritinib, alectinib, ensartinib, lorlatinib) within 5 days before Step 2; brigatinib within 7 days before Step 2 | History of interstitial lung disease or interstitial fibrosis (including pneumonitis, obliterative bronchiolitis, pulmonary fibrosis) | Active inflammatory gastrointestinal disease or conditions affecting absorption (e.g., Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis), chronic diarrhea, symptomatic diverticular disease | Clinically significant cardiovascular disease (e.g., uncontrolled hypertension, NYHA class 3 heart failure, unstable angina, poorly controlled arrhythmia, recent MI within 6 months) | Active and clinically significant bacterial, fungal, or viral infection | Active or chronic pancreatitis | Other serious illness or organ dysfunction that could compromise safety or study drug evaluation | Planned receipt of other investigational agents during therapy | Active malignancy other than ALK-positive NSCLC within 2 years, except specified adequately treated cancers | No chemotherapy and/or immunotherapy allowed after Step 1 registration | Pregnant or breastfeeding
prior_therapies: Progression after one second-generation ALK inhibitor required (ceritinib, alectinib, ensartinib, or brigatinib); Prior crizotinib allowed; No prior lorlatinib allowed; No prior chemotherapy except one cycle at initial metastatic diagnosis without progression; Prior adjuvant or neoadjuvant chemotherapy allowed if last dose > 12 months before enrollment; No chemotherapy or immunotherapy permitted after Step 1 registration
reasoning: Stage and setting match and brain metastases are allowed, but the trial requires ALK-positive NSCLC with progression after exactly one second-generation ALK inhibitor. The patient has EGFR exon 19 disease treated with osimertinib and no ALK inhibitor exposure documented, so the line-of-therapy requirement is not met.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Metastatic non-small cell lung cancer; De novo metastatic disease; Bone metastases; Liver metastases; Brain metastases on MRI; EGFR exon 19 deletion; On osimertinib for 2 years; ECOG 0; No significant comorbidities

However, there is a clear soft mismatch on line-of-therapy/prior exposure because the trial requires progression after exactly one second-generation ALK inhibitor, and the patient has only received osimertinib (EGFR TKI). Per rubric, a specific soft mismatch on a core anchor yields D. The grader’s reasoning aligns with this.
