diseases_targeted: Alzheimer Dementia; Vascular Dementia; Frontotemporal Dementia; Dementia with Lewy Bodies
inclusion_criteria: Diagnosis of Alzheimer's dementia per NIA-AA criteria | Diagnosis of vascular dementia with MRI evidence of microvascular ischemic disease and no clinical/radiologic evidence of stroke | Diagnosis of frontotemporal dementia | Diagnosis of dementia with Lewy bodies | Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) <= 15 | Cohen-Mansfield Agitation Inventory (CMAI) threshold for severe agitation as specified | At least one failed pharmacological intervention to manage behavioral symptoms | Medically stable for safe ECT based on physical exam, urinalysis, and serum chemistries (and brain imaging when indicated) | Comprehension of English | Authorized legal representative able and willing to provide informed consent | Age >= 40 years
exclusion_criteria: Current co-morbid delirium by Confusion Assessment Method (CAM) or clinical diagnosis | Vascular dementia due to stroke (abrupt onset, step-wise decline, MRI evidence of hemorrhagic/embolic stroke, or exam consistent with current/prior stroke) | Schizophrenia | Bipolar disorder | Schizoaffective disorder | Active substance use disorder within the past 6 months | Treatment with ECT, transcranial magnetic stimulation, or vagal nerve stimulation within the past 3 months
prior_therapies: At least one failed pharmacological intervention for behavioral symptoms
reasoning: The trial requires severe agitation with MMSE ≤15 and at least one failed pharmacologic intervention for behavioral symptoms; the patient has MMSE 19 and no prior behavioral therapy documented. Disease subtype and agitation severity are not specified, though age and sex fit.
patient_biomarkers: Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 68 years; Male; Progressive cognitive decline for 2 years; MMSE score 19; Moderate-stage dementia; Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
judge_comment: Hard exclusions apply: the trial requires MMSE ≤15 (patient MMSE is 19) and at least one failed pharmacologic intervention for behavioral symptoms (patient has none). These are required criteria the patient definitively lacks, triggering F. The grader identified these issues but incorrectly issued D instead of F.

question_text: I have a 62-year-old male patient diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) 14 months ago. He has limb-onset disease and an ALSFRS-R score of 38. His forced vital capacity (FVC) is stable at 85% of predicted. He is currently taking riluzole. What trial options are available?
trial_title: A Single-Center, Open Label Study to Assess the Safety and Tolerability of Metformin in Subjects With C9orf72 Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis Over 24 Weeks of Treatment
inclusion_criteria: Probable or definite ALS per Revised El Escorial criteria | C9orf72 repeat expansion positive (ALS/FTD) | Able to take oral diet, pills, and liquids; FOIS >= 4 | No known allergy to barium sulfate or metformin | Currently taking or previously taken metformin | Females of childbearing potential: negative urine pregnancy test prior to VFSS exams
exclusion_criteria: FOIS <= 3 | Does not carry the C9orf72 hexanucleotide repeat expansion | Clinically significant liver disease, renal disease, or other exclusionary medical condition | Pregnant, attempting to become pregnant, or breastfeeding | Active cancer within the previous 2 years (except treated basal cell carcinoma of the skin) | Use of any investigational drug within 30 days prior to enrollment or within 5 half-lives, whichever is longer | eGFR < 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 | Hepatic impairment: serum aminotransferases > 5 x ULN or evidence of liver dysfunction (e.g., elevated bilirubin) | Use of potentially hepatotoxic drugs (e.g., allopurinol, methyldopa, sulfasalazine) | Clinically significant abnormal laboratory values per investigator | Implanted electrical device or metallic clips contraindicating MRI
prior_therapies: Current or prior metformin use allowed
reasoning: The trial requires participants to be currently taking or to have previously taken metformin, but the patient has no documented metformin exposure. C9orf72-positive status and FOIS/swallowing ability are not reported, so those remain uncertain rather than exclusions.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS); Limb-onset disease; ALSFRS-R score 38; Forced vital capacity (FVC) 85% of predicted; Currently taking riluzole; Time since diagnosis 14 months; Age 62 years; Male sex
judge_comment: No hard exclusions apply (age, sex, disease match; C9orf72 status unknown, not a hard fail). There is a clear soft mismatch on the Line/prior-exposure anchor because the trial requires current or prior metformin use and the patient has none. Other requirements (C9orf72+, FOIS) are unknown. Thus D is correct.

question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. He has been on Osimertinib for 2 years with complete response. Unfortunately, began having headaches and recent MRI shows numerous lesions. Otherwise no past medical issues and ECOG 0. Are there any trial options?
trial_title: An Open-label, Multicenter, Multicohort, Phase 2 Study to Evaluate Enfortumab Vedotin in Subjects With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Malignant Solid Tumors (EV-202)
diseases_targeted: Breast Cancer (HR+/HER2-); Triple Negative Breast Cancer; Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer; Non-squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer; Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma; Gastric Adenocarcinoma; Gastroesophageal Junction Adenocarcinoma; Esophageal Adenocarcinoma; Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: Adult per local regulations | Measurable disease by RECIST 1.1 | Archival tumor tissue available or agree to biopsy (unless unsafe) | ECOG performance status 0–1 | Baseline labs meet protocol thresholds | Evidence of progression on or after last regimen | Locally advanced or metastatic disease not amenable to curative treatment | Cohort 1 (HR+/HER2- breast cancer): Histologically/cytologically confirmed HR+/HER2- and not a candidate for further hormonal therapy (ER and/or PR >= 1% per ASCO/CAP) | Cohort 1: Prior taxane or anthracycline in neoadjuvant/adjuvant or advanced setting | Cohort 1: >=1 prior standard cytotoxic regimen in advanced setting and <=2 prior cytotoxic lines in advanced setting; progressed/relapsed or discontinued for toxicity; prior endocrine and/or CDK inhibitor therapy with progression/toxicity (CDK inhibitor not required) | Cohort 2 (TNBC): Histologically/cytologically confirmed TNBC (ER-/PR- <1%, HER2 0–1+ or 2+ and FISH negative) | Cohort 2: Prior taxane or anthracycline; >=1 prior standard cytotoxic regimen in advanced setting and <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 per guidelines with progression/toxicity or contraindicated | Cohort 3 (Squamous NSCLC): Histologically/cytologically confirmed squamous NSCLC; mixed histology allowed if no neuroendocrine component; actionable mutations allowed if treated and progressed/toxic | Cohort 3: Progressed/relapsed or discontinued due to toxicity after 1 platinum-based regimen for advanced disease; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines in advanced setting; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 per guidelines with progression/toxicity or contraindicated | Cohort 4 (Non-squamous NSCLC): Histologically/cytologically confirmed non-squamous NSCLC; mixed histology allowed if no neuroendocrine component; actionable mutations allowed if treated and progressed/toxic | Cohort 4: Progressed/relapsed or discontinued due to toxicity after 1 platinum-based regimen for advanced disease; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines in advanced setting; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 per guidelines with progression/toxicity or contraindicated | Cohort 5 (Head and neck cancer, 2L+): Histologically/cytologically confirmed head and neck cancer of oral cavity, oropharynx, hypopharynx, or larynx (non-nasopharyngeal) | Cohort 5: Progressed/relapsed or discontinued due to toxicity after 1 platinum-based regimen for advanced disease; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 per guidelines with progression/toxicity or contraindicated | Cohorts 6–8 (Gastric/GEJ/esophageal): Histologically/cytologically confirmed gastric, GEJ, or esophageal cancer; progressed/relapsed or discontinued due to toxicity after 1 platinum-based regimen for advanced disease; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; HER2+ must have received HER2-directed therapy; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 per guidelines with progression/toxicity or contraindicated | Cohort 9 (1L HNSCC): Histologically/cytologically confirmed HNSCC of oral cavity, oropharynx, hypopharynx, or larynx (non-nasopharyngeal) | Cohort 9: Recurrent or metastatic and incurable by local therapy | Cohort 9: PD-L1 CPS >= 1 by local or central IHC | Cohort 9: No prior systemic therapy for recurrent/metastatic disease (allowed if >6 months since completion of systemic therapy given for locally advanced disease); prior PD-1/PD-L1 in curative setting allowed if >=12 months since last dose | Cohort 9: ANC >= 1.5 x 10^9/L | Cohort 9: INR or PT and aPTT <= 1.5 x ULN (unless on therapeutic anticoagulation) | Cohort 9: For oropharynx tumors, HPV status by p16 testing available
exclusion_criteria: Preexisting sensory or motor neuropathy >= Grade 2 | Active CNS metastases unless clinically stable >=6 weeks, on <=20 mg/day prednisone equivalent if needed, no new/enlarged lesions, and no leptomeningeal disease | Ongoing clinically significant toxicity >= Grade 2 from prior therapy (except alopecia) | Ongoing >= Grade 3 immunotherapy-related hypothyroidism or panhypopituitarism; history of immunotherapy-related colitis, uveitis, myocarditis or pneumonitis; or immunotherapy-related AEs requiring >20 mg/day prednisone equivalent | Uncontrolled diabetes within 3 months (HbA1c >= 8% or 7% to <8% with diabetes symptoms) | Prior treatment with enfortumab vedotin or other MMAE-based ADCs | Second malignancy within 3 years or residual disease from prior malignancy (exceptions apply) | Active systemic infection requiring treatment; active hepatitis B or C; known HIV infection | Recent significant cardiovascular event within 6 months (stroke/TIA, unstable angina, MI, or NYHA III–IV heart failure) | Major surgery within 4 weeks before first dose | Prior radiotherapy, chemotherapy, biologics, investigational agents, or immunotherapy not completed >= 2 weeks before first dose | Known hypersensitivity to enfortumab vedotin or CHO cell products/excipients | Active keratitis or corneal ulcerations (adequately treated superficial punctate keratitis allowed) | Any condition that makes the subject unsuitable for study participation | Cohort 9: Disease progression within 6 months of completing curative systemic therapy for locoregionally advanced HNSCC | Cohort 9: Prior allogeneic tissue/solid organ transplant | Cohort 9: Severe hypersensitivity (>= Grade 3) to pembrolizumab or its excipients | Cohort 9: History of non-infectious pneumonitis/ILD requiring steroids or current pneumonitis/ILD | Cohort 9: Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia, drug-induced/idiopathic pneumonitis, or active pneumonitis on screening CT | Cohort 9: Life expectancy < 3 months or rapidly progressing disease per investigator | Cohort 9: Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment in past 2 years (specified exceptions allowed) | Cohort 9: Active infection requiring systemic therapy | Cohort 9: Prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy in the recurrent/metastatic setting (if given as curative therapy, must be >= 1 year since last dose) | Cohort 9: Live vaccine within 30 days before start of therapy | Cohort 9: Active tuberculosis
prior_therapies: Breast cancer (HR+/HER2- or TNBC): Prior taxane or anthracycline in neoadjuvant/adjuvant or advanced setting; Breast cancer HR+: >=1 prior cytotoxic regimen in advanced setting; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; progression after endocrine therapy and/or CDK inhibitor (CDK inhibitor not required); TNBC: >=1 prior cytotoxic regimen in advanced setting; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 with progression/toxicity or contraindicated; Squamous and non-squamous NSCLC: Progressed/relapsed or toxic after 1 platinum-based regimen for advanced disease; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 with progression/toxicity or contraindicated; actionable mutations treated with targeted therapy if present; Head and neck cancer (2L+): Progressed/relapsed or toxic after 1 platinum-based regimen; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 with progression/toxicity or contraindicated; Gastric/GEJ/esophageal: Progressed/relapsed or toxic after 1 platinum-based regimen; <=2 prior cytotoxic lines; HER2+ must have received HER2-directed therapy; prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 with progression/toxicity or contraindicated; All cohorts: Prior anti-cancer therapies completed >= 2 weeks before first dose
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match, and age/ECOG fit. However, the NSCLC cohorts require prior progression after at least one platinum-based regimen and prior PD-1/PD-L1 therapy (≤2 prior cytotoxic lines), which the patient lacks (only on osimertinib), making a line/prior-therapy mismatch; CNS stability is also unknown.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Metastatic non-small cell lung cancer; De novo metastatic disease; Bone metastases; Liver metastases; Brain metastases on MRI; EGFR exon 19 deletion; On osimertinib for 2 years; ECOG 0; No significant comorbidities
judge_comment: Disease and metastatic setting match, but the trial’s NSCLC cohorts require prior platinum-based chemotherapy and prior PD-1/PD-L1 therapy with progression/toxicity, which the patient lacks. That is a clear soft mismatch on the line/prior-exposure anchor, warranting D. No hard exclusions are definitively triggered; CNS stability is unknown, not an exclusion.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: Phase I/II First-in-Human Study of TT-10 (PORT-6), an Adenosine 2A Receptor Antagonist, and PORT-7, an Adenosine 2B Receptor Antagonist, as Single Agents and in Combination in Participants With Advanced Selected Solid Tumors
diseases_targeted: Castrate-Resistant Prostate Cancer; Colorectal Cancer; Endometrial Cancer; Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma; Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer; Ovarian Cancer; Renal Cell Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed advanced solid tumors per cohort definitions | RCC: locally advanced or metastatic with >=2 prior systemic regimens including VEGF-targeted therapy and checkpoint inhibitor therapy | CRPC: metastatic disease with prior second-generation hormonal agent and a taxane-based chemotherapy | SCCHN: advanced/metastatic, incurable by surgery or radiotherapy, progressed during/after platinum-based chemotherapy and/or checkpoint inhibitor therapy | NSCLC: metastatic, intolerant or resistant to standard therapy or no standard therapy available | CRC: metastatic, intolerant or resistant to standard therapy or no standard therapy available | Endometrial Cancer: metastatic, intolerant or resistant to standard therapy or no standard therapy available | Ovarian Cancer: metastatic, intolerant or resistant to standard therapy or no standard therapy available | ECOG 0–1 | Measurable disease per RECIST 1.1; CRPC may enroll with non-measurable disease if screening PSA >= 2.0 ng/mL with sponsor approval | Adequate hematologic, hepatic, and renal function | Consent to baseline biopsy or provision of recent archival tissue as specified | Able to swallow capsules
exclusion_criteria: Major surgery within 4 weeks prior to screening | Active CNS metastases; treated/stable off corticosteroids allowed; leptomeningeal metastases excluded | Prior radiotherapy within 2 weeks of start; 1-week washout permitted for palliative radiotherapy (<= 2 weeks) to non-CNS disease | Prior anti-cancer therapy within 4 weeks (2 weeks for short-acting TKIs); unresolved treatment-related toxicities > Grade 1 | HIV infection | HBsAg positive unless on antiviral therapy >= 4 weeks with undetectable HBV viral load; must remain on therapy per guidelines | History of HCV infection unless curatively treated with undetectable viral load at screening | Requires immunosuppressive therapy including systemic steroids >= 10 mg prednisone equivalent daily or other immunosuppressants/biologics | Requires strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4, CYP2C9, or CYP2C19 | Requires drugs that modify gastric pH (PPIs or H2 blockers); antacids allowed with dose separation | Ongoing systemic bacterial, fungal, or viral infection | Live vaccine within 6 weeks of first dose (mRNA COVID-19 vaccines permitted) | Baseline QTcF > 470 ms (average of triplicate) | Prior surgery or gastrointestinal dysfunction that may affect drug absorption (e.g., gastric bypass, gastrectomy) | Pregnant or breastfeeding | Concurrent active malignancy other than non-melanoma skin cancer, carcinoma in situ of the cervix, or prostate intraepithelial neoplasia | Past medical history of interstitial lung disease, drug-induced interstitial lung disease, or radiation pneumonitis requiring steroids; or clinically active interstitial lung disease | History of peptic ulcer or gastrointestinal bleed within 6 months | History of stroke, unstable angina, myocardial infarction, or ventricular arrhythmia requiring treatment within 6 months | Unstable or severe uncontrolled medical condition that increases study risk
prior_therapies: RCC: prior >= 2 systemic regimens including VEGF-targeted therapy and checkpoint inhibitor therapy; CRPC: prior second-generation hormonal therapy and taxane-based chemotherapy; SCCHN: prior platinum-based chemotherapy and/or checkpoint inhibitor with progression; NSCLC/CRC/Endometrial/Ovarian Cancer: intolerant or resistant to standard therapy or no standard therapy available; Washout from prior anti-cancer therapy >= 4 weeks (>= 2 weeks for short-acting TKIs) before start; Washout from radiotherapy >= 2 weeks (>= 1 week for short palliative courses <= 2 weeks)
reasoning: Disease and metastatic setting match, but the CRPC cohort requires prior taxane-based chemotherapy in addition to a second-generation hormonal agent. The patient has only received abiraterone/enzalutamide without a taxane, making a line-of-therapy mismatch and likely ineligibility.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male; Castration-resistant prostate cancer; Metastatic disease; PSMA PET avid disease; Liver metastases; Bone metastases; Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga); Prior leuprolide (Lupron)
judge_comment: No hard exclusions apply. Disease and metastatic setting match, but the CRPC cohort requires prior taxane chemotherapy, which the patient lacks per provided prior_therapies, creating a clear line-of-therapy soft mismatch. Thus D is appropriate.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase 1/2 Randomized, Umbrella Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of MK-2870 Plus Enfortumab Vedotin (EV) With and Without Pembrolizumab, as Treatment for Participants With Advanced Urothelial Carcinoma (KEYMAKER-U04): Substudy 04C
diseases_targeted: Locally Advanced Urothelial Carcinoma; Metastatic Urothelial Carcinoma
inclusion_criteria: Histologically documented locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma | Archival or newly obtained tumor tissue adequate for biomarker evaluation (prefer newly obtained if feasible) | Adverse events from prior anticancer therapy recovered to <= Grade 1 or baseline (endocrine AEs allowed if adequately treated) | Part 1: Prior platinum-based chemotherapy for la/mUC | Part 1: <= 2 prior lines of therapy for la/mUC (platinum-based chemotherapy followed by avelumab maintenance counts as 2 lines) | Part 2: No prior systemic therapy for la/mUC
exclusion_criteria: Additional malignancy that is progressing or required active treatment within the past 3 years | Active central nervous system metastases or carcinomatous meningitis | Peripheral neuropathy Grade >= 2 | History of severe dry eye syndrome, severe Meibomian gland disease, blepharitis, or corneal disease that prevents/delays corneal healing | Active inflammatory bowel disease requiring immunosuppressive medication or prior history of inflammatory bowel disease (e.g., Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, chronic diarrhea) | Uncontrolled significant cardiovascular or cerebrovascular disease, or serious cardiovascular/cerebrovascular events within 6 months | Active keratitis or corneal ulcerations (superficial punctate keratitis allowed if adequately treated) | History of uncontrolled diabetes | Received an investigational agent or used an investigational device within 4 weeks prior to study intervention | Received a live or live-attenuated vaccine within 30 days prior to first dose | Part 2: Diagnosis of immunodeficiency or receiving chronic systemic steroids or other immunosuppressive therapy within 7 days before first dose (inhaled/topical steroids permitted; physiologic replacement allowed for adrenal insufficiency) | Part 2: Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment in past 2 years except replacement therapy | Human immunodeficiency virus infection with history of Kaposi's sarcoma and/or Multicentric Castleman's Disease | Active hepatitis B or hepatitis C virus infection | History of noninfectious pneumonitis/interstitial lung disease that required steroids or current pneumonitis/interstitial lung disease | Active infection requiring systemic therapy | Part 2: History of allogeneic tissue/solid organ transplant | Not adequately recovered from major surgery or ongoing surgical complications
prior_therapies: Part 1: Prior platinum-based chemotherapy required for la/mUC; Part 1: <= 2 prior lines of therapy for la/mUC; Part 2: No prior systemic therapy for la/mUC
reasoning: Stage matches metastatic urothelial carcinoma, but Part 1 requires prior platinum-based chemotherapy specifically for locally advanced/metastatic disease (patient’s platinum was neoadjuvant only), and Part 2 requires no prior systemic therapy for la/mUC (patient has received EV+pembrolizumab).
patient_inclusion_criteria: Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial carcinoma; Progressing after second line therapy; Prior neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin (4 cycles); Prior enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab with progression after 6 cycles; Status post cystectomy with pathologic complete response; Age 55 years; Male; Chronic kidney disease with eGFR 35 mL/min; History of type 2 diabetes mellitus; History of COPD
patient_prior_therapies: Neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin; Cystectomy; Enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab
judge_comment: Stage matches mUC, but the patient’s prior therapy history does not fit either trial part: lacks prior platinum for la/mUC (Part 1) and has prior systemic therapy for la/mUC (disqualifies Part 2). This is a clear soft mismatch on the line/prior-exposure anchor, so D per rubric. No hard exclusion applies.

question_text: What are trial options for a 68-year-old male with a two-year history of progressive cognitive decline? His MMSE score is 19, consistent with moderate-stage dementia. An amyloid PET scan was performed and was negative. CSF analysis was also negative for amyloid plaques but showed elevated p-tau. His family is seeking disease-modifying therapies.
trial_title: A Phase 3, Open-label Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-term Safety and Tolerability of KarXT + KarX-EC for the Treatment of Agitation Associated With Alzheimer's Disease (ADAGIO-3)
inclusion_criteria: Completed study CN012-0023 or CN012-0024 per protocol | One identified caregiver with approximately 10 hours/week or more contact
exclusion_criteria: Clinically significant cardiovascular (e.g., untreated or unstable hypertension, clinically significant tachycardia), pulmonary, renal, hematologic, gastrointestinal, endocrine, immunologic, dermatologic, neurologic, or oncologic disease or any condition that could jeopardize participant safety or study validity in the investigator’s opinion
prior_therapies: (none)
reasoning: This is an open-label extension that only enrolls participants who completed CN012-0023 or CN012-0024, which is not documented for this patient, so prior-exposure requirements are likely not met. Age and sex fit, but AD-specific agitation and caregiver availability are not established.
patient_biomarkers: Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 68 years; Male; Progressive cognitive decline for 2 years; MMSE score 19; Moderate-stage dementia; Amyloid PET negative; CSF amyloid negative; Elevated CSF p-tau
judge_comment: Hard exclusion applies: trial targets Alzheimer’s disease (agitation) while the patient’s disease is listed only as Dementia, not AD. Per rubric, disease mismatch → F. The grader instead gave D based on unknown prior trial completion and agitation/caregiver status, which should be treated as unknowns, not soft mismatches.

question_text: 55 year old male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma, now progressing after second line therapy. Initially diagnosed with MIBC 3 years ago. He received neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin x 4 cycles and then cystectomy with pCR. 6 months later he presented with new bone metastases. Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial cancer. He was started on EV+pembrolizumab and after 6 cycles, scans showed worsening osseous mets and now new liver lesions. He has a hx of T2DM, COPD, and CKD with eGFR 35. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase II Study of Consolidative Local Therapy in Patients With Locally Advanced or Oligo-metastatic Urothelial Carcinoma (la/mUC) Following Treatment Response to Systemic Therapy With or Without Metastasis-directed Radiotherapy
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 18 years | ECOG performance status 0–1 | Surgical candidate for extirpative surgery of primary site with bilateral pelvic lymph node dissection and urinary diversion | If applicable, surgical candidate for resection of non-irradiated metastatic lesion(s) | Histologically confirmed urothelial carcinoma, locally advanced or oligo-metastatic (<= 5 distinct metastatic lesions) | Variant histology < 50% with urothelial carcinoma predominant | Received first-line enfortumab vedotin-based systemic therapy started >= 3 months prior to surgery and total treatment duration <= 6 months | Most recent restaging scan shows stable disease, partial response, or complete response by investigator-assessed RECIST v1.1
exclusion_criteria: Systemic anti-cancer therapy within 3 weeks prior to surgery | Radiotherapy within 2 weeks prior to surgery | Positive pregnancy test or breastfeeding | History of central nervous system or leptomeningeal metastases | Concurrent medical, surgical, or psychiatric condition that may confound study interpretation or prevent completion of study procedures | Any medical condition posing undue risk to participation per investigator judgment
prior_therapies: First-line enfortumab vedotin-based systemic therapy initiated >= 3 months before surgery; total duration <= 6 months; Metastasis-directed radiotherapy allowed
reasoning: The trial requires patients who have responded (SD/PR/CR) to first-line enfortumab vedotin–based therapy and are candidates for consolidative surgery of the primary site; this patient progressed on EV+pembrolizumab and has already had a cystectomy with progression after second-line therapy, mismatching the stage/setting and line/prior-therapy requirements.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Biopsy confirmed metastatic urothelial carcinoma; Progressing after second line therapy; Prior neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin (4 cycles); Prior enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab with progression after 6 cycles; Status post cystectomy with pathologic complete response; Age 55 years; Male; Chronic kidney disease with eGFR 35 mL/min; History of type 2 diabetes mellitus; History of COPD
patient_prior_therapies: Neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin; Cystectomy; Enfortumab vedotin plus pembrolizumab
judge_comment: Hard exclusions apply: the trial requires response (SD/PR/CR) to first-line enfortumab vedotin–based therapy and candidacy for consolidative extirpative surgery of the primary site. The patient progressed on EV+pembrolizumab and already had a cystectomy, definitively lacking required stage/setting criteria. Under the rubric, failing required stage/setting is a hard exclusion → F, not D.

question_text: What are trial options for a 66 year old male with hx hypertension, afib, T2DM and mCRPC, now progressing on enzalutamide? He has been on Lupron+Zytiga for 3 years, with new liver and bone metastases which are all PSMA PET avid. He’s tolerated therapy well overall except for grade 2 fatigue.
trial_title: A Phase II Neoadjuvant Trial of Sunitinib Malate (SU011248) Plus Hormonal Ablation for Patients Who Have High Risk Localized Prostate Cancer and Will Undergo Prostatectomy
inclusion_criteria: Histologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the prostate deemed resectable (ductal adenocarcinoma included). | Low anesthetic risk for radical prostatectomy and intent to undergo prostatectomy after neoadjuvant therapy. | High-risk disease: cT3 or Gleason 8–10, or cT2b–c with PSA >= 10 ng/mL and Gleason 7 (AJCC 1992). | ECOG performance status 0–1. | Adequate bone marrow, hepatic, and renal function.
exclusion_criteria: Small cell or sarcomatoid carcinoma of the prostate. | Clinical or radiological evidence of metastatic disease. | Receiving ketoconazole as prior hormonal therapy. | Prior chemotherapy or experimental agents for prostate cancer. | Active infection that could worsen or be affected by investigational therapy. | NYHA class III/IV heart failure, unstable angina, stroke/TIA, pulmonary embolism, or myocardial infarction within 6 months. | Uncontrolled severe hypertension (>= 140/90 despite medication). | Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus. | Oxygen-dependent lung disease. | Known chronic liver disease or HIV infection. | Second malignancy (excluding non-melanoma skin cancer) unless disease-free for 3 years. | Ongoing therapeutic-dose warfarin (low-dose <= 2 mg/day for DVT prophylaxis allowed); low molecular weight heparin allowed. | Overt psychosis, mental disability, incompetence to consent, or history of non-compliance.
prior_therapies: Prior hormonal therapy up to 2 months permitted.
reasoning: This neoadjuvant trial requires resectable high-risk localized prostate cancer and explicitly excludes any metastatic disease. The patient has metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer with liver and bone metastases, which directly violates the trial’s exclusion criteria.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 66 years; Male; Castration-resistant prostate cancer; Metastatic disease; PSMA PET avid disease; Liver metastases; Bone metastases; Progression on enzalutamide; Prior abiraterone (Zytiga); Prior leuprolide (Lupron)
judge_comment: Explicit exclusion: the trial excludes any metastatic disease, and the patient has metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer. This is a hard exclusion per rubric, so F is correct. The grader’s reasoning correctly identified this factor.

question_text: I have a 40 year old patient with non-smallcell lung cancer. Diagnosed de novo metastatic disease (bone, liver) with EGFR exon 19 deletion. He has been on Osimertinib for 2 years with complete response. Unfortunately, began having headaches and recent MRI shows numerous lesions. Otherwise no past medical issues and ECOG 0. Are there any trial options?
trial_title: A Phase III Randomized Trial of Lobectomy Versus Sublobar Resection for Small (≤ 2 cm) Peripheral Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
inclusion_criteria: Peripheral lung nodule <= 2 cm on preoperative CT located in the outer third of the lung | Tumor location suitable for either lobar or sublobar resection | ECOG 0–2 | Age >= 18 years | Histologic confirmation of non-small cell lung cancer | Pathologic N0 status by intraoperative frozen section with required nodal stations negative
exclusion_criteria: Pure ground glass opacity lesion | Pathologically confirmed N1 or N2 disease | Prior malignancy within 3 years other than non-melanoma skin cancer, superficial bladder cancer, or cervical carcinoma in situ | Prior chemotherapy or radiation therapy for this malignancy | Evidence of locally advanced or metastatic disease
prior_therapies: (none)
reasoning: The trial explicitly excludes patients with locally advanced or metastatic disease and requires resectable, node-negative NSCLC; the patient has de novo metastatic NSCLC with multiple metastases. This is a hard exclusion.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Age 40 years; Male; Metastatic non-small cell lung cancer; De novo metastatic disease; Bone metastases; Liver metastases; Brain metastases on MRI; EGFR exon 19 deletion; On osimertinib for 2 years; ECOG 0; No significant comorbidities
judge_comment: The trial explicitly excludes patients with evidence of locally advanced or metastatic disease; the patient has de novo metastatic NSCLC. This is a hard exclusion, so F is correct. The grader’s reasoning appropriately identified the exclusion.

question_text: 36 female with stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma, who initially received optimal debulking and adjuvant carboplatin+paclitaxel +bevacizumab. After 5 months, she had a new pleural effusion that was cytology positive for ovarian carcinoma. She was found to be BRCA1 positive. What are trial options?
trial_title: A Phase III Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial of Carboplatin and Paclitaxel (or Gemcitabine) Alone or in Combination With Bevacizumab (NSC #704865) Followed by Bevacizumab and Secondary Cytoreductive Surgery in Platinum-Sensitive, Recurrent Ovarian, Peritoneal Primary and Fallopian Tube Cancer. NCI-Supplied Agents: Bevacizumab (NSC #704865)
diseases_targeted: Ovarian Carcinoma (recurrent); Fallopian Tube Carcinoma (recurrent); Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma (recurrent)
inclusion_criteria: Candidate for cytoreductive surgery when applicable per protocol/randomization plan | Histologic epithelial ovarian, primary peritoneal, or fallopian tube carcinoma, recurrent | Eligible epithelial histologies include serous, endometrioid, mucinous, clear cell, transitional cell, undifferentiated, malignant Brenner tumor, mixed epithelial, or adenocarcinoma NOS | Complete response to front-line platinum-taxane therapy (>=3 cycles) | Treatment-free interval without progression >=6 months after completion of front-line chemotherapy (platinum and taxane) | Maintenance biologic or hormonal therapy allowed if recurrence >6 months and >=4 weeks since last biologic infusion | Clinically evident recurrent disease | Measurable disease per RECIST with at least one lesion: >=20 mm by conventional imaging/MRI/CT or >=10 mm by spiral CT | ANC >=1500/µL | Platelets >=100000/µL | Creatinine <=1.5 x ULN | Total bilirubin <=1.5 x ULN | AST <=2.5 x ULN | Alkaline phosphatase <=2.5 x ULN | Urine protein-to-creatinine ratio <1.0 mg/dL (if receiving bevacizumab) | ECOG 0–2
exclusion_criteria: More than one prior chemotherapy regimen (maintenance not counted as a separate regimen) | Concurrent immunotherapy or radiotherapy | Prior radiotherapy to any portion of the abdominal cavity or pelvis | Prior secondary cytoreductive surgery for recurrent disease | Requirement for parenteral hydration or nutrition with evidence of partial bowel obstruction or perforation | Prior chemotherapy for other abdominal or pelvic tumors (except ovarian, fallopian tube, primary peritoneal) | Synchronous or prior primary endometrial cancer unless all met: stage <= IB; no more than superficial myometrial invasion without vascular/lymphatic invasion; no poorly differentiated subtypes (papillary serous, clear cell, FIGO grade 3) | Uncontrolled infection | Severe uncontrolled comorbid medical conditions limiting compliance or increasing risk | Peripheral neuropathy >= grade 2 | History of hypersensitivity to carboplatin and/or paclitaxel unless successfully desensitized | Hypersensitivity to CHO cell products or other recombinant antibodies (applies to bevacizumab recipients) | Pregnant or breastfeeding; inadequate contraception | Other invasive malignancy within 5 years (except non-melanoma skin cancer) or prior cancer therapy contraindicating protocol therapy | Active bleeding or high-risk bleeding conditions/coagulopathy (applies to bevacizumab recipients) | CNS disease (including brain metastases), uncontrolled seizures, or stroke within 5 years (applies to bevacizumab recipients) | Significant cardiovascular disease, including conduction abnormalities (PR >0.24 s or 2nd/3rd-degree AV block), uncontrolled hypertension (systolic >150 mmHg or diastolic >90 mmHg), myocardial infarction/cardiac arrhythmia/unstable angina within 6 months, NYHA class >= II heart failure, serious arrhythmia requiring medication, peripheral vascular disease grade >= II, or cerebrovascular accident within 6 months (applies to bevacizumab recipients) | Major surgery, open biopsy, dental extractions/procedures resulting in open wound, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days before treatment; vascular access device placement or core biopsy within 7 days before treatment
prior_therapies: Complete response to front-line platinum-taxane therapy (>=3 cycles) required; Treatment-free interval >=6 months from completion of front-line platinum and taxane chemotherapy; Front-line therapy may have included bevacizumab; Maintenance cytotoxic chemotherapy must be discontinued >=6 months before documentation of recurrence; Maintenance biological or hormonal therapy allowed if recurrence >6 months and >=4 weeks since last biologic infusion
reasoning: Trial requires platinum-sensitive recurrent disease with a treatment-free interval ≥6 months after front-line platinum-taxane therapy; the patient recurred at 5 months post-adjuvant, a definitive mismatch with the required setting.
patient_inclusion_criteria: Stage III clear cell ovarian carcinoma; BRCA1 positive; Optimal debulking surgery performed; Received adjuvant carboplatin + paclitaxel + bevacizumab; Cytology-positive malignant pleural effusion at 5 months post-adjuvant
patient_prior_therapies: Carboplatin; Paclitaxel; Bevacizumab; Optimal debulking surgery
judge_comment: The trial explicitly requires platinum-sensitive recurrence (treatment-free interval ≥6 months post front-line platinum-taxane). The patient recurred at 5 months, definitively lacking the required setting. This is a hard exclusion per the rubric, so F is correct.

question_text: A 55-year-old female has severe, seropositive rheumatoid arthritis refractory to methotrexate and two prior biologic agents (adalimumab and tocilizumab). She has active disease with a DAS28 score of 5.5. Critically, she has a history of treated Hepatitis B (HBsAg negative, anti-HBc positive) and moderate chronic kidney disease with an eGFR of 45 mL/min/1.73m². What are trial options for her?

diseases_targeted: Osteoarthritis; Traumatic Arthritis; Avascular Necrosis; Hip Dysplasia; Rheumatoid Arthritis
inclusion_criteria: Age >= 21 years | Skeletally mature | Requires primary hip resurfacing due to osteoarthritis | Requires primary hip resurfacing due to traumatic arthritis | Requires primary hip resurfacing due to avascular necrosis | Requires primary hip resurfacing due to hip dysplasia | Requires primary hip resurfacing due to rheumatoid arthritis
exclusion_criteria: Active infection or sepsis | Vascular insufficiency severe enough to compromise implant stability or postoperative recovery | Muscular atrophy severe enough to compromise implant stability or postoperative recovery | Neuromuscular disease severe enough to compromise implant stability or postoperative recovery | Female of child-bearing age | Bone stock inadequate to support the device | Moderate to severe renal insufficiency | Known or suspected metal hypersensitivity | Immunosuppressed state (e.g., AIDS) or receiving high doses of corticosteroids | Psychological or neurological conditions precluding participation | Severely overweight
prior_therapies: (none)

patient_inclusion_criteria: Seropositive rheumatoid arthritis; Active disease with DAS28 score of 5.5; History of treated Hepatitis B (HBsAg negative, anti-HBc positive); Moderate chronic kidney disease (eGFR 45 mL/min/1.73 m^2)
patient_prior_therapies: Refractory to methotrexate; Prior adalimumab; Prior tocilizumab; Failed two prior biologic agents
judge_comment: Correct: The trial explicitly excludes patients with moderate to severe renal insufficiency, and the patient has moderate CKD (eGFR 45), which is a hard exclusion. The additional note about hip resurfacing need is unknown and not required for the F decision.

exclusion_criteria: Age >= 71 years | Pregnancy or plans to become pregnant within 1 year | HIV positive | Severe pulmonary dysfunction: DLCO < 60% or requires supplemental oxygen | Oxygen saturation < 92% on room air (if unable to perform PFTs) | Uncontrolled malignant arrhythmias | Congestive heart failure NYHA class III–IV | Left ventricular ejection fraction < 50% | Estimated GFR (creatinine or iothalamate clearance) < 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 | AST/ALT > 3 x ULN | Direct bilirubin > 2.5 mg/dL on two repeated tests | Active uncontrolled infection | Lack of compliance with prior medical care | Life expectancy limited by illness other than neurological condition | Evidence of myelodysplasia | Active malignancy (except localized basal or squamous cell skin cancer)

exclusion_criteria: Insufficient tumor pathology material (tumor block or 10 unstained slides) for required testing | Prior erlotinib or other EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor therapy | Prior VEGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor therapy | Prior MET tyrosine kinase inhibitor therapy or MET monoclonal antibody | Radiation therapy to thoracic cavity, abdomen, or pelvis within 3 months;
